story:
Two girls stranded in the middle of nowhere are forced to make a life changing decision after they run into an uncanny stranger. 


Who We Are

Leslie and I have collaborated previously on a short film (Pool Boy- 2013) while in college and have been eager to create yet another project. After a year of developing what once was just an idea, we finally put together a short film. With this project, we hope to showcase our acting as two strong-minded femme fatale's. We hope to get this short out to many film festivals in the near future! 
FILM REEL https://vimeo.com/116817950 

The Impact
It has always been important for me to showcase diversity in film. As Viola Davis stated in her riveting Emmy's acceptance speech "The only thing that separates [PEOPLE] of color from anyone else is opportunity. You can not win an Emmy for roles that are simply not there."

Ok, so maybe our goal isn't to win an Emmy (YET!), but we do want to take matters into our own hands and let people know we don't always have to play stereotypical roles. We are actors; we can play anything! :) Not only are we displaying diversity in race, but diversity in gender roles as well. Think Thelma and Louise, but darker. 

We have a super small cast, but great suspenseful story featuring Leslie Lluvet (Cuban-American), Al Marchesi (Puerto Rican-Colombian-Italian-American), and me, Tensaye (Ethiopian-American). 

Tensaye Yosef as DIANA http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4648074/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1

Leslie Lluvet as ALEX http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4609876/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1


Al Marchesi as TEDDY http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4294301/?ref_=nmmd_md_nm


We also have a very talented crew on board; Cinematographer/Director, Brian Andries, On set photographer, Ariel Flores, makeup by Venetia Wyman, a haunting score composed by Sa'eed Ali, costume design by Emily Reed Esparza, and many more TBA!

Risks & Challenges

It's hard to believe the amount of work and time it takes to film one scene, let alone a whole movie...So we're going to need a secure budget to meet all our needs to get this done! 

We need to be able to 

- Feed the crew (long filming day's call for good energizing meals) 

- Travel expenses/Motel (we're filming almost an hour away from home!)

- Purchase props (we can't mime anything - it'd turn into a comedy) 

- Car rental (pick-up truck in the film) 

- Post-production (sound design, editing, ect)

- Film festival submissions (we wan't this to be seen all over the world!) 


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? No worries! With the power of social media we have the ability to spread the word out to several other people - So please help us by simply SHARING the link to this indiegogo page!

story:
70 years ago, the Greatest Generation was barely more than kids. World War II affected everyone in the country, and despite years away and thousands of miles apart, their stories were told in the letters they sent and received from home.


Now, the Greatest Generation is our grandparents and great grandparents, and if we're really lucky, still with us. As lives moved on and families grew and spread out, the letters that told their story were often left in basements and attics across America, boxed up and forgotten.

We're Bob and Matt Massie, a Father-Son team and history gumshoes. We hunt down lost boxes of military memories in estate sales, antique stores, junk shops and auctions. Each box is a story and each piece within is a clue.  With as little to go on as an address from the 1940's, we'll unravel a story of life, death, love and loss. We track people across the forests of France and the islands of the Pacific.


Some trails go cold, ending at a grave marker on a foreign battlefield. Other stories take us back home to the United States where we navigate a generational maze of half-brothers, third cousins and great uncles.

The thing that makes this so rewarding for us, and the thing we most hope to share with you, is the incredible experience of finding the families and returning these memories, sometimes after 60 or 70 years apart.

Here's what one family member had to say after receiving our first phone call:


Help bring this celebration of military service and family to life as a TV series.  We’ll use the money from this campaign to create as many hour-long episodes as you will fund, starting with a two episode mini-series when we hit our base goal. Here’s our tentative season one lineup:
 

Our base goal is just a bit short of $180,000.  That will let us make a two episode mini-series with two, hour-long stories for a national audience. 



As we unlock stretch goals together, we’ll expand that mini-series into a full 10 episode season.  And with our ultimate stretch goal, we’ll build a robust “second screen” web experience you that you’ll have full access to our materials, our searches, our process and more.  Have Letters Home on your TV and Lettershome.com on your mobile device to get a double dose of great stories at the same time.



Here's a breakdown of how we'll spend our initial goal:

How do you know we'll use the money this way and actually complete the project?

Fair question.  Three answers:

1) We've put our money where our mouths are...we've been funding this all ourselves for over a year.  We can't take it to a national audience without your help.

2) We are both business people, having developed and run successful businesses.  We know how to manage money to make things happen.

3) As you can see from the great trailer, we have lined up the talent to bring this to life.  We have award winning, experienced people working with us to ensure we're on time, on budget, and delivering the quality you expect when you turn on your TV.




PERK  UPDATE:  Lobby Cards have been used to promote films in theater lobbies almost as long as there have been films.  Our version is 14" X 11," signed by Matt and Bob and addressed to you personally.  The new perk is $35.


The biggest THANK YOU we can give you is the satisfaction of knowing that you helped make Letters Home possible -- every time you watch an episode. But in addition to that great feeling, we have some cool perks to go along;




Tell your friends that you are helping make Letters Home.  Post the campaign on your social media, talk to your family about the "dusty old boxes" that are laying around your house, share your appreciation with that veteran in the family whose story you may not know much about.

Together, we'll inspire America to a new appreciation of the Greatest Generation and the unending treasure of family.

Thank you!

story:
To Hank and Chang Lee, it’s a seven-million-dollar opportunity. To George, it’s three hundred years of divine music. To the Butler, it’s the very mark of prestige itself.

To pretty much everyone else, it’s a violin.

A really, really, expensive violin.

For one night only, the insufferably wealthy George Willoughby has the Lipiński Stradivarius on lease from the St. Louis Art Museum. In celebration, he has opened his doors to an exclusive gathering of the social elite. However, unbeknownst to George, three nefarious guests with their eyes on the violin have been preparing for years, waiting for this opportunity.

It’s a night of impostors, sloppy pedants, and crab beignets. A night of a mysterious turtle disappearance and a suspicious Mongolian violin prodigy.

It’s the night of the Lipiński.


                                          

Last January, John brought Nate and Oliver a news story about a Stradivarius violin that had been stolen in Milwaukee. The thief had apparently stalked the violinist for nearly a decade, meticulously planning the theft.

Surprisingly, when push came to shove, the thief decided to just stun the violinist with a Taser he had purchased from his barber. Within eight days, he was in handcuffs.

As we delved deeper into the story, it quickly became apparent that the thief completely transcended the story of the actual theft. It was clearly his story to tell. So, we plucked him out of the news and threw him into our fiction, crafting our story around this fascinating character.

The Lipiński has proven such a natural fit for our team. As young filmmakers, we sympathize with its themes of self-image, of desiring respect, and of the need for control. The tale’s inherent absurdity spoke to our sense of humor. The story is even set in our hometown of St. Louis, lampooning and celebrating the culture we come from.

Click here to sign up for The Lipiński newsletter.


                            

We have taken every measure to keep our costs low. Thanks to the many talented people enthusiastically volunteering their time and resources, we are looking at a remarkably professional production for a fraction of the cost.

Every penny will go into one of six categories:

For a more specific budget breakdown, don't hesitate to shoot us an email.


                             

NATE TOWNSEND - CO-WRITER/DIRECTOR

Nate Townsend is a young award-winning filmmaker based in Los Angeles, California.  Born and raised in St. Louis, he moved to Los Angeles in 2010 to attend Loyola Marymount University, where he received a degree in Film Production.  As screenwriter and director his work has been recognized by such festivals as the Boston International Film Festival, LA Indie Film Festival, Moondance International Film Festival, St. Louis International Film Festival, and others.


JOHN HAYDEN - PRODUCER/"HANK"

Also playing the role of Hank, John Hayden (also known as Hayes) is an actor and producer based in Los Angeles.  After graduating with a Bachelor of Arts in Honors Economics at UT Austin, John set his sites on Los Angeles to pursue a career in the film industry. He is the Executive Producer of Goodnight Marilyn (2016) and Suspect. As an actor, he has appeared in Running With Fear, Beat The House, and Tabloid.


OLIVER REED - CO-WRITER/ASSOCIATE PRODUCER

Oliver Reed studied at Butler University in Indianapolis and St. Andrews University in Scotland. From Butler, he earned both a Bachelor of Arts in English with a concentration in Creative Writing, Cum Laude, and a Bachelor of Arts in Religion, Magna Cum Laude. After graduating in 2014, Oliver moved to Los Angeles to pursue a career in screenwriting. He has worked on the production sets of Project Runway All-Stars, The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills, Cold Justice, Katy Perry’s Prismatic World Tour, and more.


KYLE KRUPINSKI - DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY/AP


Kyle is a DP based in Los Angeles.  He made his start in the St. Louis production community, working on commercial and film projects for the major production companies there.  He has a passion for telling stories through visuals, using light and framing to create compelling events.  He and Director Nate Townsend have collaborated for over four years.


                                           

JACK KEHLER as OLIVER

Jack has appeared in over 60 feature films, including I Love You to Death, Forces of Nature and Men in Black II. One of his most memorable performances was in the film Love Liza as Denny, an energetic radio control hobbyist trying to help Philip Seymour Hoffman's character come to terms with the suicide of his wife. He also had a brief role in The Big Lebowski as The Dude's (Jeff Bridges) landlord.


SPENCER JONES as CHANG LEE

Currently a middle school student in St. Louis, “The Lipinski” is Spencer’s first short film.  He aspires to move to Los Angeles after high school to work in commercial and narrative production.


JACK MAHANEY as THE RANGER

Jack Mahaney first started acting just a few years ago, starring in Nate Townsend’s first short film The Painter.  He has since starred in several short films and commercials.  Based in St. Louis, Missouri, Jack is looking forward to eventually bringing his talent to feature films and Los Angeles-based productions.


                                           

We attribute this opportunity entirely to people like yourself who support and believe in us. Along with a great script and our wonderful team, we are thrilled about what we can show you with The Lipiński.

Click here to sign up for The Lipiński newsletter.

story:
My Story

One and a half years ago my life changed dramatically when I was introduced to personal development. Since then I have invested a lot of time and money into myself which enabled me to make the life I once dreamed of, my reality.     

               


Now I wish to devote all my time to giving back to people who feel 'stuck' or 'lost' in their life or who suffer from serious procrastination. I believe that everyone should have the right to learn how to live up to their full potential and have the opportunity to create an extraordinary life for themselves. Therefore, I have created a community where entrepreneurs can come together to learn about the power of personal development, and how it can be used to their advantage in both their personal and professional life. 

                            

Ultimately, this has brought me so much fulfillment that I cannot even begin to consider charging members for the valuable seminars and workshops which I provide. Unfortunately, it is due to this that I am now in need of a lot of help financially, which is why I turn to the support of the Indiegogo community.  


                               The Challenge

By the second of December 2015, all of my hard work could come crashing down as I cannot afford a $ 6,000 partner visa with the love of my life, who I was blessed enough to meet here in Australia. However, I know that with enough determination and hard work that anything is possible. So there is no way that I am going to give up my community or wonderful life that I have here with my beautiful partner, Emily. 
                                  



                                The Outcome

With your help I know that I can overcome this and continue to expand our community, eventually taking it globally so that everyone can grow and transform their life, regardless of where they live and without it costing thousands of dollars. 


So if you are in a position where you can help me in any way that you can, you will be helping not just me, but many other people to live life the way it was intended. However, I understand that not everyone can afford to give to others so I simply ask if you may share this campaign with someone you love in order to build more awareness. 

                                                     


Regardless of what you decide to do, I sincerely thank you for listening and being interested in helping another human being in need.

            Perks and Rewards

We have lots of great perks for our supporters. Most of these rewards will not be available after this crowdfunding campaign is over. Below is a quick summary. For all the details, check the column on the right.

story:
Synopsis
Bad Astrology is an independent short urban fantasy film that features strong female protagonists, action, horror, and some amusement.  It takes inspiration from the pop culture of the 1980s and series such as Buffy the Vampire Slayer.

Branwen, Cassidy, and Regan are members of the Paranormal Research and Containment Society - a small group of people who are sensitive to the magical veil that separates reality from the world of the supernatural.  They've taken it upon themselves to study this realm, and combat the eldritch horrors that break through.

Each woman brings their unique talents to the Society.  Branwen is a promising spellcaster, able to create spells and rituals to aid almost any situation.  Her sister Regan is gifted with psychic abilities and can weave magic from the Veil.  The newest member, Cassidy, excels at creating magical items and gadgets from spare parts, often jury-rigging devices on the fly.

Recently, reports surfaced describing unusual attacks against college students on campus.  During their investigation of the assaults, Regan is targeted by the demon responsible and falls into a deep coma, bringing her to the brink of death.

After regrouping in Cassidy's home, Branwen tends to Regan and begins searching for a cure while Cassidy takes it upon herself to go after the demon in order to slay it, despite her fear of the creature. 

It's only then that they find that Regan's attack was far from spontaneous, and now all their lives are in danger.

Bad Astrology was shot on location in Burlington, Vermont and Whitehall, New York over the course of the summer with a small, dedicated crew and passionate local talent.  It is fully shot and edited with a runtime of 31 minutes, and we are well into post-production.  It's the first of a trilogy of films centered around the three protagonists, with scripts in progress.

Here's why we need your help.
The whole project has been self-funded up until this point, with myself as the sole producer.  I'd like your help to finish post-production and make the film truly shine by giving it a fantastic musical score, sound effects and an appropriately-themed poster.  In addition, this campaign will help pay for any visual effects that I cannot create myself.

I have already contracted a composer to write the score for the film and create the sound effects.  He is Richard Gaynor, a composer located in Australia.  You can find examples of his work here.

To complete the package, I am trying to raise money to create an awesome poster that expresses the film in a unique way, using the glorious painted posters of the 1980s horror genre such as A Nightmare on Elm Street.  I have several artists who are interested in creating a poster, but it's a matter of raising the funds to pay for it and any addition promotional artwork involved.

All money raised will go towards these post-production goals.

What Your Money Will Go To
$600 is slated towards paying for the rest of the soundtrack.
$500 is slated towards the movie poster and promotional artwork.
$150 is slated towards effects packages and plugins from Video CoPilot.

What You Get Out Of This
Every campaign has unique rewards, and this is no exception.  This is more low-key and reliant upon digital media with personalized rewards, such as high-res copy of the poster with your name on it, behind-the-scenes material, your name in the credits, and Associate Producer credit.

Risks
The film is fully shot and edited, the only hurdle now is completing the post-production phase to make the film truly shine.  The project will reach completion regardless of if we get funds, but with your help we can release the finished product sooner, and with superior effects and artwork.

It might not be released if I'm abducted by aliens.  So that's a possibility.

How Else Can I Help?
Raising money is hard!  It's not for everyone, and not every project calls to your wallet to assist funding it.  However, I'd still love to have your support by spreading the campaign around and mentioning it your friends and those interested in supporting indie films.  Heck, even a message of encouragement means a lot!
story_txt:
SynopsisBad Astrology is an independent short urban fantasy film that features strong female protagonists, action, horror, and some amusement.  It takes inspiration from the pop culture of the 1980s and series such as Buffy the Vampire Slayer.Branwen, Cassidy, and Regan are members of the Paranormal Research and Containment Society - a small group of people who are sensitive to the magical veil that separates reality from the world of the supernatural.  They've taken it upon themselves to study this realm, and combat the eldritch horrors that break through.Each woman brings their unique talents to the Society.  Branwen is a promising spellcaster, able to create spells and rituals to aid almost any situation.  Her sister Regan is gifted with psychic abilities and can weave magic from the Veil.  The newest member, Cassidy, excels at creating magical items and gadgets from spare parts, often jury-rigging devices on the fly.Recently, reports surfaced describing unusual attacks against college students on campus.  During their investigation of the assaults, Regan is targeted by the demon responsible and falls into a deep coma, bringing her to the brink of death.After regrouping in Cassidy's home, Branwen tends to Regan and begins searching for a cure while Cassidy takes it upon herself to go after the demon in order to slay it, despite her fear of the creature.  It's only then that they find that Regan's attack was far from spontaneous, and now all their lives are in danger.Bad Astrology was shot on location in Burlington, Vermont and Whitehall, New York over the course of the summer with a small, dedicated crew and passionate local talent.  It is fully shot and edited with a runtime of 31 minutes, and we are well into post-production.  It's the first of a trilogy of films centered around the three protagonists, with scripts in progress.Here's why we need your help.The whole project has been self-funded up until this point, with myself as the sole producer.  I'd like your help to finish post-production and make the film truly shine by giving it a fantastic musical score, sound effects and an appropriately-themed poster.  In addition, this story:
WHAT IS 'RAISED ON BENEFITS'? 

'Raised On Benefits' is a new documentary that questions the impact of the media's representation of families on benefits. As the team are keen to explore these issues on their own terms we wish to proceed as independently as possible. As such the project is self-funded and this is why we're asking for your help.

WHAT'S THE STORY?

From Benefits Street to Prime Minister's Questions - the negative representation and scapegoating of people on benefits is a divisive and much discussed issue. As damaging as this mindset is to adults, what we're interested in looking at is the impact this has on children - as they have neither the critical faculties nor psychological strength to question these assertions for themselves.

In order to explore this we will be talking to successful people who were raised on benefits, experts in the field and will look to ask: -

- How difficult is it for a child on benefits to succeed? 

 - How can a child on benefits empower themselves in the current climate? - What are the barriers to success? 

- Why do some children on benefits succeed but others don’t? 

- How much influence do all the different factors in a child’s upbringing influence their future success?


The Impact

This project is valuable because we believe that an equal society is better for everyone. That it is the responsibility of the strongest to safeguard the weak. It is not enough for us to question the lack representation and bias in the media, in making a documentary about it we wish to contribute to the public discourse in a responsible and accessible manner.  

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

If you donate to our campaign your money will go towards vital costs such as Insurance and Licensing and post-production costs such as editing and distribution.

We have a number of unique perks from heartfelt thanks to seeing how we'll shoot the film, to an Executive Producer credit! If we don't reach our intended goal your money will be used for production rather than post-production costs. 


PEOPLE

Melissa Dunne (Director & Producer)

 A first time documentary film maker Melissa is known primarily as a writer and director for theatre. She has directed theatre projects focusing on social equality at the Southbank Centre as part of Women of the World Festival and 'Scenes from the Stephen Lawrence Enquiry' at the Houses of Parliament. She has appeared on BBC Radio 4's Woman's Hour and is a lecturer in playwriting at the Royal Central School of Speech and Drama. www.papercuttheatre.co.uk


Production Manager - Jennie Wightman 

Jennie previously worked for seven years in Production Management for various Documentary Production Companies, including the CBBC where she travelled to countries across Africa and Asia. This brought Jennie face to face with the suffering and inequalities experienced by many people in developing countries and inspired her to work towards redressing this through working with the charity Chain of Hope.


Director of Photography - James Stittle 

James Stittle (DOP/Camera Op) has 9 years of experience in film and television, working on numerous projects from Hollywood blockbusters to television documentaries. After studying film at Roehampton he began his career working as location scout for films and commercials. His real passion lay with cameras and after few years working hard to open doors he moved on to the camera department. Specialising mainly in documentary due to his passion for the medium, James has shot across the world on projects for TV and online. James often chooses to work on films that revolve around social or human issues; topics that are close to his heart and fuel for his love of documentary filmmaking.

http://www.papercutpictures.com/


Other Ways You Can Help

* Tell your friends!

* Use Indigogo share tools.

story:
Shepherds is a new media series that takes a glimpse into the world of psychedelic therapy, with the aim to open up dialogue on drug scheduling and the breakthroughs in psychedelic research that have been happening in recent years.

The plot centers on our two Shepherds, Madison and Luke, who come from very opposite starting points. After getting fired during her 7-year tenure at one of the leading big pharmaceutical companies for playing it safe, Madison moves back to her roots in Los Angeles to regroup. She reconnects with her longtime childhood friend Luke, a hippie who is living out of his van in Venice trying to hit it big with a mobile juice business. Both lost for very different reasons, they open up an underground psychedelic trial clinic after an interesting night of catching up, existentialism and…magic mushrooms.

                                         

To raise the funding we need in order to shoot the first season of this series.  Initially with this campaign, our goal is to at least raise $15,000 in 30 days to shoot the 1st and 2nd episodes.

If we exceed our goal, we can secure funds for remaining episodes in the first season and put money toward marketing costs to reach a bigger targeted audience. 

                                                         

Drug scheduling and cultural narratives have relegated our perception of psychedelics as substances that are dangerous, addictive and without any medical benefit. Psychedelics have been portrayed as the cause of mass murder and people riding rainbow unicorns into the sunset.  Personal accounts such as “LSD freaked me out," and "I thought I was going to die” have led to a narrow perspective of their uses. Some of our favorite stereotypical comments include: “I thought I was in a video game,” "I spoke to aliens," and “Timothy Leary was a nutball.”

We are ready to tell a different story of psychedelics: what goes beyond the exaggerated cliché of tripping balls or getting fried.


What many people don’t know about, including many of those who have used psychedelics, is what is happening in the world of psychedelic research, led by professionals steeped in experience and medical knowledge. Psychedelics are being used in a variety of ways as an alternative therapy for PTSD, end-of-life anxiety, severe headaches and other prominent mental and physical problems we’ve mostly been treating with traditional pharmaceuticals.  It’s only been in recent years that a few number of doors have been opened to find out what potential these drugs have.

A lot of people are surprised to learn that psychedelic studies are being done at Johns Hopkins, UCLA, NYU and other well-established institutes and there is excitement with what they are finding.

We are initiating the conversation in the way we know best: through storytelling and comedy. We hope to entertain and spark your curiosity in the movement. And we want you to take a trip with us.

story:
Nuestra Cuba tells the inspiring stories of Cuba's first women and Afrocuban film directors. In the years following the Cuban Revolution, the island would become a leader in the Latin American film movements to eradicate colonial ideologies that once controlled the region. Nuestra Cuba is a two part documentary series, directed by Amberly Alene Ellis, that reveals the role that black women film directors had in the development of a new Cuban cinema during two very different time periods in Cuban history. 

Sara Gomez Yera would become the first woman director in the Caribbean to direct a film at the Institute of Cuban Cinema (ICAIC). She would lead the institute in it’s courageous quest to create a truly unique and revolutionary cinema during the 1960s’ and 70s. Defying the challenges posed by her race and gender, the young filmmaker would utilize cinema for a powerful tool to critically access the new republic. At thirty years old, Gomez would die suddenly in the midst of her most respected work, De Cierta Manera. De Cierta Manera, or One Way or The Other, a feature length film that confronts issues of race, religion and gender roles in Cuba after the revolution.
Decades would pass before ICAIC would see another black or woman film director. In 1992, Director Gloria Rolando directed Oggun: An Eternal Presence, a film that tells the legend of Oggun and explores the roots of the presence of African deities in Cuba. In 1998 she would premiere "Eyes of the Rainbow", an intimate look at the life of Black Panther Assata Shakur, during her exile in Cuba. Though very different directors stylistically, both Gomez and Rolando have done extensive work on the documentation of Afro Cuban culture. Since 1959, Sara Gomez and Gloria Rolando have been the only AfroCuban women at ICAIC to direct film. Nuestra Cuba seeks to reclaim the importance of the lives and work of two women that dedicated so much to film history and to the idea that we can use cinema for social change.  

This story comes at a very important time in Cuban history. As Cuba is changing very rapidly, the possibility of the digitization of films that were almost impossible to share outside of Cuba, are now becoming available. It is important to preserve the work of those who have not been recognized as "great Cuban filmmakers", in the way that others have been recognized for their work.  In Cuba, director Gloria Rolando still struggles to find the support and funding to produce films that tell the stories of AfroCuban people. Although Sara Gomez was  first in many aspects, her work has been severely understudied in Cuba.  Less than half of her films are available to the general public.

The struggles that these women faced, and the art that they were able to create puts forth a way to see Cuba through new eyes.  Unfortunately, since their films have not been able to impact the majority of Cuban people, or viewers outside the country, your contribution to this project will help reclaim their legacy. Their stories are at risk of being lost if preservation and attention to their work does not happen immediately. Nuestra Cuba is our opportunity to reclaim the power of these film, and share the complexity, through their perspectives of the complexity of African heritage in Cuba. 

To start the filming of the first half of Nuestra Cuba we must film "Revolutionarily, Sara Gomez Yera", the story of Sara Gomez. In order to do this, Film For The People Productions must raise $10,000 to cover the costs of production. Your contributions will help cover several costs. Here are some examples of a few: 

  • Sound Equipment Costs 
  • Crew Day Rates
  • Post Production Editing Costs
  • 5D Marl iii DSLR Camera 
  • Press Permits 
  • Translation & Transcription 
The following is a further breakdown of what your contributions will look like: 

     

                                   

                            

Your contribution to the Nuestra Cuba documentary project will help to create  films that have the power to inspire women filmmakers around the world. The participation of women in the filmmaking industry in Cuba continues to be a major issue, even years after the passing of Sara Gomez. This film seeks to bring light to an issue that could possibly spark positive change in the filmmaking industry, and more support for Cuban filmmakers like Gloria Rolando, who have amazing stories to tell, but lack the means or support to do so. The Nuestra Cuba project documentary project hopes to eventually assist in the digitization, and preservation of all works of Sara Gomez and Gloria Rolando. Currently, the National Library in Havana, Cuba does not list the films of Gomez and Rolando. It is our hope that this film will call attention to the importance of their work and the need to preserve it. 


                                                     AMBERLY ALENE ELLIS, director 

                                                       JEREMY MINES, producer

                                                      ANISHA PAYNE, assistant director 

                                                              STEVEN BABOUN, publicist 

                                                          YILDIZ YILMAZ, associate producer

                                 DANIELA PEREZ, language translation & transcription 

Please join us in our crowdfund to tell the stories of these amazing and talented women. There are many ways that you can help. If you can't make a contribution at the moment, please help us spread the word to as many people as possible. You can learn more about Film For The People Productions on our website, or follow us on our Facebook or Instagram. You can also hashtag about our film using the tags #nuestracubafilm or #filmforthepeople Every way of spreading the word counts! Please see the links below! For more information, contact the director Amberly Alene Ellis directly at amberlyalene@gmail.com 
Website www.film4thepeople.com
Facebook https://www.facebook.com/film4thepeople
Instagram http://instagram.com/film4thepeople

story:
Get to Know the New You.

What if everything that made you feel like “you” was portable? You can already get someone else’s eyes, heart, liver — even face or arms. But how about a brand new body altogether? Like any major technological innovation, a full-body renewal would come with some serious ethical dilemmas and psychological challenges. How would your connection to your own life change? Would your decisions seem so important if you could try just something different the next go-round? If time weren’t fleeting, would your relationships with your friends and significant others seem so ... significant?

Enter Joel and Alice. Married for 50 years, they've shared almost every experience of their mutual lives. Then, Alice "renews," choosing to have her mind transplanted into a body fifty years younger. Joel is supposed to follow suit, giving them a chance to live another full life together. But a "complication" threatens to unhinge all their best laid plans ...

This is the story that we — a crew of Bay Area filmmakers — have put our hearts and souls into sharing with you. And we've already filmed it! Our incredible crew included Academy Award nominees and filmmakers with backgrounds working with Woody Allen, Kevin Smith, the Wachowskis, and even on the Star Wars sagas.

Now we're in the process of finishing the movie. It's the longest mile of the journey, and we could use your help.

Support us in making a moving film that will make people think about how we look at getting old and being young. It is a crucial subject, and San Francisco, 2016, is the perfect time and place to bring it to life. 

What We Need & What You Get

We're trying to raise $19,500 to finish this film. That might sound like a lot, but we want to do this film right. $19,500 is what it takes to commission an original score, license music, pay an editor, hire a colorist, do the sound mix, complete the special effects, master to tape, and submit to festivals. 

In return for helping us out with this project — in addition to our undying gratitude — we're offering some fun perks to make it worth while, like original props from the film, DVDs, shoutouts in the film's credits, and tickets to the premiere.

Our Impact

We believe in the power of speculative science fiction. Movies like Her, District 9, Soylent Green, and Gattaca all explored topics in technology, culture, and philosophy, and made us think about how we interact with each other and what the future holds. 

We believe that this film will contribute to that conversation.

Film takes community, and it takes support. It's expensive. It's time consuming. It takes a lot of talented people and a multitude of unimaginable details to make the world we created on the page become a reality. It's a kind of magic, really; a hard-earned magic. And we want more of it in the Bay Area. Help us build a community of artists, and makers, and work with us to develop a thriving local film scene here. 

Risks & Challenges

Sure, there's always that worry — what if they don't make the film? Well, we're too close not to make it. We've invested too much already not to see this through to the end. We just need your help to put those last essential touches on it — to make this film as impactful and arresting as it can be.

The team behind Youth has experience completing projects and seeing them on to success. We've already brought multiple films to life to great acclaim, such as SLOMO, which premiered on the New York Times op-docs and screened all over the globe. The screenplay for our next project was shortlisted for the Sundance Lab. We have no doubt that Youth will garner similar attention and accolades.

Other Ways You Can Help:

For those of you who can't spare funding, there are so many other ways to help if you believe in this project:

— Spread the word the old fashioned way: tell your friends, family, grandparents, great-grandparents, partners, lovers, dog walkers, favorite baristas, frenemies, casual acquaintances, everyone and anyone. Heck, tell a stranger. Start a conversation and make a new friend.

— Spread the word the new-fashioned way: share this post on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat, whatever new social media platform the kids are into these days. Like it, tweet it, poke it, snap it, heart it. Get it out there into the ether!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Get to Know the New You.

What if everything that made you feel like “you” was
portable? You can already get someone else’s eyes, heart, liver — even face or arms. But how about a brand new body altogether? Like any major technological
innovation, a full-body renewal would come with some serious ethical dilemmas and psychological challenges. How would your connection to your own
life change? Would your decisions seem so important if you could try just something different the next go-round? If time weren’t fleeting, would your relationships with your friends and significant others seem so ... significant?Enter Joel and Alice. Married for 50 years, they've shared almost every experience of their mutual lives. Then, Alice "renews," choosing to have her mind transplanted into a body fifty years younger. Joel is supposed to follow suit, giving them a chance to live another full life together. But a "complication" threatens to unhinge all their best laid plans ...This is the story that we — a crew of Bay Area filmmakers — have put our hearts and souls into sharing with you. And we've already filmed it! Our incredible crew included Academy Award nominees and filmmakers with backgrounds working with Woody Allen, Kevin Smith, the Wachowskis, and even on the Star Wars sagas.Now we're in the process of finishing the movie. It's the longest mile of the journey, and we could use your help.Support us in making a moving film that will make people think about how we look at getting old and being young. It is a crucial subject, and San Francisco, 2016, is the perfect time and place to bring it to life.

story:
Team Mystery Monks wishes you all Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!


Quick Facts 

  • Successfully accomplished more than 1000 video projects so far.
  • A platform that provides easy and transparent one on one interaction between clients & the professionals - One stop destination for all types of video demands - We offer the most simplified roadmap of video production.
  • Our work speaks 3 E’s - Evolved, Exceptional and Extraordinary.
  • Ensure our customers with quick turnaround, extremely low pricing and easy to order procedures.
  • Our service and product delivery matches international standards.
  • A revolution in the video production industry.
How Mystery Monks compares
About Project

Mystery Monks is a platform where companies, start-ups, entrepreneurs and individuals connect with creative professionals like video editors, animators, creative writers, voice artists, graphic designers, etc. who collaborate with each other and put together a video that you desire! We provide tools and technology to make collaborations easier than ever. We help in eliminating the barriers of finding video professionals, expensive video-making, delayed deadlines and tedious co-ordination amongst all as our process is exclusively tailor made for even a layman.

What are we going to do with the funds?

Currently, we’re using third party tools integrated with each other to keep the engine running and we’re accessible in only few parts of the world. We wish to change that. Hence, we need your help in finish building our own platform! 

Your contribution to our initiative will make our technology more scalable and our platform accessible to more customers and more professionals around the world.

How it Works? - Customers

At Mystery Monks, after receiving your order, a team of suitable professionals collaborate with each other and put together a video for you. The professionals who work with us are trained well before they are assigned with any project. This ensures no scope for doubt or dissatisfaction in the output of our work. 


How it Works? - Professionals

Mystery Monks is a host for talent and creativity. When you sign up with us, you’ll be trained with a series practice tests. After you’re well-versed with our work, we check your availability status, assign you with our projects and voila, your payment is completed with the approval of the customer.



Key features for Customers and Professionals

Our new platform will not only allow the customers to easily collaborate with verified professionals on video projects, but also create a transparent and seamless experience.  

Customers can share instant feedbacks with the help of intelligent and collaborative tools like group chats as well as take help of reference libraries to go through a project. 

At Mystery Monks, we practice smart on-boarding of our professionals who get to list their skill sets and interests. This ensures easy co-ordination based on the professional’s timelines and quality of work.

PERKS


Your contribution plays an essential role in making our campaign a success. Together let’s reform the video production industry, and deliver quality content at affordable prices.


Mystery Monks Work Exposé


$150

                               Dutch It                                                          Gulf Auto Traders

$250

                        Terraza Greens                                              Zook Blueeoth Speaker

$50

             Heartwork Tattoo Festival                                           Heal Your Heart

$35

              Kate - Heather Hart Studio                                Andrea's Birthday Video

$15

                      Walking Distance                                               SK Web Businesses 


Watch more on our YouTube channel

www.YouTube.com/MysteryMonks 
Customer Testimonials
Where did this project come from? 

We wanted to change how video production is done. To do that we kept two things in mind, low prices and high quality. Hence we created a platform where different professionals can collaborate with each other and work on a video as per customer’s requirement.
How you can support us 

You can tell about our campaign to your friends, people of our field and others who will benefit from our project. 

Share! Help us spread to the world via Facebook, Twitter & Google Plus.

story:
Short Summary

"Venture Falls" is a comedy that encompasses realistic events as it follows the lives of three teenagers as they begin work at a rundown pirate themed amusement park called Venture Falls. The show reflects what it's like having a day to day job that you don't necessarily enjoy, or really know why you still work there, but continue showing up because of the people you work with. We will be entering "Venture Falls" into Shoot Santa Fe, a film competition based in Santa Fe, New Mexico. Upon winning the competition, the winners will be given the opportunity to turn their teaser into a pilot with the possibility of getting picked up by a production company.



What We Need & What You Get

The money you donate will be used for costumes, props, transportation, food, equipment, and any other costs that may pop up along the way. Depending on the amount you donate, we will send you original "Venture Falls" memorabilia as a thank you for your generosity.

The Impact

"Venture Falls" is an old concept that is near and dear to our creator's heart and it is  finally being brought to life. Thanks to an incredibly dedicated cast and crew, who also see the potential in this project; production will soon be in full swing. Our hopes are that you will also see the potential in the project, and help us make it a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us by spreading the word, sharing our indiegogo link, and following us on Facebook.Thank you for all of your help and support! https://www.facebook.com/venturefalls

story:
Do you believe in Innovation?

Technology keeps advancing.  It is about time we make guns personal! And save lives in the process!   BUT WE NEED YOUR HELP!

Safe Gun Technology is committed to bringing fingerprint technology to the home defense gun.   Why?  As a parent and gun owner I want to know that I am doing everything possible to protect my family.   We are not building guns;we are building an after market accessory that you can have installed on the gun you already own!  

If you leave a gun unsecured in the home and have children in the home then this product is for you! Once installed only the owner can fire the gun.   He/She can also authorize other people as well.   Husband and wife can both be installed at the same time.  You can visit the range and enroll a friend to shoot recreationally. Afterwards, remove that friend's fingerprint.   Works for both left and right handed shooters.   Use a key to disable the fingerprint completely if the situation calls for it. 

Accidental child shootings may be at an all time low but it is still a problem.  As a parent and gun owner it is a source of anxiety for me.   Most gun owners tell me it is a source of anxiety for them as well.  Training and discipline are necessary but not sufficient.  If the gun is unsecured and there are kids around you should be anxious.

Suicide by gun is a real problem in America today.   It is a problem among teenagers and young adults.   Studies show these young folks are getting access (easy access) to their parents' guns.   Studies also show that impulsivity plays a large role with these young kids.  It doesn't matter how well trained or disciplined your child is in safe gun handling.  In these emotionally unstable situations the rules go out the window and access plays a large role.  

We don't want to get caught up in political debates that go nowhere and end up enraging both sides anyway.  We want to be part of a real solution.  Access to guns is a key piece of the problem and innovation plays a large role.   Personalized guns are not futuristic.  They are here to stay but we do not believe in mandates.  We believe in designing and building a safety feature that parents will want.  

We need your help making it happen.   Check out our videos to see our proof of concept (Remington 870 Shotgun) and now our latest user tested prototype (AR-15 rifle).   What makes us unique is that we are developing an after market accessory to professionally install on your gun.  That's right.  You don't have to buy a new gun to add this layer of security to a gun!  

It is not for all guns.   We are focused on the home defense gun.  That's the gun that is left unsecured in the home.  It is also the gun that we have found the most support for among gun owners.   We believe the free market will drive success.

We are not just asking you for money.  We are asking you to help create change!

What We Need

Goal: $40,000  to begin development of our next pre-production prototype.    Meeting this goal helps prove the market wants this type of innovation.

Stretch Goal: $200,000  to complete development of our next pre-production prototype and conduct internal testing!  This prototype improves the last version based on user feedback and gets us ready for external testing.   If we don't reach our goal the money still goes to development and we will continue to raise money (much more slowly) to get over the finish line.

Stretch x2 Goal:   $600,000 to take pre-production units to External Testing.  We will use the additional $400,000 from our stretch goal to build more pre-production units and send them to an Underwriter Laboratory for testing.   It is critical that we put this product thru rigorous testing to build confidence.  

Stretch x3 Goal:  $1,000,000.   Once we fund our external testing we will use any money beyond the $600,000 to expand this product to as many models guns as possible starting with Shotguns (Remington, Benelli, and Mossberg).  The more money we get the quicker we can expand to other models including handguns.  

All money beyond these stretch goals goes to development on handgun solutions.  

Product

We will begin offering the AR-15 after market accessory (name TBD; see perks).   From there we will expand to the Shotgun family (Remington, Benelli, Mossberg) and then stair step down to the handgun family (common to home defense).   The bulk of our solution will be common to most models.  However, each solution will have model specific elements.   Here are some highlights:

a.  Ambidextrous  fingerprint authentication: Left and right hand users supported

b.  System on/off key: Use a mechanical key to turn system on and off giving gun owner control of system.

Perks  

(If you don't like our perks send us a message and make a suggestion!)

We have learned that most people think personalized guns is a common sense solution that takes advantage of innovation.   We have even seen some hard core skeptics come around after they actually test our product.   We appreciate any amount you can give and we want to reward you appropriately and at the same time take advantage of your enthusiasm around our mission.  

  Bottomline:  We need your participation.   

Desktop Download:


Risks & Challenges

There are many risks within the development process including getting it done on time and on budget.  However, our primary risk is ensuring that the product performs to the gun owners highest expectations.   We believe fingerprint technology has advanced far enough but we have validate it in this application.  

If funded to our stretch goals we will begin production mid year 2016.   We want to highlight some key risks to this goal.  First, we must pass the gun owner validation and internal testing before we enter external testing.  If we do not pass these internal tests then we may experience delays while we fix specific issues.   Second, we must perform well in the external testing.   If we do not then we will experience longer delays.    

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute directly you can still help by engaging like minded friends who care about this issue today.   Get them to contribute.  Help build awareness that this technology is available and it is not far off in the future.  

IndieGoGo provides sharing tools to make it easier for you to spread the word.  

We will send out updates throughout the campaign.  Thank you again for your support!

story:
The project

"Union" is a short film about a far-flung family that reunites for what's supposed to be a joyous occasion. What unfolds will not leave you with that warm, fuzzy feeling. 

The deal

Production is already underway. But, to fully realize our vision, we are in need of some funds. For gear, facility rentals and wining/dining our lovely actors. Think of it like buying a movie ticket: you pay a couple bucks and you get a life-changing cinematic experience. 

Another way you can help is by showing up. We'll be shooting a wedding reception scene in early December that will require 20-50 extras. Our goal is to raise enough funds to throw a legit party feat. catered meal, open bar, live band, etc. If you live on the Front Range and this sounds like a fun time, keep eyes peeled for details. The more, the *marryer.*

The product

"Union" is set to premier in January 2016. Expect a high-class, red carpet screening here in Colorado and an internet-breaking online release everywhere else.

The crew

Couchfire Collective is an amorphous bloc of sleep-deprived romantics. Core members include Charley "Barles" Bayley, Nat "Nut Steen" Stein, Nick "Whiskey Nick" Morales and Malcolm "Doctor Hot Tub" Barnes. Here's some of our prior work: 
Red Meat 

dir. Charley Bayley, Dillon Tanner and Kendall Rock
Dear Frank

dir. Malcolm Barnes and Charlie Reynolds
COUCH LOCK pt. I

dir. Nut Steen
The Bite

dir. Nut Steen starring Whiskey Nick Morales

What unfolds will not leave you with that warm, fuzzy feeling.    The deal Production is already underway. But, to fully realize our vision, we are in need of some funds. For gear, facility rentals and wining/dining our lovely actors. Think of it like buying a movie ticket: you pay a couple bucks and you get a life-changing cinematic experience. 
Another way you can help is by showing up. We'll be shooting a wedding reception scene in early December that will require 20-50 extras. Our goal is to raise enough funds to throw a legit party feat. catered meal, open bar, live band, etc. If you live on the Front Range and this sounds like a fun time, keep eyes peeled for details. The more, the *marryer.*
    The product "Union" is set to premier in January 2016. Expect a high-class, red carpet screening here in Colorado and an internet-breaking online release everywhere else.

    The crew
Couchfire Collective is an amorphous bloc of sleep-deprived romantics. Core members include Charley "Barles" Bayley, Nat "Nut Steen" Stein, Nick "Whiskey Nick" Morales and Malcolm "Doctor Hot Tub" Barnes. Here's some of our prior work: 
Red Meat 



dir. Charley Bayley, Dillon Tanner and Kendall Rock
Dear Frank



dir. Malcolm Barnes and Charlie Reynolds
COUCH LOCK pt. I

dir. Nut Steen
The Bite

dir. Nut Steen starring Whiskey Nick Morales

story:
Asuka Lin is a student filmmaker currently majoring in film/video at CalArts. Although she is 18, she has already created a numerous amount of short films that have screened at film festivals in Seattle, Los Angeles, Oakland, San Francisco, Chicago, and even the European country Bulgaria! Her work mainly consist of short documentaries about specific groups of people who do not have a prominent voice in mainstream media in America, specifically Asian-American immigrants and in this case, the physically disabled.

Her mother is a friend of Hiroto Sugihara; a 20 year old Japanese man who is paralyzed from the waist down after suffering from a spinal cord injury playing rugby.

Recently he has attempted his first mountain climb at the famous Mount Fuiji, and succeeded on September 1st, 2015; after four years of physical rehabilitation and training. Thanks to the small but powerful team of the Sugihara Project, who were the ones that helped Sugihara increase his physical abilities throughout the years, Sugihara was able to achieve his long-awaited dream.

Throughout this past month Asuka and her mother has been in contact with the team, as the team filmed and sent them images and videos they have filmed of Sugihara's journey, including the training and mountain climbing. There has been a lot of footage collected to create this documentary via internet, but as the final step into finishing the production of this film, Asuka needs to fly to Japan from California, and film interviews with the Sugihara Project members in person.

The estimated plane tickets from LA to Tokyo is around $1800, so the asking price is $2000 on the campaign, resulting to the plane ticket to be paid for and the remaining money has the option to be spent on other needs such as food/shelter/misc.

No matter how little or how much, every cent will help to make this film a reality!

Photographs by Tsuyoshi Yamamoto

story:
This campaign has closed. However, since our initial goal was not met, please contribute via: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/celebrate-errol-barrow-day-through-film/x/12856490#/

We cannot complete this film without your help! 




       


ERIC HOLDER

Executive Producer and Film Narrator. Former U.S. Attorney General (grandparents hail from St. Joseph and St. Philip, Barbados) 


ADRIAN HOLMES 

In the role of Errol Barrow. Previously seen in WB/CW's Smallville, Bravo's #1 original series, 19-2, Frankie and Alice, Elysium and more. 



   

 ROBERT RILEY 

In the role of Jean Holder. Star of VH1's hit series Hit the Floor, The Bourne Legacy, and The Turtle. 



 

   LISA ARRINDELL ANDERSON 

In the role of Wife of Errol Barrow. Previously seen in Drumline: A New Beat, Tyler Perry's Madea's Family Reunion, Spike Lee's Clockers 


                                                                           

  LISA SIMONE

         Interviewee, Daughter of Nina Simone. 


       AND MORE TO COME!!





Barrow: Freedom Fighter will bring to life the challenges, accomplishments and experiences of an accomplished statesman. In partnership with the Barbados Ministry of Culture, Sports & Youth, the Caribbean Broadcasting Corporation, the Barbados Museum, and the Barbados Government Information Services, the crew has just finished Phase I of pre-production and we need your help to continue filming! Proceeds from the film's screenings will be used to restore Barrow's historical home in St. Lucy, Barbados. 


                                        

           


SBS Productions is strongly committed to developing the talent of Barbados. Contributions will also help facilitate the following outreach efforts: 

  • SBS On-Set Apprenticeship Program: We will host 30 young persons for mentoring and training programs both during and after production.  Participants gain invaluable hands-on experience in various departments of film production. We also invite primary and secondary school students to participate in on-set tours. 
  • Study Guides & Workbooks: With the help of experienced educators, we will pair study guides and workbooks alongside the film. By doing so, Guidance Counselors and English teachers across the Caribbean region can teach our history in exciting, new formats. 
  • SBS Film and Acting Workshops: Following production, we will host additional trainings for the local community on topics such as camera operations, programming, lighting and editing. Our all-star cast will also conduct acting workshops on-location. 
  • VIP Cinema Screening for Primary and Secondary Schools: Since 2008, SBS has partnered with the Ministry of Education to invite all primary and secondary schoolchildren for a special viewing at the local cinema. We look forward to hosting them again in 2016!


Step-by-Step Productions (SBS) is a Barbadian production company founded by husband and wife team, Dave and Marcia Weekes. With over 13 years of experience, SBS has produced six-feature length films and television series on socially-relevant topics - Hush, Hush 2, Hush 3, Chrissy! and Vigilante-The Crossing. Charged with a mission to develop wholesome, uplifting and impactful moral avenues for artistic expression, SBS is excited to celebrate Barbados' 50th year of independence by producing the first-ever docudrama of the island's national hero, it's first Prime Minister, Rt. Hon. Errol Walton Barrow.


Barrow: Freedom Fighter will be the company's sixth feature-film. Since 2013, SBS has been a leading production-house and has achieved international recognition. Vigilante-The Crossing  was the first Barbadian-produced film to be screened at the Cannes Film Festival in Cannes, France (2015), one of the most exclusive and premiere film events in the industry. Vigilante-The Crossing has now secured worldwide distribution through California Pictures. SBS has received numerous awards for their work, including the 2010 UNICEF Award, 2009 Atlanta Kingdomwood People's Choice Award, the 2013 NIFCA Gold Award, and the 2013 Barbados Manufacturers Award, just to name a few.

story:
INTRODUCTION

"As a society it is our responsibility to evolve beyond hurting and killing each other"...instructor, Ron Barton, points out to students in his Victim Impact Class.  He began volunteering to teach the monthly class as a way to positively channel his grief over the loss of his daughter.  Mr. Barton embodies the idea of "compassionate community" that is so urgently necessary in today's world too often filled with blame and hate.  His work has inspired my own desire to "give back" through art.  

My name is Karen Criswell, (Producer/Director) of Koncept Films.  In 2014, I resigned my position as Vice President of Operations for Dreamworks Studios to pursue documentary filmmaking as it was apparent that there were many critical stories that needed to be shared with a larger audience.  SHIFT FORWARD:  Re-Defining Life After Loss, is the first feature documentary project to be launched under KONCEPT FILMS, to further that goal of shifting negative societal attitudes towards a more positive conversation.   

SHIFT FORWARD: Re-Defining Life After Loss, focuses on the story of an unlikely partnership between two men who, by example, are helping reshape how we react to and cope with loss and regret.

The partnership between Ron Barton, community leader, and Richard Bryant, prison inmate, has a profound impact on all who hear their story.  

In October 2001, Richard was on his way home from a company sponsored golf tournament to help his wife celebrate the raise she just received when he crashed into a car that careened into a concrete divide.  That crash took the lives of Ron Barton's 4-yr. old daughter, Riannah, and her maternal grandmother.  Richard was "over the limit", speeding, and on the phone when the crash occurred, making this tragic event, entirely preventable.  

As part of his healing process, Ron Barton took the grief that he was experiencing, and poured it back into the community by volunteering to help others. In so doing, he included in that circle, Richard Bryant, the man responsible for his daughter's death.  Richard had written to the family four years into his prison sentence, and Ron was the only one willing to read that letter.  He did so, because in sharing both Richard's and his personal experiences, he knew he was having a greater impact on the students of his Victim Impact Classes who have all, already, been convicted of at least one DUI.  

SHIFT FORWARD is an extraordinary story that can have a positive impact on the way our society deals with issues of drinking and driving.  Not just because of Ron Barton's amazing humanity, but because by sharing Ron and Richard's story with others, we stand a great chance of saving countless others from experiencing a similar tragic outcome.  The SHIFT FORWARD production team is committed to assisting Ron and Richard in their goal to reach the broadest audience possible by nurturing alliances with community groups, non-profit organizations, and educational institutions who can utilize the finished film to promote awareness.  

Please help us SHIFT FORWARD the conversation around driving under the influence, and significantly reduce preventable DUI fatalities with the hope of one day eliminating them altogether! 

With your help we can make a difference!!   

YOUR DONATIONS & THEIR IMPACT! 

Currently, KONCEPT FILMS and it's affiliates have personally financed and completed 60% of the filming.  

We need to raise an additional $18,000 to complete the project:  

  • $9,500 to obtain the necessary insurance, crew, and permitting to film Richard's interview in the Oklahoma Department of Corrections.
  • $8,500 to hire a finish editor, and composer to see the project through Post Production.  

TAX DEDUCTIBLE DONATION

Your donation is tax deductible! SHIFT FORWARD: Re-Defining Life After Loss is a fiscally sponsored project of the International Documentary Association (IDA), a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. Contributions on behalf of SHIFT FORWARD: Re-Defining Life After Loss are payable to IDA and are tax deductible less the value of any goods or services received, as allowed by law. The value of goods and services being offered is noted under each donation level. If you would like to deduct the entire donation you have the option to simply decline the reward at check out. 

We can complete the project with your help!  The first few days of our INDIEGOGO campaign are critical to the timeliness of our success.  

The subject matter of the SHIFT FORWARD documentary, is both compelling and time sensitive.  As Mr. Barton so eloquently states in his class...."every single one of the deaths caused by driving under the influence is preventable; every person jailed for causing these accidents is capable of retaining their freedom".  We just need to shift our collective societal attitude toward drinking and driving. 

CHALLENGES:  

Raising money for documentary film projects has never been more difficult or more competitive.  We, on the SHIFT FORWARD Team, respect the value of your dollar, and know that there are many options for you in this season of giving.  

Donating to SHIFT FORWARD is a way to make a valuable difference in the conversation around drinking and driving; in the number of victims of preventable crime, and the prison sentences of ordinary citizens who did not wake up with criminal intent.  Your support in getting this important story to the screen will, literally, change thousands of lives.  

As Mr. Barton tells his students..."This isn't all about me.  Richard is part of the deal, too.  More importantly, by us bringing you this information it makes it all about all of us".  

With the support of alliances that Koncept Films and the SHIFT FORWARD Team are nurturing with organizations like M.A.D.D., GIVE A BEAT, The Advot Project, and others who wish to change the conversation and find solutions for preventable crime, we will bridge a gap that is currently being felt with organizations who need impactful visual media to enhance their message.  The completed film project will be available for community screenings, organizational awareness efforts, corporate employee relations seminars, and high school/college student events in which promoting a conversation of change to our societal views on drinking and driving is a priority.  

WE NEED YOU; NOT JUST YOUR $$$!  

Please donate if you can, but if you cannot, please become an advocate!  

Here are a few simple ways, in which you can support SHIFT FORWARD that won't cost you a dime!  

  • SHARE on Social Media; our posts, our website; our campaign link (http://igg.me/at/shftFWDdoc), etc. at least 1-2x/week during the campaign
  • RE-POST our hashtags:  #ShiftFWD #Push4Change #CrashPrevention #EducateDUI #NoMoreVictims every other day or so, joining other related conversations about DUI education and prevention
  • ADVOCATE for change; online, at parties, at company sponsored events, and anywhere that alcohol is served/consumed
  • COMMIT to being a designated driver for your friends this holiday season, and tell them why...because you want to SHIFT FORWARD!!  

Help us change the world, one conversation, one film, one movement at a time!! 

Thank you!!  

The SHIFT FORWARD Team!!!

story:
Our Project

Kensington Market: The FIRST 150 Years  is a feature documentary that will tell the 150 year story of Toronto’s Kensington Market.  Its the story of the many lives of the market village, as its grown and been re-envisioned through the decades.

We will share  stories of the generations who have lived here in the past, those that live here today and explore the forces that are impacting the Market’s future.

Kensington Market has long been one of the most unique neighbourhoods in Toronto, in Canada, and in fact – the world.  Over the years, this six-block market in Toronto’s downtown core has been a harbour of safety for new immigrants to Canada from Jewish, Portuguese, Caribbean, Eastern European and Asian communities.  For many, Kensington is the first step in their journey to Canada.

Today, Kensington is a delightful, colourful alternative to the skyscraper-draped metropolis that is growing up around it. Despite its numerous incarnations, the market manages to hold onto its uniquely eclectic charm and free-spirited nature, but, as always, the times are changing.

We are inspired to make this film now, as the market is in the crossroads between what it has been and what it will become.  Every month, a heritage business leaves the market. Some of the oldest members of the community are passing on and now is the time to capture their stories so we can share them into the future.  And its an amazingly rich story, from all over the globe, a story of community and creativity.

The newest arrivals in the neighbourhood are not arriving with a single suitcase - but come in construction cranes and high-rise condo towers.  The market is again facing a state of change and who knows where it will take it. We want to capture the personality and colour of the Market now as we know it and love it, and share some of the magic for the whole community to share and cherish. 

The film includes interviews, archival material, community activities and events. Most of all, it will include the people, arts and personalities of Kensington Market. 


The Impact

Kensington Market: The First 150 Years will knit together many unique and heartfelt journeys.  We will meet the people of the market, and illuminate the vibrant roots of this neighbourhood, and this city at large.  The story of Kensington mirrors the story of Canada.  We will share it with audiences and students in Toronto and across Canada.  

This project is more than just a film – we hope it also becomes a digital movement. The twenty-first century documentary is a platform for connecting people and engaging them in conversation and dialogue.  It is an online community.  We’re telling the story of the market, but we also want the community to share their stories and impressions of Kensington.  

Neighbourhoods are built on the people who live within them and the whole city has had a deep love affair with Kensington.  There’s no guarantee that the market we know today will be around forever.  This film will act as a digital archive for the rich history of our market and our city. 

It’s going to start a conversation about what has made Kensington special, beloved - and what we will choose to protect & cherish as the city mushrooms up around it.

Project Needs and How You Can Help

Raising our fundraising goal of $12,000 will allow us to invest in shooting interviews and events.  Costs include renting equipment and paying modest production crew fees for shooting days.  Your sponsorship helps us pay for the first phase of the film’s production.  Funds will also cover archival research and image capture so we can bring to life images that span over 150 years of Market history.

This phase of fundraising will go a long way towards ensuring this documentary will complete production and allow us to show future funders material to secure post production resources.

In addition to financial support, we also invite you to join us in other ways.

If you have roots in the market, or a special tie to it that you think is worth sharing, we’d love to hear your story.  We are looking for archival film, video and photos, video and other materials that show the different eras of the market.  Please email us at Kensington150@gmail.com 

We want this project to be the best it can be. We want it to be something the community can truly be proud of and connect to – but we can’t do it alone.

Every dollar you provide brings us closer to completing the film and helping us share it for generations to come. We’re grateful for all support and any help is greatly welcomed and appreciated.  Please check out our perks to see the Kensington inspired gifts we’ve set aside for you.

Thank you fellow Kensington supporters!  We look forward to sharing our stories of Kensington with you soon!

From the folks at The Mission Media Company

Stuart Clarfield, Director & Producer
Madelaine Sawyers McKechnie, Production Manager                                                   Steven McDonnell DP                                                                                                               Joshua Henderson Special Assignment DP                                                                           Sean Singh Sound Recordist & Designer                                                                            Laura Fry, Social Media & Campaign Manager
