forces that are impacting the Market’s future.
Kensington Market has long been one of the
most unique neighbourhoods in Toronto, in Canada, and in fact – the world.  Over the years, this six-block market in
Toronto’s downtown core has been a harbour of safety for new immigrants to
Canada from Jewish, Portuguese, Caribbean, Eastern European and Asian
communities.  For many, Kensington is the first step in their journey to Canada.
Today, Kensington is a delightful,
colourful alternative to the skyscraper-draped metropolis that is growing up
around it. Despite its numerous incarnations, the market manages to hold onto
its uniquely eclectic charm and free-spirited nature, but, as always, the
times are changing.
We are inspired to make this film now, as
the market is in the crossroads between what it has been and what it will
become.  Every month, a heritage
business leaves the market. Some of the oldest members of the community are passing on and now is the time to capture their stories so we can share them into the future.  And its an amazingly rich story, from all over the globe, a story of community and creativity.The newest arrivals in the
neighbourhood are not arriving with a single suitcase - but come in construction
cranes and high-rise condo towers.  The market is again facing a state of change and who knows where it will take it. We
want to capture the personality and colour of the Market now as we know it and love
it, and share some of the magic for the whole community to share and cherish. 
The film includes interviews, archival
material, community activities and events. Most of all, it will include the people, arts and
personalities of Kensington Market. 
The Impact
Kensington Market: The First 150 Years will knit together many unique and heartfelt journeys.  We will meet the people of the market, and illuminate the vibrant roots of this
neighbourhood, and this city at large. 
The story of Kensington mirrors the story of Canada.  We will share it with audiences and students
in Toronto and across Canada.  
This project is more than just a film – we
hope it also becomes a digital movement. The twenty-first century documentary is a platform for connecting people and engaging them in conversation and dialogue.  It is an online community.  We’re telling the story of
the market, but we also want the community to share their stories and
impressions of Kensington.  Neighbourhoods
are built on the people who live within them and the whole city has had a deep
love affair with Kensington.  There’s no guarantee that the market we know today will be around forever.  This
film will act as a digital archive for the rich history of our market and our
city. It’s
going to start a conversation about what has made Kensington special, beloved -
and what we will choose to protect & cherish as the city mushrooms up around
it.
Project Needs and How You Can Help
Raising our fundraising goal of $12,000 will
allow us to invest in shooting interviews and events.  Costs include renting equipment and paying modest production crew fees for shooting days.  Your sponsorship helps us pay for the first phase
of the film’s production.  Funds will also cover archival research and image
capture so we can bring to life images that span over 150 years of Market
history. 
This phase of fundraising
will go a long way towards ensuring this documentary will complete production
and allow us to show future funders material to secure post production
resources.
In addition to financial support, we also
invite you to join us in other ways. 
If you have roots in the market, or a
special tie to it that you think is worth sharing, we’d love to hear your
story.  We are looking for archival film,
video and photos, video and other materials that show the different eras of the
market.  Please email us at
Kensington150@gmail.com 
We want this project to be the best it can
be. We want it to be something the community can truly be proud of and connect
to – but we can’t do it alone. 
Every dollar you provide brings us closer to completing the film and helping us share it for generations to come. We’re
grateful for all support and any help is greatly welcomed and appreciated.  Please check out our perks to see the Kensington inspired gifts we’ve set aside for you. 
Thank you fellow Kensington supporters!  We look forward to sharing our stories of
Kensington with you soon!
From the folks at The Mission Media Company

Stuart Clarfield, Director & ProducerMadelaine Sawyers McKechnie, Production Manager                                                   Steven McDonnell DP                                                                                                               Joshua Henderson Special Assignment DP                                                                           Sean Singh Sound Recordist & Designer                                                                            Laura Fry, Social Media & Campaign Manager

story:
IS A FANTASY-DRAMA SHORT FILM ABOUT A STORY OF HOPE AND LOVE.

Set in the early 2000s, the story centers around Elora, a beautiful 7-year old African-American girl that has a fascination with space. She wants to be an astronaut when she grows but there's one problem: her parents. Her dad and mom fight everyday, completely ignoring Elora. Nya, her teddy bear, has been her best friend and soon the two embark on a journey in outer space that forever changes the course of history. 





These are stills from films that show you the type of visual style and color we are going for:


is a special teddy bear that finds a way to restore happiness in a broken home.



Here are some sketches that give you an idea of the visual look of our project. Big thanks to our concept artist, Christopher Brown!

http://www.cbillustration.com




Marley Battle ( as Elora) 

Marley stars as our beautiful little astronaut that has a love for science and exploration. She sees light "differently" from most kids her age and travels space with Nya to escape the harsh realities of her home.

https://www.instagram.com/marley_the_natural/?h...





Yakini Horn (as Ebony) 

Yakini has a close relationship with her daughter, Elora but often times she is caught up in her own past regrets that she often overlooks her daughter's ambitions as an astronaut. She deeply loves her husband and though she is aware of his secret infidelities, she still loves him..

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4414128/





Walter Colson (as Jamaal) 

Walter often struggles with loving his family and reliving his glory days as a single man. He cares about his wife and daughter but often times his own selfishness gets in the way. He soon learns that his daughter is more special to him than he realizes.

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2116917/?ref_=fn_al_...



1. If funded, were will my donation go?



2. What makes Nya so different from other short films on Indie Gogo?

Nya comes from a place of personal experience as a father and husband. The character Jamaal is not a direct reflection of me, but small elements such as the need to have a voice in a busy world can be challenging?


3. Where did the idea come from?

It came from my three year old daughter, Tatianna. Her energy was enough to ignite my pen to begin the process.

4. What do you plan to do wit the film once it gets filmed in June?

Once the film has been edited, color graded and sound design completed, we will have a private screening for cast and crew and submit Nya to as many film festivals as possible, from Sundance to Savannah Film Festivals to Cannes. I believe this is a film worthy of many awards.

5.What's in it for your donors?

We have various rewards based on Indie Gogo page. We hope our community can feel accomplished in helping launch the beginning careers of young passionate filmmakers right here in Savannah, Georgia.

6.What's the closest film that Nya would come close to looking similar to?

I have always been a fan of science fiction so I would say Super 8, Anomaly and The Sixth Sense are several films. Anything from Steven Spielburg would be on top of that list. 

7.Why is the budget so expensive?

Film making costs money! If you want a phenomenal creation, you have to make a sacrifice. 


8. What exactly is the visual effects budget being used for?

When you create a film that has any kind of visual effects, such as flying ships, planets that rotate or place an actor in front of a green screen and change a background, you have to spend money on rendering. This requires a render farm. A render farm is a data storage that allows you to transfer information in a way that will allow large files created in an VFX program to mesh well with your live action film. 

9.What is the moral theme of the story?

Love requires sacrifice. Elora becomes elusive through the help of Nya in order to "wake" her parents up and awaken them from their individual selfishness.

10. What do you want your audience to walk away from if your vision comes to life?

I hope my audience can walk away fulfilled and enthralled at the same time. It is rare to see a fantasy or science fiction drama film casted with African-american actors that display real emotion and depth. I try to stay from cliche characters. 

11. Why were you rolling your eyes in your campaign video?

I was very tired! I work three jobs plus I have a marriage, two girls and a newborn on the way this July! I am passionate about life and film so if I look uninterested in the video, please forgive me!

Alejandra Membreno

Producer


Niko Seabrook

Line Producer


Wilson Randall, Jr. 

Writer/Director



Jack Foley

Cinematographer


Jeff Bloch

Visual Effects Producer


Nicole Ascona

Visual Effects Supervisor



Nina Christine Di Salvo

Production Designer




needs the help of a community of individuals that are willing to donate to a project that has can make a huge impact in the film industry. 



One of the most difficult challenges we will face is combining live action and visual effects that will look seamless to our audience. Every aspect of production will be important to making our script come to life: production design, costume design, sound design and music, wardrobe and makeup, locations and even color grading.
 There are very talented hardworking people involved that have a tremendous amount of skill & expertise and desire to see an amazing film. However, we are aware it takes a community of donors to make that vision a reality. If give the the opportunity to raise the money needed to create Nya, we will insure you that every dollar we receive will be put to use.



* All movie downloads will have a water mark until the project has been submitted and completely cleared by the film festivals we entered them in.
**The type of travel arrangements will be provided according the most affordable and safest form of transportation and hotel. 
***Donor must list food preferences and allergies prior to any reservations made by the producer.

story:
What is "The Miscarriage of Justice" Project?

In late 2014, I read an article about a gentleman by the name of Kirk Odom. I was absolutely floored as I read it. The story, though it was one that spoke of a dark and flawed American Justice system, was one of victory: how one man, even in times of hopelessness, came out a survivor. This prompted me to further research the issue of Wrongful Convictions among minorities within the US; the results were alarming, many of which I was unaware. Through this film, we expose the agenda and lack of due processes used in most wrongful conviction cases, and shed light on agencies and organizations committed to getting such cases reopened for the chance of exoneration. The untold stories of these men who have been displaced and robbed of their livelihoods, families and futures should not be silenced by those who have disregarded them as just another statistic.

Documentary Synopsis

The Miscarriage of Justice Project is a gritty documentary that spotlights the cover-ups and hidden truths behind our nation’s 63% minority conviction rate through background details, interviews, expert analysis, and associated facts related to the cases of several victims of wrongful convictions; some freed while others still incarcerated. The subjects featured in this film demonstrate victory, triumph and moments of hopelessness all while still fighting for their freedom, adjusting to life after exoneration and giving hope to others in similar circumstances. Miscarriage of Justice gives you a firsthand look into the grey area of the justice system through the use of statistics and interviews, told through the eyes of several distinct cases:

 

Kirk Odom: Whose case received national attention for his 2012 DNA Exoneration, after serving 22 years in prison and 9 years paroled as a registered sex offender, for a wrongful rape conviction I 1981. After being excommunicated from his family, suffering from depression, and making several unsuccessful attempts at suicide, Kirk was sexually abused and contracted HIV as a result of the abuse. His tale, of triumph in the face of adversity, is one that gives us all hope.


DaVontae Sanford: The partially blind and developmentally disabled adolescent who was being falsely convicted of quadruple murder in 2007 at the young age of 14. Though the actual assailant, self-proclaimed hit-man Vincent Smothers, was captured and confessed to those and other murders around the country, the Wayne County Circuit Court refused to allow Sanford to withdraw his guilty plea for an innocent plea due to his already entered "admitted confession". This case like so many others, hides behind falsified information and withheld evidence. Now 23, DeVontae is still in custody, serving a 37-90 year sentence and in need of a voice.  He hopes to one day have a chance a normal life outside of prison bars.


Ricky Jackson: Was just an adolescent teen when he and 2 of his friends were wrongfully accused and convicted of murder of a store owner in Cleveland, OH. Ricky's case gained greater national attention as the National Registry of Exonerations has labeled him as serving the longest sentence (39 years) of anyone exonerated on Wrongful Conviction charges. Awarded only 2 million dollars for "lost time," he continues to fight on behalf of those still weathering the Wrongful Conviction storm, by petitioning officials to revise the inadequate regulations that prevent (wrongful) convicted cases from being reexamined and retried. Ricky has gone as far as publicly confronting Democratic Presidential Candidate Hilary Clinton during her campaign visit to Ohio.

These individuals, and others featured in this film, have been robbed of their lives through an unjust justice system. These men never had the opportunity to attend college, date, start a family, choose and work in a career they love, fall in love, or even impel things like buy their first car. Had justice truly been carried out, these men would have lived their lives and experienced all the ups and downs everyone goes through, rather than wasted away in a cell for a crime they did not commit.

There is a NEED

The Miscarriage of Justice came as a result of my direct involvement with community organizations that involve both social and systematic reform. All those participating in the making of this project are social activists, and have a passion to bring about social change on a global scale. I am known for getting things done, with a team or on my own, but this is a large task for any one man. Real change really does take a village!

How Your Donation Helps

$11,000 may seem to be a lot, but this is a small amount when you consider all the necessities needed to get something like this out to the world. Your donation will help us travel to three different states and cover the necessary costs to capture these stories and bring this film to life. Every single dime of your donation is going towards budget costs related to buying multi-use equipment (lighting kits), rentals (of cameras), travel logistics to/from each city, permits, insurance, hard drives, extra batteries, crew and so much more! Our goal is to produce a compelling film that features untold stories that need to be heard! 

The Perks

Check out the cool THANK YOU gifts we're giving to each person that supports this film!


Other Ways You Can Help

Certainly, finances are important, but in addition to that we need to get the word out! Here are a couple other ways you can help us:

  • Please tell your friends, family, associates, co-workers about our campaign. No donation is too small!
  • Sign up to be apart of MOJ's email list to get exclusive updates on production and cast 
  • Follow us and SHARE our posts on Facebook [www.facebook.com/mojproject] and on Twitter [www.twitter.com/mojproject]

story:
Teaser

There’s plenty of fish in the sea. The virtual sea that is.
Swipe left? Swipe right?
Match and you’ll enter a world of superficial shortcomings.

Welcome to the world of modern dating.
A world we enter to find something, but a world we inevitably get lost in.

Marina just wants to have that someone.
Marina wants to be accepted.
Marina swipes right.
But if she’d only look up, she’d enter a world that has so much more to offer. If only we would open our eyes. After all it was acceptable in the 80s.

Be part of your world.


The Project

In a world where we are consumed by love at first sight and our self-worth is at the mercy of a like, or indeed swipe. Wouldn’t it be nice to go back to a time where it was acceptable to be one’s self? Warts ‘n’ all.

In this modern world of cyber mating and relating, looks can be deceiving and the likes of Tinder and POF have given dating a new meaning. This video attempts to depict and illustrate the travesty and misfortunes of how disconnected we are in this supposedly connected new age. Told in a parodic light with humorous undertones, whilst simultaneously being a stylish and retro music video transporting it’s audience back to a time of big hair, bold colours and that tireless style of oversized denim, tight leggings and reebok classics.

It was acceptable in the 80s tells the story of a young Marina whose quest for acceptance and the guy propels her to create a false persona online in a bid to bag the man whilst accumulating those all important likes. Online? I hear you say. Yes, online. The video will transcend technological advances and have our characters with today’s smart phones with every gizmo, gadget, self indulgent, nonsense app.

The video is set in 1988 and not just for style purposes, but this is in fact our architectural framework in which we can document the way we are living now by comparison to how we lived back then. To show contrast and inform our audiences of the direct shift in the way we are communicating which has had a huge effect on the way we are able to present our lives to the people we 'know'. The execution of the video is primarily to be thought provoking yet playful. The video is to border cheesy but whilst remaining stereotypically within the realm of the 80’s in regards to style. Overall the video’s persona that will translate from the set to screen is light and comical in spirit.


What We Need & What You Get

As you can tell this is project we are very passionate about and therefore want to create it to the best standard in order to produce high quality piece that will do justice to not only the design of the piece but more importantly the concept and story of the video to create optimal impact in the end.

Our aim is to raise £750, all money raised will go towards the project, this includes:
- The Set; a purpose built set, as well as legal fees for filming on location in London.
- Props; we want to give you the full effect, down to the very iconic items of the 80s.
- Actors; this includes travel costs, and if enough is raised also a daily rate for them.
- Catering; the crew are kind volunteers, so the least we can do is feed them!
- Transport; getting the actors, crew to locations and also getting furniture to us.
-  Equipment; the hope is if we raise enough we can hire in equipment to create an even better quality video for you.
- Additional; all those little extra bits add up, such as printing, tools, extra materials and any extra surprises along the way.

As a huge favour you will see on this page there are several favours/perks available at different levels as a way our thanks and appreciation to you. All contributions are a greatly welcomed and appreciated!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute.
That doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

 we are consumed by love at first sight and our self-worth is at the 
mercy of a like, or indeed swipe. Wouldn’t it be nice to go back to a 
time where it was acceptable to be one’s self? Warts ‘n’ all.  
In
 this modern world of cyber mating and relating, looks can be deceiving 
and the likes of Tinder and POF have given dating a new meaning. This 
video attempts to depict and illustrate the travesty and misfortunes of 
how disconnected we are in this supposedly connected new age. Told in a 
parodic light with humorous undertones, whilst simultaneously being a 
stylish and retro music video transporting it’s audience back to a time 
of big hair, bold colours and that tireless style of oversized denim, 
tight leggings and reebok classics.  
It was acceptable in the 
80s tells the story of a young Marina whose quest for acceptance and 
the guy propels her to create a false persona online in a bid to bag the
 man whilst accumulating those all important likes. Online? I hear you 
say. Yes, online. The video will transcend technological advances and 
have our characters with today’s smart phones with every gizmo, gadget, 
self indulgent, nonsense app. 
The video is set in 1988 and not just for 
style purposes,  but this is in fact our architectural framework in 
which we can document the way we are living now by comparison to how we 
lived back then. To show contrast and inform our audiences of the direct
 shift in the way we are communicating which has had a huge effect 
on the way we are able to present our lives to the people we 'know'. The execution of the 
video is primarily to be thought provoking yet playful. The video is to 
border cheesy but whilst remaining stereotypically within the realm of 
the 80’s in regards to style. Overall the video’s persona that will translate from the set to screen is light and comical in spirit. 

   What We Need & What You GetAs you can tell this is project we are very passionate about and therefore want to create it to the best standard in order to produce high quality piece that will do justice to not only the design of the piece but more importantly the concept and story of the video to create optimal impact in the end. Our aim is to raise £750, all money raised will go towards the project, this includes:- The Set; a purpose built set, as well as legal fees for filming on location in London.- Props; we want to give you the full effect, down to the very iconic items of the 80s.- Actors; this includes travel costs, and if enough is raised also a daily rate for them.- Catering; the crew are kind volunteers, so the least we can do is feed them!- Transport; getting the actors, crew to locations and also getting furniture to us.-  Equipment; the hope is if we raise enough we can hire in equipment to create an even better quality video for you.- Additional; all those little extra bits add up, such as printing, tools, extra materials and any extra surprises along the way.As a huge favour you will see on this page there are several favours/perks available at different levels as a way our thanks and appreciation to you. All contributions are a greatly welcomed and appreciated!
 Other Ways You Can Help We understand that some people just can't contribute. That doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
?

Worum geht's?

Keine Lust zu lesen? Weiter unten gibt es eine Kurzzusammenfassung.
Es war einmal das MetaGer-Safari-PlugIn. Safari-Nutzer konnten frei und anonym mit MetaGer im Web suchen. Doch dann entschied sich Apple (Hersteller von Safari) künftig Geld zu verlangen für die Möglichkeit, Safari-PlugIns anzubieten; eine Praxis, die bei freien Browsern undenkbar wäre.

Damit schwebt das Safari-PlugIn für MetaGer in Gefahr, künftig nicht mehr existieren zu können, doch mit eurer Hilfe können wir es schaffen:
Würden wir die Kosten für Freischaltung und Entwicklung des PlugIns selbst tragen, würde zu Lasten der generellen Weiterentwicklung von MetaGer gehen. Die meisten unserer Nutzer, die den Safari nicht nutzen, würden davon nichts haben.

Das?finden wir nicht fair; insbesondere weil diese Kosten aufgrund der Geschlossenheit des Browsers besonders hoch sind.
Deswegen haben wir uns entschieden, unsere Nutzer selbst darüber entscheiden zu lassen.

Finden sich genügend Nutzer, die sich ein Safari-PlugIn wünschen, können wir dieses am Leben erhalten, ohne Abstriche bei anderen Nutzergruppen machen zu müssen.
Der Quellcode des PlugIns wird natürlich unter einer freien Lizenz veröffentlicht werden.
?
?

Nochmal in kurz

  • MetaGer ist die größte deutsche Suchmaschine. Sie ist in einem gemeinnützigen Verein organisiert und respektiert die Privatspäre ihrer Nutzer.
  • Apple hat sich entschieden, Geld für die Freischaltung von Safari-PlugIns zu erheben.
  • Durch ein Crowd-Funding der Kosten müssen wir keine Abstriche bei der sonstigen Weiterentwicklung von MetaGer machen.
  • Finden sich genügend Safari-Nutzer, kann das PlugIn überleben und weiterentwickelt werden.?
?

?

Unser Kostenplan????

Nachfolgend eine kurze Aufstellung der von uns geplanten Kosten:

~100€ - Soviel verlangt Apple in etwa, um uns überhaupt die Möglichkeit zu geben, das PlugIn für den Safari-Browser ein Jahr lang anzubieten. Kosten für Entwicklung und Pflege sind hier noch nicht enthalten.

200€ - Diesen sehr kleinen Betrag brauchen wir um das PlugIn für ein Jahr anbieten zu können und ist gleichzeitig der Minimalbetrag, ab dem diese Kampagne als Erfolg bezeichnet werden kann.

400€ - Mit nochmal 200€ können wir das PlugIn für ein weiteres Jahr anbieten und weiterentwickeln.

800€ - Hiermit wird nach unserer Planung langfristig (min. 4 Jahre) die Witerentwicklung des PlugIns gesichert. Außerdem haben wir die Möglichkeit, uns Safari-spezifischen Features zu widmen.

1000€ - Ab diesem Betrag macht es Sinn eine MetaGer-iOS-App in Erwägung zu ziehen, die wir bisher aus ähnlichen Gründen nicht anbieten können.

Alles übrige Geld ist sowohl für die Weiterentwicklung von Apple-nahen Technologien (Safari-PlugIn, iOS-App u.ä.) als auch für die generelle Entwicklung der MetaGer-Dienste (Websuche, anonymer Proxy u.ä.) vorgesehen.

Warum MetaGer so wichtig ist

In Europa nutzen über 90% eine einzige Suchmaschine. Auch wenn der Zugang gebührenfrei ist, kostenlos ist er nicht. Bezahlt wird mit dem Ausverkauf der Privatsphäre.

Der SUMA-EV engagiert sich mit MetaGer schon seit 2004 für mehr Transparenz und Sicherheit im digitalen Raum. Mit MetaGer kann sicher und ohne Verlust der Phrivatsphäre im Netz gesucht werden. Damit wurde ein Instrument geschaffen, sich auf Basis eines gemeinnützigen Vereins gegen einen Ausverkauf der Privatsphäre und gegen Überwachung erfolgreich zur Wehr zu setzen.?

Risiken & Herausforderungen

Die Risiken für die nahe Zukunft halten sich in Grenzen: Wir hatten bereits ein funktionierendes Safari-PlugIn und können auf dessen Basis weiterarbeiten.

Trotzdem sind wir mittel- wie langfristig von einer dritten Partei abhängig: Apple.
Sollte Apple die Kosten für die Entwicklung/Pflege des PlugIns erhöhen oder unser PlugIn durch Änderungen am Browser gar verhindern, kann dies schwere Folgen für das PlugIn haben. Dennoch erachten wir das Risiko - besonders des letzteren Falles - als gering und rechnen mit dem langfristigen Betrieb des MetaGer-Safari-PlugIns.
??

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Wir können nicht nur finanzielle Hilfe gebrauchen: MetaGer lebt durch seine Nutzer.

Auch wenn du uns nicht durch deine Spende unterstützen kannst, mit deiner Stimme kannst du es.

  • Rede über MetaGer und darüber, warum unabhängige Suchmaschinen wichtig sind.
  • Weise andere auf diese Kampagne hin.
  • Unterstütze uns (für dich kostenlos) mit deinem nächsten Online-Einkauf.
  • Werde gegen einen geringen Jahresbeitrag Mitglied im SUMA-EV.
  • Nutze MetaGer.

Dennoch erachten wir das Risiko - besonders des letzteren Falles - als gering und rechnen mit dem langfristigen Betrieb des MetaGer-Safari-PlugIns.
??
Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann
Wir können nicht nur finanzielle Hilfe gebrauchen: MetaGer lebt durch seine Nutzer.
Auch wenn du uns nicht durch deine Spende unterstützen kannst, mit deiner Stimme kannst du es.

Rede über MetaGer und darüber, warum unabhängige Suchmaschinen wichtig sind.
Weise andere auf diese Kampagne hin.
Unterstütze uns (für dich kostenlos) mit deinem nächsten Online-Einkauf.
Werde gegen einen geringen Jahresbeitrag Mitglied im SUMA-EV.

Nutze MetaGer.

story:
28 + More to come!!!

Greetings and THANKS for visiting this campaign. My name is Jeffrey Collins, I am an artist and a filmmaker. I am in need of YOUR help in order to be able to make more interviews with artists and art world personalities.

I've been making documentary films on artists since 2012 when I made my first filming trip to New Hampshire to interview the great curator Carl Belz, since then I have interviewed 28 artist and art world personalities, and I want to go back to New York City to interview more.

I've been a painter seriously since around 1999 and since 2000 I have been desiring to make an updated version of the legendary art documentary PAINTERS PAINTING. In 2011 I began that long and winding road, it has lead me here with 28 interviews being conducted and am hoping with your help I'll be able to make it to 29, 30, 31, 32 and so on. I want to be able to compile interviews with great people so future generations can get to know the people I have been honored to interview.
I've been so infatuated with this project for a decade and am so glad to see it grow way beyond my original idea of making one film. I now have over 100 hours of film on many great artists, writers, and curators. I've been blessed to get to know these people and hope that, through my filming, you will be able to get to know them too. 
This campaign is here to help build this archive that will guide future generations.
Listing of every participant: Anders Knutsson, Art Guerra, Carl Belz, Darryl Hughto, Dee Solin, Francine Tint, Forrest Myers, James Panero, John Zinsser, Karen Wilkin, Klaus Kertess, Liv Mette Larsen, Loren Munk, Louise P. Sloane, Matthew Deleget, Michael Brennan, Peter Reginato, Richard Timperio, Robert C. Morgan, Robert Sagerman, Rodney Dickson, Ronnie Landfield, Ruth Ann Fredenthal, Sandi Slone, Seren Morey, Stephen Bennett, Susan Roth, and Vincent Como.


What We Need & What You Get

I'm using this campaign to raise funds for travel, lodging, and food while on my next filming journey. I already have all the electronics I am going to need for this project, and all I need is your support to get there and get it done. 

Travel to NYC by car is 9.5 hours roughly to get to NYC, to get IN NYC it takes another 10-30 minutes depending on the traffic at the tunnel. If you've driven into NYC you know what I mean. I am usually able to stay with friends, which significantly cuts down on production costs, which is why i've been able to make so many interviews over the years on the cheap. Everytime I do one of these filming trips, I spend a lot of time walking around and am now also in need of a new camera equipment bag, which will be around $200. Subways are wonderful for me and a 7 day pass is around $30. I always buy a 7 day pass, even if i'm there for three, as you put in a $20 and you'll run through that in one day if you are a busy person. I have usually been blessed to eat a few meals with the kindness of friends, but can't depend on things like that or you'll starve. 

When you buy a DVD of one of the interviews, that money will go toward helping me do the above in order to get the world another interview with another great artist, along with allowing me to survive while there.

I'm also working on getting the archives of these interviews into some university libraries around the country. Hopefully one day, the world. But until that happens, please keep the positive thoughts coming. It would be awesome for a young student to come upon these interviews, like I did with PAINTERS PAINTING and have it change their life as that film did for me.

If the goal of this project is not realized, the funds still go through, this is a flex-funding campaign, so unlike that other crowdsourcing site, this one allows all funds to be allocated toward getting as much done as I can with what I raise. So please do share this with your friends and family so everything will work out amazingly.


The Impact

To have an archive of interviews from some of the world's greatest artists of this era is indispensable to art history. One day I hope that the entire archive will be available at any local art university library, but until then, you can have a piece of it for yourself in the building of this mountain. 

I've done these campaigns before and many people have helped me get to where I am, I hope that they will again be willing to lend their help to this project to make it a reality.

There are not many people out there doing interviews like this, but there are more now than ever, people are using their cameraphones to do interviews with and in return are building a  worldwide archive of stories of artists like never before seen.


Risks & Challenges

Those of you who know me, know how important this filming project has been, it's got even more important when I decided to do separate interviews of all kinds of art world personalities. As trying to bring everyone together in a massive 10 hour film, I am now looking to gain enough footage to put together 1 hour programs on each of these artists and writers, critics, and curators.
I've done this trip to NYC to interview many times and look forward to doing another few trips. I doubt I have much more to accomplish in NY before I feel i've done enough. I will then pass the torch to another generation and I will focus on the next place. Probably Los Angeles or Europe. 


Here's how to keep helping!

If you can't contribute by way of monetary value, you can always help by simply sharing this campaign with your family and friends. We need all the help we can get....am I right? 

The easy to use sharing tools from indiegogo allow anyone to put it on their blog, or Twitter feed, or even your Facebook feed.

Thanks very much for your help, I am a very grateful filmmaker.

story:
WHAT'S SO SPECIAL ABOUT DUDETOPIA?

Dudetopia is a documentary about The Dude, Duder or El Duderino if you're not into the whole brevity thing. How The Dude was the source of inspiration for so many wonderful things: art, festivals, fashion, books, career choices, bars, restaurants, charity work, communities, a Daoism-like religion called Dudeism, and a philosophy called The F Word Spirituality... and other things.

I am going to tell the stories of a group Dude fans from all around the globe, from different places and backgrounds. How they were inspired by the Dude and how they use his take-it-easy philosophy and wisdom in their lives.

THE CAST:

In addition to Dude fans, the cast of Dudetopia will include: film critics, political activists, intellectuals, spiritual leaders, and hopefully The Coen brothers (the creators of the Dude), Jeff Dowd (the fictional Dude) and Jeff Bridges (the actual Dude). They will explore the cinematic, political, spiritual, social and other aspects of The Dude's character.

THE PLAN AND THE MONEY, LEBOWSKI:

In order for Dudetopia to become a reality, I need $25000. I'm being as frugal as possible. I'm not paying myself a salary and my huge network of Dudeist friends will accommodate and help me as much as they can while shooting the movie.

The money is for: 
The gear- I'm buying because renting will cost much more.
The crew (Editor, D.O.P, sound engineer)
The perks (manufacturing and postage)
The transportation and traveling expenses
The licensing of copyrighted music.
The publicity and other expenses in the production and post-production processes.

PLAN B:

What if I didn't reach my target? Well, that is certainly a possibility, Dude. I have two scenarios as my plan B. I will either make a short version of Dudetopia or make another, less expensive project and later make Dudetopia from its profits. It all depends on the amount of funds that I raise.

But in each and every case, in each and every plan I will deliver the perks, the presents and awards that I promise my contributors.


WHAT'S IN IT FOR THE DUDE:

We have a unique set of perks starting from a shout out on Facebook to a trip to Egypt for 7 days.
Including, a Dudemaste (a special thanks in the closing credits), a watching Dudetopia online, the D.V.D, a t-shirt, personal t-shirt (a t-shirt designed the way you choose), a poster, producer credit, personal poster( a poster designed as you choose), the famous sweater of the Dude made of Egyptian cotton, a cameo in Dudetopia, a silver Dude necklace, a golden Dude necklace. 
Note: I will deliver these perks even if I didn't reach my full target.
                                                >>> CHECK OUT PERKS >>>


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

Donating money is not the only way you can help Dudetopia. There are other ways, Dude, like spreading the word about it. Share this campaign on social media, tell your friends, you classmates and your colleagues about Dudetopia,. and last but not least your positive vibes and your moral support. Thank you and Dudemaste :)

story: The Last Beluga is a short film directed by Paige Powell, a senior film student at Biola University. It is an animated picture, which has required a lot of resources and dedication from Paige and her team. The film follows the story of a Beluga who lives with a colony of penguins, and highlights the impact that humans have on the environment around us. Please consider contributing to support this creative filmmaking endeavor!

story:
AS THE END OF MARIJUANA PROHIBITION COMES INTO FOCUS, WE NEED YOUR HELP TO TELL THIS INCREDIBLE STORY.

BASED ON THE WALL STREET JOURNAL BEST SELLING BOOK 'JACKPOT'

This isn’t a story of hit men, mobsters, cocaine cowboys or cartels. The Gentlemen Smugglers built a multi-million dollar marijuana smuggling empire over the course of a decade, living by their own moral code. They shunned violence, enlisted their friends, and perfected the art of enjoying the scam.  As the operation grew beyond the smuggler’s wildest dreams, the foot soldiers in President Reagan’s War on Drugs quietly set their sites on the outlaw sailors. The government saw marijuana as the gateway drug to an exploding crack cocaine problem. The Gentlemen Smugglers, and presently the majority of this country, couldn’t disagree more.  With a zest for life and a healthy sense of humor, the smugglers rewrote the rulebook on marijuana trafficking. Based on the Wall Street Journal best selling book 'JACKPOT' by Jason Ryan.

A MESSAGE FROM OUR DIRECTOR

We have never met a better group of story-tellers than the men known as The Gentlemen Smugglers.  Perhaps it’s due to their time on sailboats crossing the Atlantic, bails of weed covering every available square inch of the vessel.  When you are sailing back from Jamaica, Colombia, even Lebanon you have weeks to share stories and you certainly have a treasure chest of material to pull from.  I’m sure those stories were refined in prison.  Instead of blue water on the horizon they have only time to navigate - time to share adventures about money earned and lost, about friends turned snitches, and about women that stuck by them when all signs seemed to point to run.

The Gentlemen Smugglers built a multi-million dollar marijuana empire over the course of a decade, living by their own moral code. They shunned violence, enlisted friends, and perfected the art of enjoying the scam. Most were from the south, and strangers to the lifestyle the smuggling operation suddenly afforded them. Some opted to hide the money and live quietly, but most did not. They lived large and enjoyed the fruits of their marijuana labor.  

But while the party raged down south, the foot soldiers in President Reagan’s War on Drugs quietly targeted The Gentlemen Smugglers in a task force they coined “Operation Jackpot.”  The government saw marijuana as the gateway drug to an exploding crack cocaine epidemic, and was determined to bring down the southern dealers. Meanwhile, the smugglers went about their business, following their own ethical standards, with a less fatalistic view of weed. Said Gentlemen Smuggler Kingpin Les Riley,  “I only saw marijuana as a way of having a good time and getting hungry.”  

The smugglers were not an easy bunch to capture. Some were on the run for years, and others were caught, but managed to escape on multiple occasions. When the decade-long party finally ended, friends betrayed friends, families were torn apart, and sailboats on the open water were traded for prison cells.

While the “who and what” of this story is fascinating, it’s the smugglers themselves that make the documentary necessary.  They are naturally gifted storytellers who overcame odds, made a mark on history, and became legends. Our goal as filmmakers is to make the story as colorful and rich as the people who lived it.  The Gentlemen Smugglers are finally ready to tell their version of history. 

~ Director Tony Wise

WE NEED YOUR HELP. PLEASE JOIN OUR TEAM!

We are seeking financial support to produce an incredible documentary. The Gentlemen Smugglers are fantastic group of colorful characters and have an amazing story. They were pioneers in the marijuana trade of the 1970's and 1980's. Their story is of historical significance filled with passion, intrigue, adventure, and capitalism.  They had a zest for life and ethos on par with any successful corporation. Their story is stranger than fiction. Larger than life. These men were old fashioned non-violent cowboys living in the 1970's and 1980's South. They did their time and served ridiculously long federal prison sentences. Now we want to share their story to the world. 

Documentaries are extremely difficult to raise financing for and get produced. We have an amazing, dedicated team, but we need your help! Your contribution will be spent on the production, delivery, and promotion of this wildly entertaining story. 

  • Our team has been self-financing this project for the past two years. We need your help to get it to the finish line without compromise and in-style. We have secured the rights to the book, financed a high quality 12 minute docu-promo, a promotional teaser (link above) and scentless countless hours researching and developing the story that we want to tell. 
  • Funds will go toward incredible re-enactments, great production design, and in- depth research and the use of archival footage. We plan to tell the story of The Gentlemen Smugglers visually through the real life smugglers, wives, ex-wives, sons, daughters, members of the IRS, present and former US Prosecutors, Local Sheriffs, and Political figures.  
  • We will take the time to craft an incredibly rich story. Our award winning team has a combined 60+ year track record of successfully telling stories and delivering entertainment to the international stage. 
  • We will have the finest post production completed for the film at Media Toaster in Burbank, CA. www.mediatoaster.com
  • Regardless if we reach our crowd funding goal, you can be assured that your contribution will be spent on bringing this wonderful story to the big screen.

GREAT REWARDS. GREAT MEMORABILIA. 

BE A PART OF OUR STORYTELLER TEAM. 

Be a part of our team. We will reward you with great gifts and great experiences. 

  • Original, Custom Designed Limited Edition T-Shirts and Sweatshirts
  • Custom Designed iPhone Covers 
  • Replica Smuggling Bags with Embroidery
  • Replica Smuggling "Bettie Page" Floaty Pens
  • Limited Edition Bumper Stickers
  • Limited Edition Bottle Openers
  • Limited Edition Shot Glass
  • Limited Edition Smuggler Flask
  • Photos from the Set
  • One or More Days on Set
  • Dinner with Barry Foy
  • Limited Edition Autographed Photos
  • Tickets to the Premiere of the Film
  • Deep Sea Fishing with a Kingpin
  • Golfing with a Kingpin
  • Sailing with a Kingpin
  • Dinner with a Kingpin (sounds fun!)
  • Sailing the Caribbean with a Kingpin (what?!?)
  • Tour Jamaica with a Kingpin (what?!?)




DONATING A PORTION OF PROCEEDS TO MARIJUANA NON-PROFITS & FOUNDATIONS

Our team intends to pledge a portion of our crowd funding support to non-profit organizations and foundations that are focused on the legalization and most importantly the decriminalization of marijuana laws. We believe in reforming Marijuana laws. We believe in a legally controlled market for marijuana, the responsible use of marijuana by adults and the removal of all penalties.  Some say if it wasn't for the smugglers we would not have the legalization movement that exists in our country. There was a demand for product and the smugglers fulfilled that need and supplied marijuana to the people for over ten years.

EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS...

Your contribution matters regardless of size. There is no shortage of stories, but GREAT stories are difficult to come by. We have a GREAT story and a group of men that want to share it...first hand. 

You have our pledge that we will deliver a first class, entertaining, coffee shop, water cooler, breakroom gossip inducing documentary feature film. This film has lived with us for years, and it is time we help tell it. Be part of something unique. Please join our team.

SPREAD THE WORD...

We understand that not everyone that is supportive of the project has the ability to contribute financially. If that is you, we still need your help! 

  • Please spread the word about our project. Email your friends, families, and let people know about this unbelievable story. Every penny counts! 
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools and send our campaign out to the world.

Thank you for your consideration. We are excited to make this film! 

FAQ

When will the movie be made?

We are actively making the movie now and will continue to produce the film once we have raised additional funds.

When will the movie be released?

If all goes well, all production and post-production works should be finished in the first half of 2017 and released in 2017.

How will I get my digital download still photo?

You will receive an email containing the link for digital download still photo within three months.  We will keep in touch with you to keep you hyped all the way through. 

When will the various items be shipped and/or available?

Most of the rewards will be available within 3-5 months. 

What about the visits to the movie set? Golfing? Deep Sea Fishing? How will that work?

We will email you dates of filming that will be open to you. You will have the ability to select dates that work. 

When do I get to travel with a Kingpin? 

We will email you dates for you to choose from. It will be in winter 2017. 

What will happen if I move before rewards are shipped? Can I update my delivery address?

We will inform you in advance about the progress of shipment and delivery. In the case of any problems you’ll simply let us know via email and we’ll work it out.

Will there be more special rewards offered during the campaign?

Absolutely. Stay tuned. 
Where will the premiere take place? 
A major film festival and Charleston, SC!

story:
Short 

Manifest Destiny is important to me as the director, because I, Tyler (director), have been poor all my life and unable to help my community, this is my first chance in life to create something bigger than myself.
Your contribution will be helping me start a new era of film acting in Iowa, help me give jobs to the wonderful boy, girls, men, and women, whose dream it is to be an actor but have had no chance to, due to inaccessibility.
On the production side we have Caleb Harris and his crew JunctionLaddes, Gabriel Tejeda and his crew Gate 13 & Company.  And last but certainly not least, our actors are numerous, and some more known actors in Des Moines include but not limited to Arlen Daleske, who is our Alchemist Captain, and Rebecca Masucci, who is our Mystic Elder. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our ideal would be 3,000, which would help us get full cosplay costumes for our actors, it would help us get an editor who can bring the story I have in my head to life, it would allow us to get great quality and fully functional equipment, and most important to me allows us to pay our talent, who very much deserve to. Also almost equally important to keep up morale, we'll be able to feed everyone, no one works at 120% on an empty stomach.

Now all of that is good, but the real question is what to I get out of it, and I'm here to tell you that we do have prizes for you. Depending on how much you contribute, will dictate what prize you get for exmple: if you give ten dollars you will get an Exclusive 9Tail Production metal fine tip pen. 

All extra money we have left over will have different purposes depending on how much money we can get for the budget. If we get the full $3,000 than we can include paying the actors the the leftovers would go towards our new production company 9Tail productions. If we do not meet are goal and still have extra money it's all going to the actors, I (Tyler), will keep none of it and that is a promise.

The Impact

The Impact you are leaving will be more than you would ever dream. Like I said i was poor all my life, I was just happy to wake up the next day before I was adopted. So it's giving me a chance at have a life that's not below average, and create something bigger than myself. You are helping me build resumes for people who other wise would get left in the wind, because of the small acting market in Iowa. But the big kicker is helping the actors community, people will see what talent Iowa, Des Moines specifically, has and then more projects will come here, it will encourage people to make their own projects and do what, 9TP is doing.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is people not getting on board whatever that is, may it be funding or lighting the set. If we cannot get people invested, then there is no production. I (Tyler) am not anymore qualified than the next guy, I believe that if you are fated to make a change, even average Joe down the street can spark a movement. I am just doing what I feel like I am being guided to do. We have other small risks such as tech not working, or actors not showing, but that is something that I (Tyler) have to deal with when it gets to that point. Fortunately for me i have a coalition of people to help with the things that I, either cannot do because I don't have the knowledge, or because I have something else on my plate. Without the "We", I am nothing, and that is how we overcome honestly all of the challenges. I am not more qualified than anyone else, but we can change the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that not everyone has even a penny to give, I have been there and very senseitive to that, so there are other ways you can help out the production, and is equally as encouraged and valued as contributing monetarily. You can help by getting the word out, let people know who we are and what we stand for. You can do that by liking, sharing, and inviting friends to do the same on our official Facebook page,'9Tail Productions". You can do that with the share tools that indigogo has gratiously included to make getting our name out there that much easier.

story:
Vintage Glorious Glendale is going on the Telly!

We have been asked to create a three part documentary series for television!  So now the editing begins to take the current version and create three parts that are of broadcast quality.

The expense of editing, rendering and producing three parts as a series is in need of support to pay our stellar editors to lend their expertise to this documentary.

"VINTAGE GLORIOUS GLENDALE" A SERIOUS DOCUMENTARY ABOUT GLENDALE, CALIFORNIA is an enthusiastic look at the very vintage buildings, businesses, homes and people of Glendale California.  A documentary shot in the style of "Huell Howser's California Gold" with interviews and onsite visits showing how Glendale started, how it progressed and interviews with prominent Glendalians.  So many lovely and interesting places in Glendale, from the Alex Theatre to the Metzler Violin Store, Sons of the Revolution Library, YWCA, YMCA, Glendale Community College and Foxy's Restaurant!  The full length DVD of the documentary is available now along with the 149 page book at Velvet Rhodes Productions website.

Vintage Glorious Glendale is screening at the MGN FIVE STAR CINEMA and premiered at the Alex Theatre and has been receiving great reviews which you can read by clicking here:
GLENDALE NEWS PRESS READ HERE
CRESCENTA VALLEY WEEKLY READ HERE
GLENDALE NEWS PRESS COMMENTARY READ HERE


Great Appreciation for All of The Supporters

It is with great appreciation and gratitude to reach out to all of you who have been so supportive and enthusiastic about Vintage Glorious Glendale..............this documentary could not have been made without your generous contributions!

  • The editing for television is quite different than for film, so experts are on board to perfect, sound balance, and color correct each segment removing any technical flaws.  Given the amount of information in this documentary, the process is very time consuming.
  • The monumental success of this documentary will now become a series that can screen around the world on television.
  • It is so exciting to have come this far with this film and all because of YOU!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially that doesn't mean you can't help:
  • You can get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
  •  You can share on social media pages.

story:
Chippr is a safe space for you to address your concerns related to LGBT community anonymously and a place to meet like-minded LGBTQIA individuals!

Find out more on www.ChipprApp.com



What Inspired Chippr?

#StartOut 
I still remember that night, January 4th, 2013. It was just like any other evening, 2 days before I started my Winter quarter as a Sophomore at University of California, San Diego, little did my mom know that I was going to come out to her that night. After struggling with my sexuality for years, I decided that it was time to finally face the truth and start living as myself. What a better way to accept yourself than having your mom be the first person in the world to know the truth, right? I thought I was ready, but apparently I was wrong. Like a lot of our parents, she lost it, freaked out, and was in complete denial, but it was understandable: I just wasn’t prepared for it. I had no one to turn to, no one to talk to, and had no idea where or how to reach for help. If it wasn’t for a guy on social media who talked to me (whom I didn't even meet in person), I don’t know if I would still be standing here today. That experience planted a seed in my head:what would happen if we can build a localized online community that is safe for people to turn to whenever they need help, support, or simply someone to talk to?That became the fundamental principle of Chippr, to serve the LGBT community...

As I started to get used to my “new found identity,” I began trying out all those dating applications out there; however, I just wanted to find a like-minded friend. I hesitated when it asked me for a profile picture because I wasn’t comfortable enough to let people know that I am gay. After coming through with that process, I realized that having a picture on the dating applications would result in one of two cases: a hookup or a rejection that leads to lower self-esteem. It got me curious as to how can we make the online experience better, more personal, and supportive? What can we do to make it better? How can we connect people in a more genuine way?The answers to those questions later became the foundations of Chippr.

Photo credit to my mom. Taken in Hawaii, one year after I came out to her.


What We Need & What You Get

How much money do we need?

Our Goal: $15,000. Our Dream: $25,000.

The more money we raise, the better our platform will be! We have a lot of interesting and unique features that we haven’t gotten to implement yet due to our budget. From a more integrated way for you to reach LGBTQIA community professionals right through our apps to a more comprehensive way for you to discover new and exciting local LGBT businesses.Therefore, the more money we raise, the bigger the platform will be, the more features you will see, and eventually it all comes right back to benefiting you as a user and giving you the tools to create a more convenient, safer and exciting life.

Where is the money going?

Most of the money will be going towards development/maintenance and marketing. 60% of the funding you put in will go towards development, pivoting our platform with the feedback we receive from you and maintaining our system down the road. Developing a product that really serves the needs of the LGBTQIA community is our top priority. No matter how we brand it or what kind of marketing campaign we do, it all comes down to our product. We want to create a platform that is close to you and can actually solve your problems. That being said, we will spend 30% of the funding we receive towards marketing. With a genuine and sincere product that we build, combined with a few social network campaigns, we believe sooner or later, word-of-mouth will eventually shrink our cost of advertisement down for us to focus even more on delivering better products for you. (Indiegogo takes 5% and Paypal takes another 5%).

What will you get from this?

We build Chippr to set out to be the ultimate safe harbor and a genuine social/resources network for the LGBTQIA community around the world. Other than the features and services that we already provide on Chippr app, we are constantly thinking of new ways to solve the pains of the LGBT community. No matter what you are looking for, a friendship or a relationship, it all starts with connecting and meeting them. As a result, we are creating more innovative ways for businesses, community centers and people to collaborate, for like-minded people to meet and for the community to celebrate the LGBTQIA culture.

When will the App be Available?


The Impact

For better quality photo, click here: http://postimg.org/image/t8ex5kxil/

According to Bloomberg status, almost 23% of the American population belongs to the LGBTQIA group. That's almost 1 in 4 people around you. Yet, coming out is still not an easy task, many people today are still struggling in understanding themselves and figuring out their own identity. Like I always say, it's only when you start to accept yourself that others will start to accept you. So, when you contribute to Chippr, you are contributing to the greater society. You are making a HUGE difference not only in someone's life but in society as a whole. You are essentially promoting understanding and offering LGBT individuals the support they need. Create a safe environment for people to chat and a genuine place for people to meet up.


Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread out the word! The more exposure we get, the more people that you can reach out to. Please share our Indiegogo Campaign on your Facebook, Twitter or Instagram account. Tell your friends about us! Sign up for the official launch notification on our landing page: www.chipprapp.com. You never know, maybe you got a friend who is still struggling coming out, or maybe you got a friend that is looking to find LGBT individuals to connect with. Either way, simply let them know about our platform and you will already be making an impact in someone else's life! Be a s/hero!

story:
FitSteps Life

The FitSteps team of Ian Waite, Natalie Lowe & Mark Foster founded FitSteps in 2013 to get the world fit through Latin & Ballroom dancing. To date FitSteps has trained over 2,000 instructors who teach FitSteps classes to over 50,000 people each week. The FitSteps program teaches people the fundementals of Latin & Ballroom dancing while incorporating fitness techniques to produce an exercise class that gets you fit, helps you lose weight and teaches you how to dance.

We have just launched our 2 new variations, the first of which is specifically designed for those of you looking to get started at a slower pace or need a lower impact version. The other takes it in the opposite direction, really raising that heart rate and working those muscles!

FitSteps Life is an online community bringing those classes (and much much more), taught by the team, into your home or on to your mobile device.

What is FitSteps Life:

  • An on-line community for those want to get or keep fit and lose weight
  • For those who want to dance like the stars they see on their favourite TV shows
  • A place to learn the steps to all of your favorite Latin & Ballroom dances
  • Somewhere to can get diet and nutrition tips from an Olympic & 6 time World Champion athelete.
  • Tips on how the celebrities get that "Star'' look.
  • Blogs & Vlogs from the stars
  • Guest stars and dances
  • Conditioning programs from the team.

Not everyone can get to a class, and those that do sometimes want more. This community will allow absolutely everyone, no matter where they are located, to have access to classes,  as well as the ability to learn to dance and find out where they can join others taking the class or just interact through the community.

The Team:

Natalie Lowe

  • Four time finalist and former Winner of ''Dancing With The Stars''
  • Strictly Come Dancing regular and former finalist
  • Nat has been competing (mostly undeafeted) internationally for 20yrs
  • Natalie is also a trained beautition and skin care professional!

Ian Waite

  • European Latin American Champion
  • 'Strictly Come Dancing' regular professional
  • Presenter of 'Waite's Wednesday Warm Up'
  • Professional Choreographer

Mark Foster

  • International Swimmer
  • 6 x World Champion, 5 x Olympian, 11 x European Champion
  • 8 x World Record breaker
  • Celebrity Competitor on 'Strictly Come Dancing'


So What Do We Need & Why!

We are hoping to raise a minimum of £20,000.

Though we have a huge amount of video content already we want to make sure that on the 1st day the community is launched there will be enough content for everyone of varying levels to enjoy and take part in. It costs a huge amount of money to have this produced to a professional standard and most of the money raised will go to the initial batch of filming.

We also need to upgrade our website, this will allow simple intuitive menu's and the ability to stream all the content on any smart device.

It really is as simple as that! The more we raise the more content we make and the better the platform can be!

Here is the breakdown:


Now The Fun Bit!

We have some great rewards for all of our early adopters, everything from a simple thank you from the team to private dance lessons with the stars of the show!

Remember if you want more than 1 perk you can give the subscription to a friend!

We have made some great apparel for you, all of which includes a 30 day subscription to the community. When you get it as part of the reward is actually less than it would cost normally!!

Apparel


As well as merchandise you can star in one of our video's and become a real member of the team:


Why Help!

By helping us launch this channel you will become part of a worldwide movement to get everyone fit through dance. 'Strictly Come Dancing' and 'Dancing With The Stars' air in over 50 countries and is more often than not the number one show - who doesn't want to be able to dance like that!! (not to mention those celebrity weight loss stories!). Not everyone has access to learn or go to local classes, some people want to get used to classes or fitness before doing it in public and of the biggest issue we get asked about is that not everyone has a partner to learn with.

FitSteps & FitSteps Life has been built for everyone, we want people to go to the local classes, practice at home, learn new moves and get more proficient, but above all - dance, be healthy and be happy in the comfort of your own home!!

We are giving all of our instructors access to the site so there will be lots of expert advice as well as the ability to find that local class near you (no matter what country your in).

Our instructors will all have access to the music and moves in the video's so be sure to ask for your favourite!

How Else Can You Help

Please help us to get the word out by sharing our social media links and telling friends, fellow dance entusiasts, co-workers and family. Remember you can share directly from Indiegogo to any social media platform.

We look forward to hearing from you if you have any questions.

story:
I'm an artist living in Brooklyn who creates and performs music/comedy. One day I was shopping for a mini rhythm machine online and I read an Amazon product review that CHANGED MY LIFE. I never knew how dramatic and emotional a product review could be! This review had everything- story, character, drama, and lots of feelings. So I turned that review into a dramatic rock ballad. 

I thought I was done... 

But I found some more captivating reviews and wrote them into songs. Then with the help of the amazing director/choreographer Wendy Seyb, we decided to turn those songs into a big musical web-series with an ensemble of dancers, musicians, and musical theater actors!

This series is called "Amazon Product Reviews Set to Music" (naturally). These product reviews showcase a rainbow of emotions and introduce us to an extremely entertaining cast of relatable characters. This is crucial for me to create because it shows that every human can make art when they combine emotion with self-expression, and supports my main goal as an artist which is to make art-making accessible for all. 

All the Monies

This is the inaugural production for my new production company, Maul Face, LLC. I strongly believe in paying the talent I work with and am committed to creating a safe and fulfilling work environment for everyone involved. This means paychecks for every cast and crew member (dancers, singers, musicians, etc), set insurance, and craft services (food and beverages)- things we all need at our jobs.

The aesthetic of the series is hand-made and personal with a charming tone- while the acting, writing, and music recording will be crisp and professional. This means additional funds for the rehearsal rooms, recording studio time, and the audio engineer.  Plus other fun necessities like props, website fees, transportation, and more. 

The Impact

All those things together make $26,000 which equals eight original songs AND eight original musical episodes filled with dance, comedy, & glitter. 

This is the first and only hand-made musical web-series with Broadway talent (from such shows as "Book of Mormon" & "The Pee-Wee Herman Show") singing Amazon reviews. We plan to launch it on Vimeo in the fall of 2016.

That's one whole series and one whole soundtrack- pretty good for $26,000! (Especially when you consider that most Broadway musicals cost 100 times more.)

 

Perks! 

Look to your right! They are fun.

    I'm So Excited... Let's make this already!

    This is a huge endeavor and requires a brilliant team which I've already assembled - now all we need is to add your brilliance to mix!

    Every dollar contributed will go to Season 1 - and we are already planning Season 2 - "The Comments Section"! Be sure to sign up for our newsletter at Maul Face, LLC to receive updates.

     

    Thank You!

    Please feel free to spread the word.  We would really appreciate it! 

    Love,

    Lauren
