the top creative universities in England. In the four years she has set her
sights on Screenwriting, her comedic work has been performed live on Hollywood
Boulevard as part of the 3rd LA Scripted Comedy Festival, and has
won numerous awards including BEST SERIES SCRIPT at The Indie Gathering
International Film Festival. Her passion for filmmaking and under represented
characters AND comedy caused her to create this series. Her comedy inspirations
include the likes of Amy Sherman Palladino (Gilmore Girls), Mindy Kaling (The
Office and The Mindy Project) and Diablo Cody (Juno, Young Adult). 



Rosemary Andrews - DIRECTOR/PRODUCER
Rosemary currently studies at Royal Holloway University, England. She specialises in Theatre Direction, having written and directed and even acted for the stage! This insight into actors makes her direction on shoots particularly helpful. She has also worked behind the camera on multiple projects ranging from creation of trailers to doing official photography for many Scouting events in South London. In her work co-producing and directing a pantomime in South London, she successfully developed comedic performances, co-ordinated with the light and sound team; liaising with the lightning and sound team and created a great work environment. Her directorial inspirations include Katheryn Bigelow (The Hurt Locker, Zero Dark Thirty), Amy Sherman Palladino (Gilmore Girls) and Shonda Rhimes (Grey's Anatomy, Scandal, almost every other show on TV).



Alicia McKenzie - ACTOR
Alicia plays the main character Kayla in the series. 
Alicia has acted in many theatre productions such as
"Rapunzel", "The White Witch of Rose Hall" and "Ring a
Ding Ding" which was performed in New York. She has also worked in feature
films and the TV show Asylum.


Bhavnisha Parmar - ACTOR
Bhavnisha plays the role of Kayla's best friend and workaholic doctor, Amreeta, in the series. 
Bhavnisha Parmar, known for her roles in the TV movie Guilty
Pleasures (2016) and the shorts Les Crabes Terribles (2014), Darren Has a Breakdown and Champion of the
World (2012).



Nir Kitaro - ACTOR
Nir plays the role of long suffering neighbour Faizan. 
Nir has had great success, playing various roles in short
films, American TV pilots and several theatre productions such as Avenue Q a major theatrical hit.



The Impact



While there have been great strides made in the comedy world with women in film, there is still a lack of representation in the comedy world for women of colour.
Our project is important as it shows that series about women of colour, and people of colour in general, do not have to have race as the over arching theme in order to be popular or worthy of viewing.
Our series is in many ways a romantic comedy, but with a racially diverse cast of characters and a quirky black woman at the forefront. This is important as its important to give characters of colour the same range of representation as white characters are afforded in media.
Our campaign is also providing work experience for youth in our local area for ages 16 and over to help them with their CV's and spark a love for filmmaking that could last a life time.

What Have You Got Done So Far?
Earlier this year we opened a mini gofundme campaign to get money to shoot our first two episodes, plus some excerpts from other episodes that could be used to form a trailer. With £400 pounds we spent two days shooting those scenes and have now cut them together in our trailer. With the extra money not only can we produce the rest of our episodes but also do more thorough post production on our footage which was not completely possible due to limited funds.
In addition to this we have launched accounts on Twitter, Facebook AND Instagram. Have THREE different sets of poster art to choose from. And recorded an original theme song for our series. We have been hard at work for months and we don't expect any of that to stop any time soon. We had our first production meeting back in August and we've been working towards this ever since. So, you can definitely see we're committed and have thought this project out . . . a lot!


    Risks & Challenges
Every crowdfunding campaign has its challenges. For some it's their schedule of sending out perks. For others it's the wave of panic when their campaign goes so viral they don't know what to do with themselves or the extra cash that has come rolling in.
We are prepared for both instances. 
In the wonderful instance that you guys get us over that 100% mark, don't fret about where that extra money's going. No one here is going to be off buying big mansions. All extra money will go towards a SECOND season of our show. We love these characters and we know they have so many more exciting and funny storyline's for you all to enjoy. If we get over our goal, we'll store that money away so hopefully next time, we will ask for hardly anything or even better yet, we won't have to ask for anything at all. 
    Other Ways YOU Can Help We know not everyone can contribute and guess what? That's totally okay! There are other ways to help us reach our goal which won't make any kind of impact on your bank account. Here are some of those ways:  Tell people about how much you love our campaign. Tell your co-workers, your mom, that cute guy at the coffee shop who kinda looks like Chris Evans. Who knows? They may be as excited for it as you (and us!) and end up donating! Share our campaign on Twitter, Facebook and other social media!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Synopsis

The Favela Pacification Program was launched in 2008 to reduce crime and drug trafficking in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. In April 2015 however, police shot and killed 10-year old Eduardo de Jesus in Complexo-do-Alemão, causing uproar in that community. Alemão and other pacified communities began to realise that the program had become the very thing it was designed to destroy.
Taking place in the build to the 2016 Olympic Games, this is the side of Rio that you have never seen before.


The Directors

David Morris

I have been a filmmaker and Human Rights Campaigner for several years. Upon hearing the story of Eduardo and visiting the favelas of Rio, I struggled to understand why a place such as Complexo-do-Alemão could be host to such horrific stories. I felt a connection and once the opportunity to help became a reality, I jumped with both feet it, to do what I could.

BIO: Originally from Dublin, Ireland, David has several years of industry experience having pitched, directed and produced multiple projects for some of the biggest artists and organisations in the world, receiving a 'Best Director' award, 'Excellence in Teaching' nomination, as well as a Meteor Music Video Award Nomination. In 2014 David launched Script 2 Screen Media in the UK and grew rapidly into South Korea, mainland Europe and Brazil. With a strong belief in making each experience personal and bespoke, David brings his passion, optimism and creative vision as it radiates through his work and his colleagues. 

Angelica Melo

I have been filming in the favelas of Rio for several years, I had a collection of horror stories from a large number of people who lost their loved ones to the war on drugs. For me, 7 years is enough, I had to share these stories, I had to help people in the favelas to find their own voice.

BIO: An experience producer, interpreter and fixer, Angelica Mel has worked on a diverse range of projects for clients including YAHOO! Dubai, Discovery Channel, Michelin and the Danish Broadcasting Corporation. Bilingual in Portuguese and English, she founded Maruti Blue Productions in 2008 working on projects in Brazil. Angelica now works as a film producer, managing large-scale crews, and researching stories, scouting locations and arranging every aspect of filming logistics. Her network of resource providers and local experts has grown exponentially, along with the demand from international filmmakers for her services. Her company is S2S Media's official Brazilian partner. 
www.marutiblue.com

What we hope to achieve

Our project is designed to help generate awareness and inspire change to the growing War on Drugs in the Favela's of Rio de Janeiro that are currently undergoing Pacification. The Favela Pacification Programme is fierce, breaking multiple Human Rights laws in a country where someone dies every 10-minutes as a result of the War on Drugs, and the police kill every 3 hours.

The project completely and independently produced by S2S Media and Maruti Blue Productions, having already invested upwards of $30 000 of our own money, allowing the freedom to explore and challenge existing representations of the favela communities in Rio. 

With reviews and articles stretching from Singapore, Czech Republic and the UK, to Brazil, USA and Canada, we are slowly drawing eyes beyond the postcard image of Rio to the often miss-represented 'dark side'. 

Here lies our opportunity, in Olympic year, to show the true impact of the Olympic Games, Pacification and lack of Government responsibility on these impoverished communities who continue to fight for justice, for their right to peace and to make the world aware of the living conditions enforced on them by the War on Drugs. 

Fundamentally, this documentary is not here to provide all the answers, but instead hopes to allow voices to be heard, to begin conversations by simply asking the right questions that - in time - will hopefully lead to resolutions. So, if you want justice, then please please please donate to help bring our film to the world!


What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $16 000 to help cover the following:

1. Our Global Premiere at the Odeon Theatre in Rio de Janeiro taking place on June 23rd. This will include organisation of international media, exhibitions of the work done by Human Rights campaigners in the Favela's of Rio and marketing to help generate as much awareness about the film and the issues represented within it ($3250).

2. Music Licences for our film have been offered to us at significantly discounted rates totalling $4000. A High-Profile soundtrack that embodies music spanning over 6 decades helps emphasise the length of time the struggles and issues represented in the film have been occurring. 

3. Certification and Classification is required in both Brazil and the UK to help distribute our film via Video-On-Demand (Global) services and DVD (Europe Only). The BBFC in the UK for example charge by the minute, as well as a one-off fee, meaning that to obtain legal permission to distribute in the UK and Europe can cost upwards of £3000 ($5000). 

4. Independent screenings with QnA's to help educate students and residents in the Favela's of Rio about the wider context of the issues they are currently encased in. This will help create a greater understanding, helping Human Rights campaigners of protests to channel their cause to more specific aspects of the issues ($2750). 

5. The final $1000 will help with any surprises along the way, ensuring we have a back-up fund for any disaster!

If we fail to raise the full amount, it will not prevent us from achieving our overall aims however, it may mean we simply might not be able to spread our message as far as we hope. Rest-assured Angel and David have been, and will continue to, work 24/7 to help raise awareness and every penny will be stretched as far as possible to aid this.

Our perks offer a unique opportunity to get involved and to take a piece of our film and bring it into your very own home. As well as this, every contribution generate change, and it is important that everyone is acknowledged for your hard work and hard-earned money that you are so willing to donate to this cause. As you can see from the perks, we are determined to make every member of this production valued and celebrated - so have a good look at each perk and see which one suits you - as we said before, every single penny goes a long way.


The Impact

Having already shot the majority of our footage, we have been fortunate enough to have multiple interviews with Terezinha de Jesus, the mother of 10-year old Eduardo (who was shot and killed on April 2nd 2015). Terezinha has become an icon for the people against the FPP (Favela Pacification Programme) having been featured consistently throughout Amnesty International's content. Terezinha is a friend to the filmmakers and has provided us with a raw insight on the subject area of her son’s death, the troubles in the favelas and her own struggle.

Beyond this, we have also interviewed a whistleblower from the Police in Rio, a Colonel called Íbis. He has taken great personal risk to speak with us, sharing his insight on the issues within the favela of Alemão and the pacification program as a whole. He has agreed to allow us use of his image and full name in the hope of inspiring others within the police to speak up about the ongoing war on drugs.

Two former drug traffickers in Rio de Janeiro also agreed to an interview, one of whom was a published writer at the age of 16, the other a father. Their personalities are strong, their viewpoints are educated and extremely valuable to understanding all aspects of the War on Drugs and the impact of the Pacification Programme.

Raull is a human rights activist based in Alemão. He has organised various protests both on the night of Eduardo’s death, as well as consistently throughout the year. His politics are current and deeply routed; his passion is very much supported by the local community, as well as Amnesty International. In recent weeks his friends and family have been receiving threats from the Police to prevent him gathering further support.

Tiago is a photojournalist operating out of Rio. He accompanies the Police on raids, as well as providing media coverage to various media outlets in Brazil to help raise awareness on the social issues in the favelas of Rio.

There are a series of other interviews that we have already collected that will form a small part of the documentary but certainly Terezinha, Ibis, The Guys (Drug Traffickers) Tiago and Raull are the 5 main cornerstones of the documentary cut together with given footage and various images captured as part of our filming days in Rio.

The content is there, the rough cut is assembled and we are almost at the stage to present our work to the world. We have already shown our film privately in test-screenings to press and Universities around the World. Initial responses are positive, having received some excellent reviews. You can read articles about the issues, as well as reviews and live interviews the Directors have taken part in via the links below:

LINK 1: Estûdio Í, Globo News LIVE Interview conducted on April 7 2016 (In Portuguese) - http://g1.globo.com/…/documentario-conta-a-histori…/4941065/

LINK 2: RioOnWatch Free Media Website Article/Review (In English) - http://www.rioonwatch.org/?p=27912

LINK 3: Czech Republic Radio Interview and Article (In Czech - English version coming soon) - http://www.rozhlas.cz/zpravy/film/_zprava/novy-dokument-o-pacifikaci-odhaluje-odvracenou-stranu-ria-de-janeira--1599596


O Outro Lado Do Cartão-Postal/The Other Side of the Postcard (Morris & Melo, 2016) – Review by Chloe McMahon (UK)

In the pursuit of justice, Morris and Melo delve into the fractured underbelly of Rio, exposing what the picturesque postcard struggles to hide.

“There is no escape,” claims an activist. These words drape over the favelas of Rio like a never-ending omen, trapping its inhabitants in a world where the value of a human life is so easily disregarded. Indeed, it drapes over the documentary itself, channelling through each facet of the community from the drug traffickers to the grieving mothers of deceased children.

This harrowing account of the slums begins unexpectedly with what seems like a playful cartoon aimed at children. Bright colours, an informative voiceover and stimulating animation make up the ingredients of what is expected of a primary school educational video. However, there is a deeply saddening reason as why the narrative is constructed in this way. Concluding with animated splatters of blood and racing bullets, this prelude communicates clearly how involved children are in the crossfire of favela conflict. Innocence seems obsolete in a corrupted environment.

One such victim is 10-year-old Eduardo who was shot dead by law enforcers in the spring of 2015. Morris and Melo follow his mother as she fights for justice against the Brazilian court. What is haunting about her story is not the events that unfolded but the composure she maintains when explaining it. The camera lingers on her like an uncomfortable spectator, capturing her emptiness of emotion and sense of loss. There is an exhaustion in her words that resonates among the favelas. With 60,000 Brazilians dying a year, Eduardo’s death comes sadly as normality within the slums.


Risks & Challenges

One of our most fundamental challenges is Safety for our Subjects and Film Crew based in Rio de Janeiro. With support from Human Rights groups, as well as developing high-profile awareness around the film protects the entire team from overly-aggressive attacks from authorities in Rio. With this taken into consideration however, it is simply impossible to completely protect ourselves from any potential attack from either side of the Drugs War. 

Finances are also a challenge as we are completely independent and free from any larger media influence, we make every penny go as far as we can. This also means that we rely on the help and support of our family, friends and kind-hearted strangers to help support our film and generate the awareness these issues so desperately need. Through this crowd-funding campaign, these challenges present a much reduced risk, so thank you!

Finally, obtaining classification in various countries will prove difficult, given the graphic and honest content in the film. We have developed a strategic distribution and marketing plan that will allow us to bring the film to our primary target market through the use of Social Media, Independent Media and Online Distribution channels. This has also been helped by the excellent support from the Odeon in Rio de Janeiro, who have offered us a large-scale Premiere at their 99-year old theatre, followed by a week-long theatrical release in the same theatre. This kind act alone means that up 4000 people in the city of Rio will have the opportunity to watch this film - so the funds raised from this campaign will play a significant role in our marketing plan and getting those seats filled!


Other Ways You Can Help

Obviously we understand that most people aren't made of money - we aren't! That's why we are asking for help. But that doesn't mean you still can't help us. If you would like to get involved in the production, then get in touch via info@s2s-media.com. Your support might be something as simple as sharing our crowd funding campaign amongst your family and friends or on social media, maybe you could write a review for us, organise a screening at your University or in your local community, share our website and social media pages (all those 'likes' on Facebook fill everyone who has worked on this documentary so far with hope and greater determination - we cannot tell you how great it feels to know our message is being heard!). 

So use the sharing tools on this page, the website www.s2s-media.com or on Facebook.com/OutroLadoCartaoPostal. 


Finally, if you've made it to this part of the page we just want to throw you a big THANK YOU for taking your time to read what we have to say. We hope it inspires you to donate, or maybe even get out there and fight for your own personal causes!

story:
Short Summary

This is the story of a small neighborhood in the Hollywood Hills of Los Angeles.

A neighborhood with big Ideals. Ideals of Integration, tolerance, community, architecture, design and progressive politics.

It was created in the 1950’s on the concept of an integrated housing cooperative by a group of friends that included Garrett Eckbo who is now widely considered the father of modern landscape design.

"Wonderland Park" film unravels the complex history of this community through the colorful storytelling of it's residents past and present.

The film looks at the architectural and social significance of the integrated housing cooperative model the neighborhood was founded upon. And how that has changed over time and its relevance today.  We speak to social commentators, architectural experts and historians. 

Also we look at the design revolution taking place in the 50's especially in California which was seen as a region that pioneered modernist forms of living. The neighborhood has classic examples of Midcentury architecture by Pierre Koenig  (Case Study house No. 21), Philip Kimmelman and Buff & Hensman.

The neighborhood attracted people who were socially engaged and progressive and we hear  residents stories beginning in the era of McCarthyism.

Some of the extraordinary people who lived here are fondly spoken of by residents and where possible the film sheds light on who they were.

influential characters.

JERRY BROWN, ELLEN DEGENERES, PAUL SCHRADE, OSCAR FISHINGER, MILT HOLLAND, DOUGLAS KIRKLAND, TIMOTHY LEARY, GARRETT ECKBO, PHIL KIRBY, IRVING RAVETCH, JULIANNE MOORE

 

 PROGRESSIVENESS, ARCHITECTURE & DESIGN , COMMUNITY.

The look and concept of the midcentury architecture and landscape design will surely change in time as will the community values of the 1950's. There are few original residents left and we are happy to have completed the filmed interviews with them. 

It was a very tight knit neighborhood with a strong sense of community which is increasingly rare in America today.

Make it happen! Support this entertaining and educational film about a very special community in Los Angeles.

 

How your support makes it happen.

  • Shooting
  •  The budget is set at $35.000.  
  •  $19000.00 shooting budget / Two Camera Crew and Sound Mixer / Equipment Rental                                                                                                                                                                        
  • Post Production 
  •  $5000.00 Editing
  •  $3000.00 Archival footage and music clearance.
  •  $4000.00  Sound mixing
  • $5000.00 color grading     

  • Perks

  • When you contribute funding to this film you get some great perks in return. There is a portrait sitting (4 available) with David Ash in a studio in LA. There are  several limited edition photographic prints available as Perks see image of Lake Hollywood below.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        

  • We started filming interviews at the end of June 2016 and have filmed 14 interviews so far. All money raised will go towards completing this 45 minute documentary film and will make it possible to film the remaining 4-5 interviews and film extensive B roll footage of architecture scenery of the neighborhood.                                      ​                                         

  • Money raised will cover all the post production and make a huge difference to how long it takes to complete. We are committed to making the film no matter what!                                                                                          
  • EXPERIENCE
  • David Ash is an award winning photographer and has worked with many of of the worlds leading magazines and ad agencies. David's work has been exhibited widely and his Portrait work is in the collection of The National Portrait Gallery of great Britain.    
  • Other Ways You Can Help. If you are unable to donate to our campaign today, please help us by sharing it around with your friends and family-use the indiegogo share tools. Every little bit helps!
story_txt:
Short Summary
This is the story of a small neighborhood in the Hollywood Hills of Los Angeles.
A neighborhood with big Ideals. Ideals of Integration, tolerance, community, architecture, design and progressive politics.
It was created in the 1950’s on the concept of an integrated housing cooperative by a group of friends that included Garrett Eckbo who is now widely considered the father of modern landscape design.
"Wonderland Park" film unravels the complex history of this community through the colorful storytelling of it's residents past and present.The film looks at the architectural and social significance of the integrated housing cooperative model the neighborhood was founded upon. And how that has changed over time and its relevance today.  We speak to social commentators, architectural experts and historians. Also we look at the design revolution taking place in the 50's especially in California which was seen as a region that pioneered modernist forms of living. The neighborhood has classic examples of Midcentury architecture by Pierre Koenig  (Case Study house No. 21), Philip Kimmelman and Buff & Hensman.The neighborhood attracted people who were socially engaged and progressive and we hear  residents stories beginning in the era of McCarthyism.Some of the extraordinary people who lived here are fondly spoken of by residents and where possible the film sheds light on who they were.influential characters.JERRY BROWN, ELLEN DEGENERES, PAUL SCHRADE, OSCAR FISHINGER, MILT HOLLAND, DOUGLAS KIRKLAND, TIMOTHY LEARY, GARRETT ECKBO, PHIL KIRBY, IRVING RAVETCH, JULIANNE MOORE  PROGRESSIVENESS, ARCHITECTURE & DESIGN , COMMUNITY.The look and concept of the midcentury architecture and landscape design will surely change in time as will the community values of the 1950's. There are few original residents left and we are happy to have completed the filmed interviews with them. It was a very tight knit neighborhood with a strong sense of community which is increasingly rare in America today.Make it happen! Support this entertaining and educational film about a very special community in Los Angeles. 
How your support makes it happen.

Shooting
 The budget is set at $35.000.  
 $19000.00 shooting budget / Two Camera Crew and Sound Mixer / Equipment Rental                                                                                                                                                                        

Post Production 
 $5000.00 Editing
 $3000.00 Archival footage and music clearance.
 $4000.00  Sound mixing
$5000.00 color grading     
Perks
When you contribute funding to this film you get some great perks in return. There is a portrait sitting (4 available) with David Ash in a studio in LA. There are  several limited edition photographic prints available as Perks see image of Lake Hollywood below.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
We started filming interviews at the end of June 2016 and have filmed 14 interviews so far. All money raised will go towards completing this 45 minute documentary film and will make it possible to film the remaining 4-5 interviews and film extensive B roll footage of architecture scenery of the neighborhood.                                      ​                                         
Money raised will cover all the post production and make a huge difference to how long it takes to complete. We are committed to making the film no matter what!                                                                                          


EXPERIENCE
David Ash is an award winning photographer and has worked with many of of the worlds leading magazines and ad agencies. David's work has been exhibited widely and his Portrait work is in the collection of The National Portrait Gallery of great Britain.    

Other Ways You Can Help. If you are unable to donate to our campaign today, please help us by sharing it around with your friends and family-use the indiegogo share tools. Every little bit helps!

story:
About the Film


Landfall  is the new feature film from Australian writer/director Travis Bain of Sapphire Pictures. Landfall  is an intense crime thriller/disaster movie aimed at a worldwide release in 2017/2018. It will run approximately 90 minutes.


Synopsis

A young couple in tropical Australia, Dylan and Maisie, is trapped in their beach house by three desperate fugitives carrying a mysterious box containing unknown contents, and they must rely on their wits and cunning to survive as a severe tropical cyclone looms.

Inspired by classic film noirs, Landfall  is chock-full of twists, suspense, and some very nasty weather.


What we're asking for

We believe quality feature films don't have to cost millions of dollars. We need just $30,000 (or more) to make Landfall  a solid piece of entertainment. We already own all our own camera, sound and editing gear, so this budget will allow us to cover other costs such as:

  • Cast & crew.
  • Props.
  • Costumes.
  • Transport to and from location.
  • Catering.
  • Visual and practical effects to bring the cyclone to life.
  • Commissioning a cool poster from genius Brazilian artist Juarez Ricci (see his amazing Throwback  poster below).
  • An original music score by the talented Cairns composer Samantha van der Sluis.
  • Submissions to film festivals.
  • Travel and registration for the American Film Market in November 2016, where we hope to sell Landfall  to international cinema and DVD distributors!


What you get in return

To thank you for supporting our film, we'll give you cool rewards based on how much you contribute, rewards such as:

  • Access to private updates, including video diaries, photos and more.
  • A personal thankyou in the credits.
  • A download of the finished movie.
  • Seats at the private cast and crew screening, well in advance of the film's public release.
  • A download of the shooting script.
  • Exceptional local and international exposure for your business or brand if you choose the business sponsorship reward
  • Downloads of the original soundtrack by Samantha van der Sluis.
  • Naming rights to one of the characters.
  • Tickets to the gala Cairns premiere.
  • An Executive Producer credit.

And lots more!


Our timeline

We've already mapped out our game plan for Landfall, and it goes like this:

  • July 2016: we'll start filming Landfall  at a stunning Queensland beach house.
  • November 2016: after months of editing, we'll submit the finished cut of Landfall  to one of the world's major international film festivals: the South By Southwest Film Festival. Submissions to many more festivals, such as the Toronto International Film Festival and the TriBeCa Film Festival, will follow in 2017. If Landfall  gets accepted into one of these prestigious festivals, our chances of getting a worldwide DVD/Blu-ray distribution deal will increase dramatically. Also around this time, we'll present the finished film to prospective distributors and sales agents at the annual American Film Market in Santa Monica, California.
  • 2017 and beyond: Landfall  will either screen at a cinema near you, or it'll become available for you to watch on DVD/Blu-ray, or both! That is our goal.

Who's in the movie?

We're lining up some great actors for Landfall.

Legendary Aussie badass Vernon Wells from Mad Max 2, Commando  and our previous feature Throwback  has signed on to play a major character: Sergeant Wexler, a veteran cop with a troubled past.



And if we hit our target, we'll be able to cast not one but TWO other famous actors in Landfall,  whose identities will be revealed if we pass the $30,000 mark. These actors are well-known for their film and TV work spanning many decades, and they've already agreed to jump on board Landfall  if we hit our target ... so let's hit our target!!!

Who we are

We’re Sapphire Pictures, an independent production company based in Cairns, Australia, headed by award-winning filmmaker Travis Bain, who recently made the low-budget monster movie Throwback.  Here's the trailer:



And the poster by artist Juarez Ricci:


Throwback  screened at a dozen international film festivals and it's now available on DVD and Blu-ray worldwide. Check out these review quotes:

"A rousing good yarn and very entertaining. For a mad monster movie, it's played fairly seriously and works well for it ... a little gem." - Fleapitcinema.uk.

"Throwback  is a fun creature feature" - Infernalcinema.com.

"Throwback  is an adventure/monster B-movie that is chock full of charm." - HorrorCultFilms.co.uk.

"Everything you need in a good Bigfoot film." - Horrorhound Magazine.

"Impressed the hell out of me ... what Throwback  accomplishes is nothing less than extraordinary." - Fakeshemp.net.

"Throwback  is highly recommended for fans of the Bigfoot subgenre, and independent cinema in general." - LaptopZombie.co.uk.

"Exceptional ... you are literally on the edge of your seat throughout and it announces Travis Bain as one of Australia’s most promising directors." - SubcultureEntertainment.com.

"This is a damn good monster movie" - The Fifth Dimension blog.


Our 2015 short film Little Nippers  has also done well, screening at film festivals around Australia and winning awards.


And we're also developing a sci-fi/horror feature entitled Starspawn, an epic story which will begin with the short prequel film Starspawn: Overture, successfully crowdfunded in 2015. Starspawn: Overture  starts filming in April 2016 and will be made available on YouTube after its film festival run. Landfall  is the project that will keep us busy and sharp while we're seeking the finance for Starspawn.


People who have seen our films have said the same thing over and over: "Imagine what these guys would be capable of if they had a bigger budget." We couldn't agree more! We're ready to step up to the next level. Will you help us get there?

story:
My name is Charles Mitchell. Here is a little bit on me:
   I was raised, quite literally, in movie theaters. My mother and father met while working in a movie theater together. They owned several theaters such as Movies At the Mall in Flagstaff, Arizona and The Majestic Theater in Streator, IL. Add on the fact that my great great uncle was the legendary horror movie actor Vincent Price, it makes quite the combination and because of these things I have a strong love for movies and have a stronger passion to make them. 

VENGEFUL is a first person short horror film. After narrowly avoiding a strange woman in the road, a young man by the name of Luke goes in search of his girlfriend whom mysteriously vanished after the crash. What he discovers is both horrifying...yet familiar. The film will be shot entirely in first person, giving the viewer a closer more intimate and horrifying experience. 

CONCEPT SHOTS VIDEO


The funds we receive from this funding will help us invest in better equipment to make the film, as well as paying for the talent, location, and catering service to help feed our people. We have included a graph below showing how we would alocate the funds raised.

This is the first film that will be created by our parent production company, Winter Winds Production. We have big plans for future projects, that includes an original feature film horror series with the working title being "COLD SILENCE". We plan on creating not only short and feature length film, but also original web-series.

We will also be looking to help other artists get noticed and become the best they can be. This includes musical talents, painters, drawers, actors and everything under the word "ART". We are made up of these kinds of people and love getting more to join our ranks.

As with every project, obstacles arise. As these things are unforeseen and usually not counted on, we can not say for certain they wont happen. But we can guarantee that should one arise we will meet it head on and over come it. We won't let anything stop us from making the films we love

story:
Short Summary

"The Same Coin" is about three women who find themselves involved in the escorting business--Tiffany by force,  Liz by choice, and Raq in an act of desperation.

Last year, I shot a concept trailer for this project and posted it on my website. A woman who used to be an escort reached out to me in hopes to have her story told. This woman then helped me get in touch with other escorts, and I began interviewing them.

A year later, we are now developing a pilot episode for this web series project. I've already written the script, completed casting, and am prepared to Direct. I could very well handle the Cinematography, Sound and lighting myself, and save money on hiring a crew. However, as confident as I am in my ability to get the job done by any means necessary, the project would be better off with a creative team.


What We Need & What You Get

We have an amazing cast and are assembling an awesome crew.  I have some funds that will enable me to pay my cast a fair day rate, and lock down the necessary locations. However, in order to have a dedicated crew, I will require more funds to budget for their day rates and equipment.

Shooting this pilot will take 9 days, and as I've been interviewing for crew positions these are the average day rates of those that I wish to hire:

  • Director of Photography- responsible for capturing the look of the project through the camera. $200/day
  • Gaffer- responsible for lighting every angle and scene of the project. $100/day
  • Location Audio- responsible for recording and mixing all audio on location. $100/day
  • I will be Directing, Managing the Project, and handling the Production Design. One of the lead actors is also a Make-up Artist. We will be collaborating to put together the right looks for each character.
Your generosity will be rewarded in a variety of ways that will make you a key member of our team. Select from any of the perks you see here. Some are exclusive so if you see something that catches your eye, don't hesitate to make an early selection!


The Impact

Crizlassic Productions seeks to tell visual stories deeply rooted in truth. We are not seeking to exploit anyone, we are just telling real human stories. This project does have risque subject matter on the surface, but we are depicting personal stories, not fantasy erotica. Escorting is a choice that some make for a variety of reasons, and too often we as society shame these women without knowing the whole story. The Same Coin will tell these stories in an accurate and engaging way.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute to this project's funding at this time, but still wish to help, here are a few ways:

  • Allow us to use your property as a shooting location for the pilot or a future episode (NYC and Northern NJ locations only).
  • Feed us with your positive energy (and food if you care to share).
  • Contribute your creative talents if interested!
  • Support us by sharing the link to this campaign. Exposure is valuable! 

Thank you for taking the time to check out this project. We look forward to bringing "The Same Coin" to you soon!

story:
Es Mi Mamá


Es Mi Mamá es un documental sobre la relación amor-odio entre la Mamá de la Directora y su Abuela. 
En el documental se presenciará una Constelación Familiar, que es una terapia alternativa dirigida hacia la Mamá de la Directora. Personas desconocidas representarán a familiares y en especial a la Abuela y percibirán sensaciones de a quiénes representan. 
Necesitamos de tu ayuda para recaudar el presupuesto y cubrir los gastos que el Documental requiere.

 
 

Más detalles:  

 
    El documental cuenta con un presupuesto de $1000. Éste está destinado a cubrir la comida de los 15 integrantes del crew por 4 días, equipo de fotografía, iluminación y sonido, gasolina y pago a los personajes. 
  • La recompensa para los que donen más dinero es: 
  •  Entrada a la inauguración y Clausura del Festival Ícaro 2016, que es dónde se proyectará el documental.
  • Entrada a la proyección del Documental.
  • Souvenirs del documental como tazas y bolsas. 
  • Tu nombre saldrá como PRODUCTOR EJECUTIVO, en los créditos. De esta manera te daremos tu mención merecida por apoyarnos. 
  • La idea de este crowdfunding masivo, es que todos se sientan parte del proyecto. 
    •  
 

El impacto

 

Gracias a tu contribución el Documental será de mayor calidad y de esa manera tendrá más posibilidades de ser enviado a Festivales Internacionales. 

  • Consideramos que el tema es trascendental y tiene mucho potencial para representar a Guatemala internacionalmente.  
  • El crew que está involucrado ya está trabajando profesionalmente en el ámbito audiovisual de Guatemala. De ésta manera nos comprometemos a realizar un trabajo serio y de calidad. 
  • Tu aporte será un incentivo para el Crew y para la comunidad estudiantil de Audiovisuales, ya que será evidente el apoyo de los guatemaltecos y extranjeros al artista nacional. 
 

Riesgos y desafíos

En todo proyecto audiovisual se encuentran obstáculos y riesgos, esa es una de las cosas que más nos emociona como cineastas. Estar dispuestos a enfrentar cualquier cosa que se nos presente pero eso no nos detiene, porque la meta es terminar el documental y que los espectadores reciban lo que esperan, un audiovisual profesional. 
 
  • Nos destacamos por encontrar soluciones y no problemas.
  • Todo lo que sucederá será para tener más experiencia y aprender.
  • El trabajo en equipo siempre será un reto.
 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 

Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar:

  
  • Ayúdanos a compartir la campaña, de esa manera más personas se enteran y colaboran.
  • Cuéntale a tu amigos, familiares, etc. que hay personas haciendo cine en Guatemala y que es el momento perfecto de ayudar al arte guatemalteco. 
  • Recuerda que cada $ que aportes, es un granito de arena para cumplir nuestra meta. 
    •
story_txt:
Es Mi Mamá
Es Mi Mamá es un documental sobre la relación amor-odio entre la Mamá de la Directora y su Abuela. En el documental se presenciará una Constelación Familiar, que es una terapia alternativa dirigida hacia la Mamá de la Directora. Personas desconocidas representarán a familiares y en especial a la Abuela y percibirán sensaciones de a quiénes representan. Necesitamos de tu ayuda para recaudar el presupuesto y cubrir los gastos que el Documental requiere.
  Más detalles:  
 El documental cuenta con un presupuesto de $1000. Éste está destinado a cubrir la comida de los 15 integrantes del crew por 4 días, equipo de fotografía, iluminación y sonido, gasolina y pago a los personajes. 


La recompensa para los que donen más dinero es: 
 Entrada a la inauguración y Clausura del Festival Ícaro 2016, que es dónde se proyectará el documental.
Entrada a la proyección del Documental.
Souvenirs del documental como tazas y bolsas. 
Tu nombre saldrá como PRODUCTOR EJECUTIVO, en los créditos. De esta manera te daremos tu mención merecida por apoyarnos. 
La idea de este crowdfunding masivo, es que todos se sientan parte del proyecto.  

 El impacto Gracias a tu contribución el Documental será de mayor calidad y de esa manera tendrá más posibilidades de ser enviado a Festivales Internacionales. 


Consideramos que el tema es trascendental y tiene mucho potencial para representar a Guatemala internacionalmente.  

El crew que está involucrado ya está trabajando profesionalmente en el ámbito audiovisual de Guatemala. De ésta manera nos comprometemos a realizar un trabajo serio y de calidad. 
Tu aporte será un incentivo para el Crew y para la comunidad estudiantil de Audiovisuales, ya que será evidente el apoyo de los guatemaltecos y extranjeros al artista nacional. 

 Riesgos y desafíosEn todo proyecto audiovisual se encuentran obstáculos y riesgos, esa es una de las cosas que más nos emociona como cineastas. Estar dispuestos a enfrentar cualquier cosa que se nos presente pero eso no nos detiene, porque la meta es terminar el documental y que los espectadores reciban lo que esperan, un audiovisual profesional. 
 
Nos destacamos por encontrar soluciones y no problemas.
Todo lo que sucederá será para tener más experiencia y aprender.
El trabajo en equipo siempre será un reto.

 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar:  
Ayúdanos a compartir la campaña, de esa manera más personas se enteran y colaboran.
Cuéntale a tu amigos, familiares, etc. que hay personas haciendo cine en Guatemala y que es el momento perfecto de ayudar al arte guatemalteco. 
Recuerda que cada $ que aportes, es un granito de arena para cumplir nuestra meta.

story:
I am 36, working in an office, running twice a week, bla-bla, bla-bla, like everyone. But one day I went to see the doctor with my knee problems. He said that had not been a big deal I could run a Marathon once, but only once.

So I decided to find the most spectacular Marathon race in Europe. And I found the MidnightSun Marathon in Tromsö, far North, beyond the Arctic Cirle. I would like to thank for the wonderful MSM team who support me with a free registration for the Race!

I have a Zastava, an old, Yugoslavian car so I decided to spend three (maybe four?) weeks driving throu Europe. From Budapest, Hungary it is more than 7.000 kilometers to reach Tromsö and come back. 

The car has 42 horsepower, designed by italians, made in Yugoslavia in 1987. We love each other!  It is repaired by my own hands because the Zastava Factory does not exist any more. Neither does Yugoslavia at all.  I hope he will enjoy our journey to the Arctic Circle to see the Sun at mindnight in Tromsö. And I really hope that he will carry my ass back to Hungary!


The main part of the project is to promote and support the Camp of Courage Fundation. Each contribution contains a part which goes to charity.

“The Bátor Tábor is a machine into which children are thrown sick and tired, and they come out much happier and healthier, filled with experiences” – Peti, 15 year old, camper living with cancer.

The Bátor Tábor (Camp of Courage) is a small world of miracles where every year 700 children with cancer, diabetes, haemophilia, and JRA receive curative and reinforcing experiences. The camp is a member of SeriousFun Children’s Network, founded by Paul Newman. This association brings together the largest camps dealing with children with diseases all over the world. Similar to them, their sister camps in the USA, Ireland, Italy, England and Israel help children in need with the method of therapeutic recreation.

“Doctors gave back my life, then the Bátor Tábor gave back my passion for it." – Dóri, camper

http://batortabor.hu/en/about-us/

https://www.facebook.com/truenorthproject2016

https://www.instagram.com/true_north_project

story:
For most of my life, I was not comfortable sharing with my friends and colleagues that I was diagnosed with Asperger’s Syndrome when I was five years old. It wasn’t until I was nine years old that my parents sat me down and explained how I was different from the other kids, and I have been overcoming the challenges of Asperger’s ever since.

For those of you who do not know, Asperger’s Syndrome is a social condition that is classified as an Autism Spectrum Disorder  as it shares some of the key symptoms of Autism (difficulty making eye contact, difficulty participating in a conversation, obsessive behaviour and dependence on routine). Despite these challenges, which can make a person with Asperger's seem clumsy or otherwise unintelligent, they can process and interpret information extremely fast and are highly intelligent. When it comes to dating and being in romantic relationships, it’s a whole different world for them.

Even though I can quote films verbatim and was very good at video games as a kid, I struggled throughout my childhood and teen years with making friends and speaking up about what was important to me. Dating was, at one point, something I considered impossible. I was always terrified of saying the wrong thing, or hearing girls tell me "you're weird". Constant rejection in places like High School, College, or University can also leave a lot of us feeling hopeless.

On a more positive note, I learned through my childhood and teen years to overcome most of these challenges, and I became a film-maker as a means to express myself through visual story-telling. I also go on dates as often as I can, which I really enjoy.

I participated in a Self-Expression and Leadership Program in 2015, and from that course, was inspired to create a project that would make a difference for people with Asperger's, whilst staying true to my film-making roots. The concept for the documentary Awkward Love: Dating for People with Asperger's Syndrome was born.

Ever since I started talking about making this film, I have been exploring and researching the issue of what it is like for people with Asperger's to date and be involved in romantic relationships. I conducted a series of on-camera and off-camera interviews, and the footage was cut to make a trailer.

That's when the film started to gain attention from the Asperger's community, other film-makers, the media, and families affected by the spectrum.

I also collaborated with dating coaches Lesley Edwards, Dr. Stephen De Wit, and Laura Bilotta of Single in the City, to create a special seminar called Date Camp for Asperger's, where people on the spectrum came together for an afternoon of learning new social skills, and sharing personal stories. Toronto-based dating coach Layan Bubbly has also expressed interest in being a part of this film, and is excited to make a difference on camera.

Today, I realize now more than ever how important this topic is to many people, and I now have a clear idea of what I want the film to be about - we will tell a story about someone with Asperger's Syndrome who brings together relationship and dating experts to work directly with people on the spectrum to understand how they function in different social arena's and on dates, to inspire them to have the love lives they want and deserve.

Our team needs $10,000 to finish this film and make a difference in the lives of the 68 million people on the planet who are affected by Asperger's on a daily basis.

All donations will go towards film-making necessities;

-  Cinematography and Camera Equipment

-  Audio Equipment and Sound Design

- Editing

-  Colour Correction

-  Distribution to Film-Festivals

The ultimate message of this film is that no matter who you are, or what you deal with, love is the single greatest force that will never disappear.

Your contribution of any amount is greatly appreciated.

Thank you,

Evan Mead

Director/Producer

416-668-1227

evan.mead9219@gmail.com

story:
What is it?

Pedestrian is about a reckless girl that drives home drunk after a night of celebrating, and ends up hitting a pedestrian. Instead of doing the right thing, she attempts to cover up her deadly mistake. However, she is forced to face her guilty conscience, as she is haunted by the consequences of her actions.

What We Need

There's much more to a film then what you see on screen. Your donations will contribute to:

  • Equipment
  • Art Department Needs (i.e. Makeup, Wardrobe, Set Dressings)
  • Feeding the Cast and Crew
  • Permits
  • Transportation
  • And much more!

Nothing you donate will go into our pockets. We love what we do, and want to keep doing it. This is a stepping stone to our future goals, whether it be directing big feature films or producing television shows. When you donate, you are not just covering our crews' morning cup of Joe, you are investing in our future.

The Challenge Ahead

Ahead of us lies four 12-hour shoot days overnight, in the woods with a cast and crew of over 25 people. If that's not a challenge enough, we have to have everything tested and ready in under a month!


Who's involved?


        Saviel Castillo //Director
       

      

        Monika Gobaira // Unit Production Manager


    Trevor Dennis // Director of Photography

    Renna Gardner // 1st Assistant Director


    Shay Lesser // Production Designer


How can you help?

Other than donating, spreading the word about our film helps out just as equally. We want to reach as many people as we can. Follow us on Facebook, Instagram and Snapchat to keep up to date with our progress!

Facebook: Pedestrian Film

Snapchat: pedestrianfilm

Instagram: Pedestrian Film


Thank you for your valuable time and support!

story:
Director's Message

I am the producer/writer/director of The Valley. I followed the traditionally prescribed path for second generation Indian Americans, and studied electrical engineering, making it all the way to a Ph.D.  I worked for many years as an engineer, and then had two daughters.  I wanted to prioritize my time so that I could spend more time with my daughters, so I started a very successful building business, designing and building custom residential homes.  In parallel, I pursued my lifelong passion, and completed a degree in film at San Jose State.  It was not until middle age that I got the opportunity to do what I wanted to do all along.

The story of The Valley evolved from many of my observations and life experiences.  I have witnessed the pressure that young people undergo to meet their parents expectations and its deleterious effects, particularly in the immigrant community.  I have also seen mental health issues ignored because of the stigma and shame associated with them. My brother, a vibrant dynamic person, was struck down with schizophrenia in his late teens.  His constant struggles and the shaming that my family experienced from some in the Indian community is something I will never forget.  He passed away far sooner than he should have.

Filming

Filming has been completed in the silicon valley area.  We were blessed to attract an amazing cast of seasoned actors who give superb performances - Alyy Khan, Suchitra Pillai, Samina Peerzada, Jake T. Austin, Christa B. Allen, David S. Lee and Barry Corbin.  Rising stars Agneeta Thacker, Salma Khan, Hope Lauren and Tom Fox-Davies also give memorable performances.

 

Required Funding

Picture editing is completed and we are currently working on sound and music.  Funds are needed to complete music and final mixing, and for film festivals, advertising and marketing.  With your contribution we can see this movie through to completion and distribution.  

 We require $50,000 to accomplish our goals:

- $6,000 crew/cast payment

- $5,000 audio mix

-$5,000 composer

- $6,000 song license fees 

-$3,000 graphic design

-$25,000 festivals/advertising/promotion

Everyone who has seen the current version of the film says that it is powerful and moving. It still requires sound, music and marketing resources to reach it's full potential and gain distribution.  

I am extremely grateful for any help you can give.  Thank you.

story:
The STORY of CREEP

After coming home from her first year away at college, Olivia finds her family slaughtered in their beds by the mysterious masked "Mr. No Name", plunging her into a deep depression.

In an attempt to distract Olivia during the one year anniversary of the tragedy, her cousin, Izzie, convinces her to travel to their family's river house for the weekend, failing to mention the group of college kids waiting to party back at the cabin. Olivia is furious, but decides to make the best of the weekend, agreeing that distraction may be what she needs the most.

The weekend of distraction takes a dark turn, however, when people start to disappear! Is it Mr. No Name? Or is it a new threat all together? In the end, the true question remains...can Olivia survive the weekend and defeat the true killer before she's consumed by the demons in her own mind?


The STORY of MetFilms Entertainment


                                        

                          www.metfilmsentertainment.com

Founded by Stephanie Metzger in 2012, MetFilms Entertainment produced the horror short SNAP as well as the fantasy feature BOUND, in addition to several other shorts and promos! Stephanie had a camera in her hand in elementary school, later attending Drexel University's Film and Video Production program in Philadelphia before relocating to Ormond Beach, Florida.

CREEP is our latest project and we need your help to bring it to life on the screen! Not your typical horror film, Creep breaks the boundaries of the psychological thriller, tackling depression as a mental villain in the story. Olivia must stand up to the physical threats that surround her, while simultaneously confronting the mental illness that has held her back for months!

Knowing what we now know, Creep is on a much smaller budget than our last venture into feature filmmaking. We used limited locations, less characters, and less pages all together. This will make production easier, quicker, and smoother! Here's an overview of what your contributions will be used for...

  • Costumes, Props, Make-up, and Special Effects
  • Transportation, Equipment, Craft Services, and Production Costs
  • Marketing, Editing, DVD Creation, and Distribution

What We Need & What You Get

Our budget is low, but we still need your help to get there! Below is a breakdown of exactly what we need and where your contributions are going!

  • Costumes - Some characters require multiples of costumes due to blood
  • Props - We need a breakaway oar and several prop weapons
  • SFX - Certain scenes require a good amount of blood and gore
  • Transportation - The main location requires 1 hour of travel/gas (one way)
  • Equipment - Extra batteries and backup cables/ extension cords
  • Craft Services - We need to feed about 15 people for a total of 10 days
  • Production Costs - Unforeseen fees or issues we didn't account for
  • Marketing - After we film, we need to promote and get people excited! We would buy posters, t-shirts, etc.
  • Editing - Any costs during post-production
  • DVD Creation - When we have a final product, we want to put it on DVD!
  • Distribution - Film Festival entry fees, etc.

Check out our awesome PERKS!


The Impact

MetFilms plans to use Creep as a way to show audiences that depression, just like any other villain, can be overcome. Olivia's story is meant to show that, with enough inner strength, one can defeat even the greatest of horrors.

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge MetFilms Entertainment is facing is the budget. The team, while talented and dedicated, also has bills to pay... (another great horror) Creep will only happen with the help of the fans! If we all work together to raise the small amount that we need, we have the potential to create something really special.


Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can afford a monetary contribution but that's OK! Here are a few other ways you could help us bring Creep to life on the screen!

  • Get the word out! Tell your friends and family! Share and like our social media posts! Help us get people as excited as we are!
  • Check out the website and keep an eye out for Cast and Crew calls for the film! We could always use extra hands!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

    • www.metfilmsentertainment.com

Click here to check out our FACEBOOK page!!

Thank You so much!
