  Risks & ChallengesThe main challenge MetFilms Entertainment is facing is the budget. The team, while talented and dedicated, also has bills to pay... (another great horror) Creep will only happen with the help of the fans! If we all work together to raise the small amount that we need, we have the potential to create something really special.
  Other Ways You Can Help Not everyone can afford a monetary contribution but that's OK! Here are a few other ways you could help us bring Creep to life on the screen!  Get the word out! Tell your friends and family! Share and like our social media posts! Help us get people as excited as we are!
Check out the website and keep an eye out for Cast and Crew calls for the film! We could always use extra hands!
 Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools! 

www.metfilmsentertainment.com

Click here to check out our FACEBOOK page!!
Thank You so much!

story:
THE FIXER   -  http://bit.ly/THEFIXERimdb

The FIXER is an ambitious and complex project for an indie/student filmmaker. It had drone shots, car scenes, tracking shots, fight scenes, long takes, gun fights, and even a dog. On top of that it was shot on prime locations in Miami, FL and using RAW in 4K, something that demands not only computer power and state of the art technology, but a lot of storage.

To achieve it, our prep was rather comprehensive: Castings, Call Backs, Rehearsals, Location Scouts, Location Tech Scouts, Story Boards, Gear Tests, more rehearsals, etc. The Pre-Production phase ran through the spring and summer 2016, and Production was from the the fall of 2016 thru spring of 2017.

All spread out during that period, we produced the whole Episode 01  (Pilot) in 14 Days of Principal Photography. Unfortunately we had to compromise three scenes that we couldn't afford,  but that could live without, and were thus put on hold.  With everybody's collaboration, we pulled it off. However, in this expensive business, making the most out of every cent is a must. 

We were very very efficient in Producing this film, whose main purpose is not only to be sold, but to put everyone in the map: showcasing their skills.  Everyone sacrificed and compromised quite a lot, both cast and crew, because they beileve in the project!

Please Check out also the Behind the Scenes Photos Already Uploaded.

And that is why we need you. We need your support to have the movie and concept be sold. The movie is being pitched and in Festivals, studios and networks privately, however, before its officially Premiered, it needs 3 things that literally cant wait: a couple very specific finishing high-tech/advanced work done in Post-Production,  the music and the music rights need to be paid for, and some cash needs to be spent in marketing and promotion at festivals and what not. 

THE TRAILER

http://bit.ly/THEFIXERfacebook

 

Title: THE FIXER

Genre: DRAMA / ACTION

Type:  Pilot

Medium:  Digital HD – 4K

Theme: Whoever digs a pit shall fall into it.
Logline (Season 01): In an office of Karma Fixers a hit man and his colleagues, find themselves entangled, while attempting to rescue his kidnapped daughter from their own boss.

---------

Theme (Pilot):  Your worst enemy can be your best friend, and your best friend your worst enemy.

Logline (Pilot): After fixing another 'regular', Natasha wants to quit yet again. However, Marcus thinks he has a proposal she can't refuse.

Rating:  R  (strong violence, explicit language, sexual content).

***************************************************************************

Masha Silberberg  as NATASHA RUDINOVA

I am a good person. I kill bad guys. I was a child/teen sex slave and Marcus rescued me. He took care of me and trained me. He made me a FIXER. I am Russian, originally, but I don't remember anything from my troubled childhood. I don't want to. It's blocked somewhere back in my mind. I've been killing for more than ten years already. I'm tired of this job. I want a life, a family.

        

Born in a small Siberian town in Russia, Masha was raised in a hard-working class family by her grandmother and her father. In school, she took drama classes and performed in the local theater. Although she was a reserved child, she always enjoyed being on stage and performing for audiences. At the age of 22, Masha earned her Master's degree in Civil Engineering. While attempting to pursue a career as an engineer, fate brought her to the United States, where she followed her true passion in life. Masha is a recent graduate from The Neighborhood Playhouse School of the Theatre. She found her passion for acting when she was 12 years old and is now a professional actress with extensive experience in theatre, film and television. Masha had a pleasure to study with some of the greatest teachers in Miami and New York, that include Gilda Pianelli, Barbara Sloan, Sherman Roberts, Ron Stetson, Gary Gendell to name a few. Aside from being an actress, she also currently serves as the VP of Programming for the distinguished and internationally recognized Wide Screen Film & Music Video Festival, which takes place annually in South Florida. She lives in Hollywood, FL.

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5624458/

 

Noa Lindberg as POLLY DI LUCIA

I have been a bad-ass all my life. I take no bullshit from anybody. I am a street smart and a nerd. I go to school but I'm an outcast. I don't belong to any click, but I can belong to any of them. I am different than most of the kids. I think is my IQ. I'm cocky, I know, but I am a good centered and spiritual being. I hold no prejudice, but I believe the world is fucked up. I am a proud vegan. I want to be like Natasha. She has taught me a lot. She is an inspiration and my role model. I warn you, please don't mess with me.  

         

Noa Lindberg was born in Israel and raised in France. From a very early age, Noa has been recognized as an on-stage performer, a dancer, an actress. In parallel to her Acting training, she graduated with two Master's Degrees: Business and Law. She moved to the US to pursue her dream of becoming an Actress and a Writer. Noa has been fully dedicated to her career and has landed many roles, both lead and supporting, on a diverse set of moving pictures and commercials. Noa speaks English, French, Hebrew, German and some Spanish. She resides in Miami Beach, FL.

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2161081/

http://www.noalindberg.com/

 

Carolina Sauer as ANGELIKA CAMPBELL (DAVINI REALLY)

I am a badass. I can fight like Mike Tyson. My dad, Jebediah is very rich and powerful. I have a sister too. Roxy. I never met my mom because she died when I was born. I work for my dad and help him manage all his businesses. He is a good man. He helps people and he supports companies in their growth. He is very powerful and influential, yet some people seem not to understand his role in this world. I would die for him. I will take his place when he passes. I'm ready already.  

Carolina was born and raised in Miami, FL along with an older brother and an identical twin sister. very artistic early on, Carolina loves to sing, dance classical ballet and jazz. For over 3 years now, she has been working in the industry, but mostly in TV and short films. She permanently trains for TV/ Film with private acting coaches, while balancing out castings and shoots as well. She is a Communications major at FIU. Her identical twin sister, with whom she have appeared in multiple commercials and films, will play Roxy. They both reside in Miami, FL.

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5277917

 

Danny Perez as FRANK DAVINI

I was the first fixer. Marcus and I opened the operation.  He is my father figure, my big brother. My buddy. We met when I killed my real dad in an operation of his. He then spared me, took me, adopted me and trained me to be a fixer. The original fixer. I became as lethal as anyone can be. However, I don't kill anymore. I'm the only fixer ever that has been allowed to retire.  Marcus allowed me to, after a fix of ours went bad. Because of it, my baby daughter went missing and my wife was murdered. Everybody thinks I am dead too. I'm off the grid with a new identity. 100% Retired. Haven't seen him for a while actually.

    

Danny Perez was born in Queens, N.Y. and grew up in Miami, FL. He attended The Stella Adler Academy of Acting in Hollywood, CA. and Graduated The Sanford Meisner Center for the Arts in Los Angeles, CA. After his training Danny began performing in live theater, and continues to make numerous film and television appearances. Theater credits include: Spike Heels (Andrew), Apocalyptic Butterfly (Hank), and Waiting for Lefty (Taxi Driver). With supporting television credits on Dexter (Showtime), Burn Notice (USA Network), and Darkside Miami (Lifetime Movie Network). His most recent lead roles in films include: Deuce, Countervail, Salvador, and The Fixer. He lives in Miami, FL and in Los Angeles, CA.

 

Kurt Andon as MARCUS PATTERNSON

          

Kurt Andon started on a path to being a professional actor in 1967, when he studied with Sandy Meisner at the Neighborhood Playhouse. His first professional acting job was doing a soap opera in 1969. He then acted in multiple NYU student films, and  wrote several stories. Afterwards, he got into the movie-making business, specifically the distribution business, and helped Cannon Films go public. However, he also played parts in several Cannon features, but then moved to Los Angeles to continue furthering his career. He then landed roles in numerous feature films and TV shows, including a film "Cathedral Canyon", which he helped put together. It won the 2014 Palm Beach International Film Festival, and the Jerome AZ Film Festival, both for the people's choice for best film. During the past few years, in-between acting jobs, he has focused helping writer/director Floyd Mutrux get two Rock &  Roll driven musicals to Broadway. “Million Dollar Quartet"  &  "Baby it's You". He resides in Stuart, FL.

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0027964

 

J.J. Crowne as JEBEDIAH CAMPBELL

Human Trafficking is my business. It's my life. I sell humans and human parts to businesses around the world. I am also a philanthropist and a billionaire entrepreneur. I own many businesses around the world, and despite the fact that my portfolio seems diversified, my core business is humans. Think about it.

        

J.J. Crowne is a relative newcomer to screen-acting after retiring from a 30-year career as a criminal trial lawyer.  For most of his adult life, he’s also been a voice-over artist and singer/songwriter with international acclaim for his original music.  His country-rock single “Only Time” rose to the U.S. Top 30 Country Radio Airplay Chart in 2013 and his self-titled album remained in the International Top 10 Folk Radio Airplay Chart for over 2 months.  Within the past two years, J.J. has appeared in over 70 film and television productions - including recurring roles on “Graceland” (USA Network), “Every Witch Way” (Nickelodeon) and “Bajo El Mismo Cielo” (Telemundo).   He currently appears as co-star in 5 indie films shot this year in Miami, in supporting roles in two new TV series, as co-star of a VISA Pre-paid Card national TV spot, as well as narrator of an audiobook (“Managing Bubbie”) with TV legend Linda Lavin and as a British character voice in a new exhibit at the Smithsonian in Washington D.C. He resides in Miami, FL.

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm7484868

 

Kevin Sharpley as COLONEL KAKENGO

I don't believe in anybody. The system is corrupt here and there. Everywhere. People get oppressed without mercy: used, exploited and abused. The current economic systems do not take care of the human being. Humans suffer everywhere, die of hunger and don't even enjoy basic human rights. That's why I fight. I'm willing to give my life  for the cause. Equality for all. Prosperity for all. Justice for all. Equality or Death, that's my motto.

       

Kevin Sharpley holds a bachelor’s degree from the University of Miami with a dual major in motion pictures and psychology in addition to an Associates of Arts degree from Miami Dade College. He was inducted into the Miami Dade College Alumni Hall of Fame in 2014.  His range of work includes films, television, documentary, commercial, music video, multi-media and event video production. In addition, he is an actor and well respected artist, having shown and performed his work in many exhibitions and shows throughout South Florida. Mr. Sharpley currently serves as the Chairman of the Miami Dade County Film and Entertainment Advisory Board apponted by Miami-Dade County Commissioner Dennis C. Moss, as well as the Chairman of the Committee for Community Building for the board.  Mr. Sharpley also has produced and directed many documentaries and television projects.  

Kevin Sharpley has been in the Film and Entertainment industry for over eighteen years and is a member of the Screen Actors Guild. As an actor he has been featured in the hit Fox Family series “S Club 7”, the HBO promo “Tonight”, the Verizon Commercial series “Can You Here Me Now” and in many other films, television shows, commercials and print campaigns (Macy's, Lens Crafters, Kohls, Aeropostle)  throughout his career. He has also been profiled on the PBS series "Art Street" as a featured filmmaker, company owner, organization head and community organizer. In addition he has done public service announcements for the PBS radio program NPR and the PBS member station WLRN. In addition Mr. Sharpley has designed, moderated and emceed many panels, workshops and seminars. This includes an incredible youth workshop for The American Black Film Festival for underserved children featuring Vivica A. Fox, Wendell Pierce and Ronald Lang. Mr. Sharpley is also a respected artist, working in many disciplines. He has traveled internationally as a model for prestigious agencies such as Wilhelmina, Ford, Major and Boss having lived in Europe, 

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5107891/

http://www.kijikmultimedia.com/kevinsharpleybio...

*****************************************************************

*****************************************************************

 

David Calderón Vizcaya -  Writer & Director

David Calderon Vizcaya, was born in Bogotá DC, Colombia in the early 70's. He went to an American-based K-12 school, and already holds an Engineering degree from Universidad de los Andes, and a MA in Economics from New York University. He turned to filmmaking in 2010 when he started to pursue an MFA in film at MIU-Ai in Miami, school from which he transferred to Academy of Art University in San Francisco, CA,  to focus and deepen his MFA film studies on Directing. He already has written, directed and produced a documentary film, and two short films, one of which was an adaptation. Currently, other than working as a freelance filmmaker, he Produced and Directed his thesis film, THE FIXER, based on an original script of his, and is also developing a handful of projects, including fiction features and shorts, documentaries, and TV pilots. He graduated from his MFA in Motion Pictures & Television on May 2017. David is also The Producer and Executive Producer.

6 min directing reel - http://bit.ly/reelDCV

9 min directing reel - http://bit.ly/reelDRCV

credentials - http://bit.ly/resumeDRCV

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm9136193/

 

Carlos J. Ruiz - Cinematographer 

Carlos Ruiz made his name in Venezuela, producing and editing for local and national television shows, as well as a multitude of commercials. He also directed three music videos prior pursuing a career in filmmaking and moving to the United States in 2010, which further bolstered his 11 years of experience as a professional cinematographer, editor, and later on, photographer. Along with working anything from off-road competitions to heavy metal concerts, his notable projects include serving as Editor for award-winning films “3:13” and “The Denied,” which played in the London International Film Festival and the St. Tropez Film Festival. He lives in Miami, FL.

http://www.carlosruizphoto.com/

http://m.imdb.com/name/nm5054053/

 

Tom Criswell - Production Designer

Tom Criswell was born in Caracas, Venezuela and early on he became a visual artist. He attended The Art Institute of Chicago while still in grade school, then graduated from Saint Andrew’s Preparatory School before returning to Venezuela to study graphic design at the Hans Neumann School of Design. Afterwards, he attended classes at Prodiseño and the Federico Brandt School of Fine Arts. He relocated to Miami in 2000 and became very active in the fine arts scene, He found a studio space and was represented several local galleries. He took part in several group and solo shows, and thereafter, he was asked to join the art department of a film crew to work on a television commercial. Such event set into motion a series of continued successful collaborations which developed into a career as an Art Director, Production Designer and Property Master for countless commercials, music videos, short films, feature films and special events.  He already has production design credits for several feature films and has also worked as a prop stylist for photographers such as Annie Leibovitz, Bruce Weber, Nigel Perry, and David LaChapelle. He lives in Miami, FL.

http://www.tomcriswellart.com/classes/

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2161081/

 

Juan Pablo Martinez -Costume Designer

Juan Pablo Martínez was born and raised in Bogotá, Colombia. After spending his senior high school year in Iowa, USA, as a Foreign Exchange Student, he returned to Colombia to study Fashion Design at Taller 5 University, graduating from the 5 year program. He then furthered his education in Milano, Italy studying Patternmaking and Sowing, and then attended Atelier Chardon Savard in Paris; there, he also worked with Christian Lacroix at his prêt-à-porter studio. Back in Colombia, he jump-started his own boutique and produced many fashion shows both nationally and internationally. Nowadays, he is the first Sustainable Fashion Designer in Colombia and his business is expanding internationally, including the USA. Film and Cinema are among his dearest hobbies and passions. He lives in Bogota, Colombia.

 

Nick Smith - Producer & Assistant Director

Nick was born in the UK. He is a bestselling author, prime time TV actor and award-winning filmmaker. Nick is the author of 'Scriptwriting: The Secrets Unleashed,’ drawing on his experience as a writer for everything from movies and TV to radio, plays and novels. Nick founded Scotland’s first national Film School in 1997. coaching 2000 students over a five year period. He also founded and ran Fierce Films, a production company, specializing in independent feature films, documentaries and TV dramas. Nick has a degree in scriptwriting, and ran the Writers' Studio in England from 2002-3. After directing the action movie “Cold Soldiers’ he earned a MFA in Film. He lives in Sarasota, FL. (He also plays Fabrizio Laurenzo)

 

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2967733/

 

Daniel Merendoni - Producer & Production Manager

       

Daniel Merendoni has studied photography and film in Argentina, Italy and Miami. He has performed various duties for over 14 years in filmmaking productions. He has served as Field Producer, Production Coordinator, Assistant Director, and Floor Manager in several Independent Shorts and Feature Films. Most recently he has worked in production for Docu-realities as well. He currently resides in Miami Beach, FL.

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3188425/

 

Paul Homza - Fight Coordinator

 

Paul Homza, has been working in South Florida for more than 15 years as an actor, fight choreographer/stage combat instructor, set builder, stage hand, electrician, gun tech, fly-rail operator, assistant technical director and deck supervisor at various theaters in South Florida. He has also worked on various films, tv shows and commercials as an actor, stunt performer, and fight coordinator. He lives in Miami, FL.

 

www.paulhomza.com 

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0970953/

 
 
Amy Doyle - Dance Choreographer
 

Amina began studying Raqs Sharqi (dance of the East) in 1995.  She has been performing in restaurants and for private and corporate events since 1998.  Her most influential teachers early on were Kamila and Maja from South Florida. With a background in gymnastics, baton twirling, Kung Fu, fitness and nutrition she sees the dance as a lifestyle change to promote health and well being. She wishes to share this knowledge with as many people as possible, of all ages, sizes and genders and taught students between ages 5-70 over her many years of instruction. She has studied with many local and international instructors such as Suzanne Del Vecchio, Miriam Eli, Ilsa, Virginia, Hanan, Bozenka, Samay, Amir Thaleb, Tamalyn Dallal, Jasmin Jahal, Jihan Jamal, Maria Jammal and many more.

Currently she teaches small, semi and private classes out of her home studio in Hollywood, Florida.  She’s been certified in Yoga Fit Level 1, ISSA Personal Training, ISSA Fitness Nutrition and Zumba.  She is just starting to share and teach belly dance with various senior centers in the South Florida area to promote, health, fitness, well being and mindfulness for life.

Amina has taught and trained many dancers some of whom now perform professionally and/or with Amina’s performing company “Desert Jewels” for private and corporate events. Amina and her dancers have shows for all types of events, corporate, private, cultural and senior centers.  Shows include choreography, props, improvisation, audience participation and/or instruction.

Humans suffer everywhere, die of hunger and don't even enjoy basic human rights. That's why I fight. I'm willing to give my life  for the cause. Equality for all. Prosperity for all. Justice for all. Equality or Death, that's my motto.        Kevin Sharpley holds a bachelor’s degree from the University of Miami with a dual major in motion pictures and psychology in addition to an Associates of Arts degree from Miami Dade College. He was inducted into the Miami Dade College Alumni Hall of Fame in 2014.  His range of work includes films, television, documentary, commercial, music video, multi-media and event video production. In addition, he is an actor and well respected artist, having shown and performed his work in many exhibitions and shows throughout South Florida. Mr. Sharpley currently serves as the Chairman of the Miami Dade County Film and Entertainment Advisory Board apponted by Miami-Dade County Commissioner Dennis C. Moss, as well as the Chairman of the Committee for Community Building for the board.  Mr. Sharpley also has produced and directed many documentaries and television projects.  Kevin Sharpley has been in the Film and Entertainment industry for over eighteen years and is a member of the Screen Actors Guild. As an actor he has been featured in the hit Fox Family series “S Club 7”, the HBO promo “Tonight”, the Verizon Commercial series “Can You Here Me Now” and in many other films, television shows, commercials and print campaigns (Macy's, Lens Crafters, Kohls, Aeropostle)  throughout his career. He has also been profiled on the PBS series "Art Street" as a featured filmmaker, company owner, organization head and community organizer. In addition he has done public service announcements for the PBS radio program NPR and the PBS member station WLRN. In addition Mr. Sharpley has designed, moderated and emceed many panels, workshops and seminars. This includes an incredible youth workshop for The American Black Film Festival for underserved children featuring Vivica A. Fox, Wendell Pierce and Ronald Lang. Mr. Sharpley is also a respected artist, working in many disciplines. He has traveled internationally as a model for prestigious agencies such as Wilhelmina, Ford, Major and Boss having lived in Europe, http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5107891/http://www.kijikmultimedia.com/kevinsharpleybio...********************************************************************************************************************************** 
David Calderón Vizcaya -  Writer & Director 

David Calderon Vizcaya, was born in Bogotá DC, Colombia in the early 70's. He went to an American-based K-12 school, and already holds an Engineering degree from Universidad de los Andes, and a MA in Economics from New York University. He turned to filmmaking in 2010 when he started to pursue an MFA in film at MIU-Ai in Miami, school from which he transferred to Academy of Art University in San Francisco, CA,  to focus and deepen his MFA film studies on Directing. He already has written, directed and produced a documentary film, and two short films, one of which was an adaptation. Currently, other than working as a freelance filmmaker, he Produced and Directed his thesis film, THE FIXER, based on an original script of his, and is also developing a handful of projects, including fiction features and shorts, documentaries, and TV pilots. He graduated from his MFA in Motion Pictures & Television on May 2017. David is also The Producer and Executive Producer.
6 min directing reel - http://bit.ly/reelDCV
9 min directing reel - http://bit.ly/reelDRCV
credentials - http://bit.ly/resumeDRCV
http://www.imdb.com/name/nm9136193/
 
Carlos J. Ruiz - Cinematographer 

Carlos Ruiz made his name in Venezuela, producing and editing for local and national television shows, as well as a multitude of commercials. He also directed three music videos prior pursuing a career in filmmaking and moving to the United States in 2010, which further bolstered his 11 years of experience as a professional cinematographer, editor, and later on, photographer. Along with working anything from off-road competitions to heavy metal concerts, his notable projects include serving as Editor for award-winning films “3:13” and “The Denied,” which played in the London International Film Festival and the St. Tropez Film Festival. He lives in Miami, FL.
http://www.carlosruizphoto.com/
http://m.imdb.com/name/nm5054053/
 

Tom Criswell - Production Designer

Tom Criswell was born in Caracas, Venezuela and early on he became a visual artist. He attended The Art Institute of Chicago while still in grade school, then graduated from Saint Andrew’s Preparatory School before returning to Venezuela to study graphic design at the Hans Neumann School of Design. Afterwards, he attended classes at Prodiseño and the Federico Brandt School of Fine Arts. He relocated to Miami in 2000 and became very active in the fine arts scene, He found a studio space and was represented several local galleries. He took part in several group and solo shows, and thereafter, he was asked to join the art department of a film crew to work on a television commercial. Such event set into motion a series of continued successful collaborations which developed into a career as an Art Director, Production Designer and Property Master for countless commercials, music videos, short films, feature films and special events.  He already has production design credits for several feature films and has also worked as a prop stylist for photographers such as Annie Leibovitz, Bruce Weber, Nigel Perry, and David LaChapelle. He lives in Miami, FL.
http://www.tomcriswellart.com/classes/
http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2161081/

 

Juan Pablo Martinez -Costume Designer

Juan Pablo Martínez was born and raised in Bogotá, Colombia. After spending his senior high school year in Iowa, USA, as a Foreign Exchange Student, he returned to Colombia to study Fashion Design at Taller 5 University, graduating from the 5 year program. He then furthered his education in Milano, Italy studying Patternmaking and Sowing, and then attended Atelier Chardon Savard in Paris; there, he also worked with Christian Lacroix at his prêt-à-porter studio. Back in Colombia, he jump-started his own boutique and produced many fashion shows both nationally and internationally. Nowadays, he is the first Sustainable Fashion Designer in Colombia and his business is expanding internationally, including the USA. Film and Cinema are among his dearest hobbies and passions. He lives in Bogota, Colombia.

 
Nick Smith - Producer & Assistant Director

Nick was born in the UK. He is a bestselling author, prime time TV actor and award-winning filmmaker. Nick is the author of 'Scriptwriting: The Secrets Unleashed,’ drawing on his experience as a writer for everything from movies and TV to radio, plays and novels. Nick founded Scotland’s first national Film School in 1997. coaching 2000 students over a five year period. He also founded and ran Fierce Films, a production company, specializing in independent feature films, documentaries and TV dramas. Nick has a degree in scriptwriting, and ran the Writers' Studio in England from 2002-3. After directing the action movie “Cold Soldiers’ he earned a MFA in Film. He lives in Sarasota, FL. (He also plays Fabrizio Laurenzo)
 
http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2967733/ 
 
Daniel Merendoni - Producer & Production Manager
        
Daniel Merendoni has studied photography and film in Argentina, Italy and Miami. He has performed various duties for over 14 years in filmmaking productions. He has served as Field Producer, Production Coordinator, Assistant Director, and Floor Manager in several Independent Shorts and Feature Films. Most recently he has worked in production for Docu-realities as well. He currently resides in Miami Beach, FL.
http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3188425/
 
Paul Homza - Fight Coordinator
 
Paul Homza, has been working in South Florida for more than 15 years as an actor, fight choreographer/stage combat instructor, set builder, stage hand, electrician, gun tech, fly-rail operator, assistant technical director and deck supervisor at various theaters in South Florida. He has also worked on various films, tv shows and commercials as an actor, stunt performer, and fight coordinator. He lives in Miami, FL.
 
www.paulhomza.com 
http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0970953/
  Amy Doyle - Dance Choreographer 
Amina began studying Raqs Sharqi (dance of the East) in 1995.  She has been performing in restaurants and for private and corporate events since 1998.  Her most influential teachers early on were Kamila and Maja from South Florida. With a background in gymnastics, baton twirling, Kung Fu, fitness and nutrition she sees the dance as a lifestyle change to promote health and well being. She wishes to share this knowledge with as many people as possible, of all ages, sizes and genders and taught students between ages 5-70 over her many years of instruction. She has studied with many local and international instructors such as Suzanne Del Vecchio, Miriam Eli, Ilsa, Virginia, Hanan, Bozenka, Samay, Amir Thaleb, Tamalyn Dallal, Jasmin Jahal, Jihan Jamal, Maria Jammal and many more.
Currently she teaches small, semi and private classes out of her home studio in Hollywood, Florida.  She’s been certified in Yoga Fit Level 1, ISSA Personal Training, ISSA Fitness Nutrition and Zumba.  She is just starting to share and teach belly dance with various senior centers in the South Florida area to promote, health, fitness, well being and mindfulness for life.
Amina has taught and trained many dancers some of whom now perform professionally and/or with Amina’s performing company “Desert Jewels” for private and corporate events. Amina and her dancers have shows for all types of events, corporate, private, cultural and senior centers.  Shows include choreography, props, improvisation, audience participation and/or instruction.

story:
"OK, so here we go, we decided to share and provide you with more pictures then words, since it is a visual movie production. Hope you enjoy our campaign presentation".

 

Overall Concept:

     As a retired Navy SEAL and former Law Enforcement Officer; I wanted to produce a instructional movie that shared with the audience information about firearms safety and suggestions on how to improve their shooting skills.

My desire was to include what I have learned over the past 30 years:

  • Firearms safety procedures
  • Firearms shooting fundamentals 
  • Firearms Tactics   

 

Quiet on the set.......Action!

     I discussed this with my beautiful wife Sue, and obtained her outstanding support for our entire venture that has been over 1.5 years in the making. We had a vision to make this movie totally different then what is currently available to the viewing audience. We desired our movie to be both educational and entertaining by including:

  • Other firearm professionals sharing their vast knowledge
  • Embed the viewer alongside other students
  • A fresh and creative Director
  • An original musical soundtrack
  • A Spanish Voice Over option
  • Provide a beautiful backdrop

JD and Sue Williamson

 

Our Movie:

An instructional movie about practical firearms and shooting fundamentals for new or experienced pistol shooters. Viewing time is 1 hour and 45 minutes.

"This is not a typical training video; it’s a movie that embeds you alongside four students while they learn about firearms safety and how to improve their pistol shooting skills".

 

Pistol 1 is a movie that places you inside the firearms training environment with JD Williamson, a globally recognized subject matter expert with over 30 years of experience in:

  • Special Operations as a Navy SEAL Chief
  • Law Enforcement Officer
  • Tactical Firearms Instructor
  • Security Officer Trainer
  • Personal and Executive Protection
  • Worldwide Antiterrorism Instructor

 

Movie Features:

  • A team of Law Enforcement, Firearms & Security professionals with over 50 years of experience also joins JD to share their vast knowledge.

 

  • Presented in English or Spanish Voice Over options.

 

  • Movie contents include:

 

Meet the Cast and Crew:

The producers: 

JD and Susan Williamson, a married couple of over 26 years, JD is the main firearms instructor

 

The Director:

The creative vision and magical touch of Mr. Jorge Serra

 

The Stars:

Ms. Danica Williamson as a student going through the firearms course

 

Mr Julio Serra as a student going through the firearms course

 

Ms. Migda Casas as a student going through the firearms course

 

Ms. Jessica Linares as a student going through the firearms course

 

Mr. Terry Bryson (Retired State Patrol Officer) offering Pro Tips 

 

Mr.Chris Velez (Deputy Sheriff) offering Pro Tips

 

Mr Bruce Jacobs (Gun Shop Owner) offering Pro Tips

 

Original Musical Soundtrack by Capi:

Mr. Kevin "Capi" Carbo provides the musical soundtrack with his unique talents

 

Photography,  Mastering and Production:

 

Filmed on Location: 

In Bonita Springs, Florida and Lehigh Acres, Florida at:

 

Veteran Charity Donations:

"Our way of giving back and supporting our Military"

Our faithful and honest pledge to support charities with 10% of product sales, with 5% going to two different charities:

LZ-Grace - Warriors Retreat           American's Mighty Warriors

 

 

It's a Wrap! (well almost):

Cut!:

"We are almost done with our movie release and offering it to the world to view".

This is what we have accomplished up to this point: (We have been busy)

  • Turned our project concept into a real movie 
  • Fully completed all filming of our movie 
  • Completed our final directors editing cuts
  • Completed our original movie soundtrack
  • Completed our Spanish Voice Over option
  • Sent our final movie to a Professional Lab for polishing, mastering and authoring
  • Established a website and social media sites, so we have platforms for promotions
  • ALL bills, invoices, costs and production are "PAID in FULL" up to this point

 

Funds needed for final production: $ 7,777    

(Rounded down for good luck!)

 

We pledge and raise our right hand 

to use YOUR funds for:

 

Now Showing!

 

How can you help and support our move release?

  • Join our Team efforts by pledging any amount
  • Spreading the word using the Indiegogo share tools, emails and social media

 

Your HooYah! Rewards:

Supporting a Veteran on a product that's produced in "America"!

  • Mentioning you by name on our social media sites and saying thanks! 
  • Sending you a movie poster
  • Sending you a copy of our movie on DVD
  • All the above!

 

Curtain Call:

Thanks so very much for viewing our campaign and learning about how you can help us finally release our instructional movie. We truly feel that our movie will make a huge difference to viewers in regards to firearms safety and how to improve their shooting skills. Please don't hesitate to give us a shout , should you need further information or have any questions. Feel free to email me at JD@MyXSEAL.com.

Best to you and your Family!

 JD and Sue Williamson

story:
Ghastly Fun Films

If you love 80's horror films with gallons of fake blood  splashed around, exploding heads, severed cocks flying through the air, obscene language , nudity, drug use...a total disregard for political correctness then this is the film for you. As Freddie said "We Will Rock You!"

THE OFFICIAL DETOUR POSTER (for sale in the Perks)

 

 

 

The Story

After a debauched night in a seedy motel Frank accidentally kills Ann. Frank's remorse is short lived. Ann returns the next day fully intact with no memory of anything that happened after sex. They pick up the shagging where they left off the night before. During the night Ann transforms into a vicious demon (thanks to evil forces unleashed by the demonic wallet Frank stole) and tries to kill Frank. Frank kills Ann for a second time... the next day she comes back from the dead again…and again.

In between Ann coming back from the dead and Frank killing her again, they fall in love. Together they find a way to break the curse and vanquish Nybbas, the vicious demon who controls the wallet’s power, and live happily ever after, or join the undead for good…

Evil Dead meets Groundhog Day.
 

 

A Word On Special Effects

"In Camera"  is the only way we can afford to do our SFX.  Cheap, fast, good- pick two.  Cheap and fast for us. Which means our effects are going to be cheesy as hell but a lot of fun all the same.

 Mickey Rourke says in “Sin City” - “Blood and by the gallon”.

David Cronenberg's "Scanners" Exploding Head Gag- old school magic

THE TEAM

 

Michael Egan (Writer-Director)

I have always enjoyed gory yet funny horror films like "Bad Taste", Evil Dead 2 "Shaun Of The Dead".  Horror Comedy in general. Exploding heads amuse me for some bizarre reason.

 

On set "Love In The First Degree" 2002

 

The idea for DETOUR started in 1991 when I made a short horror film "The Room Is Ready For Ralph" (starring none other than Roger Ward).  In the film a friendly guy, on a rainy night in the middle of nowhere, picks up a hitchhiker (Roger) They go back to his spooky farm house where he learns a dark secret and has to run for his life. No  matter what he does or where he goes the bad guy keeps coming after him. 

I have been trying to make a feature film version of that idea for  twenty five years. I think it's time I made it don't you think.

Joy Smithers (Ann)

As an actor, she has appeared in 10 mini-series & 12 feature films: she starred opposite Nicole Kidman in the AFI Award-winning mini-series Bangkok Hilton, and  played the bipolar physio-therapist “Rose Carleton” on Australia’s top-ranked television drama All Saints and more recently on Wonderland as Felicity the Cougar. In 2012 Joy traveled to Nambia as part of Fury Road Mad Max 4 cast working along side Tom Hardy and Charlize Theron.

She also starred in my first (and only) feature film Love In The First Degree.

Margaret Pomeranz wrote this about Joy's performance-

 

"Do you know what impressed me about this film? The fact that Joy Smithers is such a talent and is so unused on the big screen in this country. She is actually the performance glue that holds this film together".

"At The Movies" Review LOVE IN THE FIRST DEGREE

With your help we can finally make another film together. Way overdue!!

LOVE IN THE FIRST DEGREE- full movie.

 

 

Barry Duffield (Frank)

 

 

Over the years Barry, has been in numerous TVCs, television dramas, and a handful of feature films. Barry most recently played Lugo for two seasons on the very successful Starz TV drama, Spartacus,

 

Barry is also a talented writer. He has several scripts under option around the world. I met Barry  five years ago when I optioned his hilarious Horror Comedy "Tandoori Apocalypse". We share a passion for horror comedy ...and exploding heads.

 

ROGER WARD (Nybbas The Demon)

 

 

Considered to be a pioneer of the Australian new wave, Ward has created characters such as  Bob Taylor in ‘Man From Hong Kong’, Weppo, in the long running TV series, ‘Number 96’, Captain Fifi McAfee in ‘Mad Max’ and Ritter “the guard from hell” in ‘Turkey Shoot’. He was also featured in the Oz-ploitation doco  "Not Quite Hollywood".


 I am so pleased Roger and I  can continue our journey together from "The Room Is Ready For Ralph" to "Detour".

Robert Agganis (Director Of Photography)

 

Rob on set- "Love In The First Degree" 2002

Rob started his career  in 1984 as Don McAlpine's first camera assistant and Steadicam operator on Predator.  Since then he as worked on big Hollywood blockbusters  The Matrix, Dark City, Medicine man, Moon Over Parador, commercials, music videos and all my films since we met  in 2002 on the set of LITFD.
 

Shooting 4K with  Anamorphic lens - this film will look fully sick!!!

 

Hanna McNicole (Costume Designer)

 

Hanna on set- Stills Shoot April 2016

Hannah started her fashion career in Milan, Italy after studying design in Florence. After several years Hannah decided to move back to Sydney with her family to start her own label and retail store and do morning soft sand runs on Bondi Beach. She did the label and stores. The soft sand still awaits.

Hannah is amazing, immensely talented and passionate about all things fashion. Her eye for detail and style is extraordinary, perfectly capturing the essence of our characters. She has loved the challenge of working in film.

 

Final Words

Welcome to Detour my friends. As Margo Channing says in "All About Eve" : "Fasten your seat belts, it's going to be a bumpy night!"

Merchandise
 

 

Official Detour T shirt

 

Respect!

story:
Background

Since the early 2000's  we have produced a series of short films which have screened in festivals home and abroad. Several productions have been broadcast on national television , won awards and have secured deals with US and Canadian distribution companies.

Mad Dog Productions founded the Waterford Film Festival in 2007. Since then the festival has screened well over 400 films and awarded over € 30,000 in prizes to filmmakers and writers with our partners at FilmLab.

Under Mad Dog Productions and with the Waterford Film Festival  we want to create  new programmes and competitions for filmmakers and writers. 

Within our current screenplay competition,  the awards that we currently provide include equipment access, editing facilities access and some financial support.  Writers & filmmakers have gone onto make their films with our support.

  Apart from creating new competitions if we raise all of the funds it would be our aim to set up a profit sharing video on demand service, in which selected films would be put onto a new video site.  We would use the site to help promote the films and to have a pay per view service in which the filmmakers would share in the profits. 

Some of the funding will also help support the running costs of the Waterford Film Festival.

 

About the Waterford Film Festival

 

The Waterford Film Festival was established in 2007 by local filmmaker Stephen Byrne. His objective was to bring something new to Waterford's arts and cultural scene, promoting local, national filmmakers and writers, but in particular independent film. 

Since  the foundation of the  festival, we have screened over 400  films from filmmakers around the world as well promoting writers with the short screenplay competition. Filmmakers from across Ireland, UK, France, Germany, Holland and as far as Canada and USA have attended the festival.  

​What We Need & What You Get

 We need  start up funding for the following:

  • Awards Fund & Competition- This fund will be used to set up new competitions for filmmakers & writers to compete to win awards in writing/film and also to provide support in the production of films and would also help develop current competitions. 
  • Support towards the running costs of the Waterford Film Festival (www.waterfordfilmfestival.net)
  • Set up of a website for a VOD service, where filmmakers can submit for possible online distribution and share in the profits.
  • Promotion and marketing funds for the new VOD service and the selected films.

This funding will not only go towards putting these plans into place but it will also contribute towards the under funded Waterford Film Festival. 

 

Producer and Festival Founder- Stephen Byrne

Stephen Byrne is an award winning filmmaker based in Dublin. He has a BTEC Higher Diploma in creative media production from Colaiste Dhulaigh.

His drama productions have screened in national and international film festivals.

Several of his films have broadcast on television including his 1916 short film 'Jack Hat'  which aired on RTE, Easter 2016. He has also secured distribution deals with U.S. and Canadian companies.

He has worked on productions we’re he produced or co-produced that were filmed on various formats including ; Super 16mm , Digi Beata and Red Cam.

The genres he has worked on include dramas, romantic comedies and several period films that were set during the 1916 Rising.

In 2007 he founded the Waterford Film Festival, which in 2017 it will celebrate its 11th Annual event.  

For his work in the film festival he was nominated for the ‘contribution to the arts award’

He works as a freelance filmmaker and produces online video content for top companies, that include Credit Union, Maxol, Chamber of Commerce, Neville Group.

Other Ways You Can Help Us

  • Use indiegogo share tools and help us get the word out there
  • Post on friends social media pages
  • If you have any PR skills and want to help , please get in touch!

story:
When a quiet refugee in Johannesburg learns that his wife is restricted from leaving the war-strewn DRC, he embarks to cross legal and moral lines in order to evacuate her himself.


Vision:

Our vision is to create a story that is engaging and authentic. It’s a riveting war epic that never forgets its human characters. The focus is on one man’s struggle for his wife against the backdrop of the refugee crisis and African Civil Wars. We’re combining styles from some of the great war-films of the decade while capturing a unique perspective on the genre. 


About the Project:

BROKEN is a 24-minute short-film about Arthur, an honest Congolese refugee, who lives in South Africa where he waits for his wife to be freed from war-strewn DRC. He works hard for little, saving for whatever fees would be needed for his wife’s immigration. When Arthur learns that deadly rebels have invaded his hometown and threaten Grace, he panics. Arthur is devastated, but he will no longer lay dormant. He uses his savings to hire an amoral mercenary to aid him in his journey to reach his wife, at whatever cost.

BROKEN is written, directed, and produced entirely by AFDA students as a 4th year graduation project. AFDA, the South African School of Motion Picture Medium and Live Performance is one of the leading film schools in South Africa. AFDA supplies us with equipment but everything else needed for the film will be obtained by the crew itself.

The film will premiere in November 2016 at the AFDA Film Festival held at Ster- Kinekor Cinema Nouveau in Rosebank Mall. We then plan to submit BROKEN to film festivals across the world and distribute it online.

Your donations will go towards:

·  Food for the Cast and Crew – we have a very talented team bringing this film to life but it becomes difficult to tap into that talent with empty bellies. A well-fed crew is a happy crew!

·  Additional Lighting and Camera Rentals – AFDA supplies us with exceptional equipment but we would like to push the boundaries of student filmmaking and in order to do that, we are looking at getting additional gear

·  Costumes and Make-up – in order to bring the characters to life, we need authentic costumes and realistic make-up. This will include rebel soldier uniforms, guns, special effects make-up and fake blood.

·  Location and Design Costs – this film is set in South Africa, the Democratic Republic of Congo and the journey in between. We need to find the perfect locations or create the sets and all the props that go in them.

·  Transportation Costs – several scenes require a Jeep for our characters to travel in as well as a bakkie (pickup truck) for the rebel soldiers. These vehicles don’t move if you don’t fill them with petrol and you can’t fill them with petrol if you don’t have money.

·  Marketing costs – we would like to create DVDs, t-shirts, hoodies, stickers, flyers, posters, business cards and anything else we can get our hands on. This film will mean nothing without an audience knowing it exists.

·  Festival Submissions – we truly believe in this film and this story. We would love for the world to see it in as many film festivals as possible.

We would be incredibly grateful for absolutely any contribution. We are offering some pretty cool perks too, so make sure to guide your eyes to the right hand side to see what we have to offer you in return.

We understand that times are tough (we’re students, we understand) and not everyone has spare money to donate. You can still help us though! SHARING goes a long way. Tell your friends about us, share our campaign with them.  Anyone who can help in any way will be welcomed with virtual open arms.


FOLLOW and LIKE us on Facebook  and Instagram, to keep up to date with the behind the scenes of making this film!

WE START SHOOTING ON THE 30TH OF JUNE 2016!

Kelly Ryan – Producer

Kelly Ryan is a young aspiring filmmaker and film producer from Johannesburg, South Africa. She is currently studying towards an Honours degree in film at AFDA School of Motion Picture Medium and Live Performance with a major in film producing. She is passionate about telling local stories that transcend a South African audience. She believes that at the root of any story is an element of humanity that everyone can connect to. “A film about a person with a completely different life to your own still manages to touch your heart because of that humanity. And that is the beauty of filmmaking”.

David Wayne Smith – Director/Writer

David is an American born Global citizen, having grown up partially in Zambia and currently residing in South Africa. From an early age, David could feel the emotional power of stories. "They inspire, they challenge and they dare." He hopes to one day inspire the next generation of movie-goers the same way he was inspired; not a passing of the torch, but the dream to set others’ imagination alight. David received his BA in Motion Picture Medium from AFDA, the South African School of Motion Picture Medium and Live Performance in 2015. In the same year, he was awarded Best Director and his film “Courage” won Best Film and the Critic’s Choice Award at the 21st Annual AFDA Awards and is currently circulating the South African film festival circuit.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ryan. I am an aspiring filmmaker. I am a web designer/developer by trade. I have a very personal connection to the subject our documentary is about. In 2013 I worked for a major bank and experienced jobless. It was an year and half before I was able to find employment again and was on the brink of despair.  I watched other family members and friends go through a similar situation at the same time by no fault of our own. There are things we can do as a society non related to government programs etc... to stop this downward spiral but education and awareness needs to be brought to light about the after effects of cutbacks backs, plant closings, and what happens to those families, people after the fact. Please help me  raise this awareness through the art of storytelling and film. 

What We Need & What You Get

We started this project with a budget of $0.00 dollars and did our best to keep our ask to the very minimum. In order to bring our vision to light our budget we set will provide a much needed upgrade in audio gear, a B camera, assist in permits and festival fees in addition to giving us the ability to hire professional talent to be on screen for voice over and interviewer.  

The Impact

Our hope is after our project is completed and submitted to the Big Sky Documentary film festival on September 2 we will catch the attention of activist that can assist in advancing our goal of remedying the growth in unemployment and homelessness. 

Risks & Challenges

We have been in the planning stages for some time and have already experienced some minor setbacks, due to a few state regulations some people that originally agreed to go on camera for interviews have been forced to decline due to political and corporate views. While this has been disappointing it has hardly deterred us. Our core vision remains intact with our core characters and we have had some very promising replies from independent social workers and development agencies that can fill those roles without lost of creditable content.   

Other Ways You Can Help

We fully understand all too well if you cannot offer any financial assistance but if you deem our cause worthy you can help support us by simply passing along this information on social media to help create additional awareness around our subject matter and follow us on youtube at: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCiG6_KOnRjWwBe...

story:
The Jubilees Project – a plea for Funding

Dear Sirs,

In 2 years time, occurs the 70th anniversary to the establishment of the state of Israel and in 7 years the 75th anniversary thereof. According to the Jewish tradition these are dates bare special significance. The establishment of the state of Israel and its independence war make for a uniquely extraordinary event in human history: a people exiled from its homeland, having preserved its separate identity, language and faith for 2,000 years and then returned to its homeland and reconstituted its statehood in it. The heart of this event was the dramatic war of independence which took place in the years 1947-1949, and which nearly ended with an Israeli collapse.

The story of the Israeli independence war of 1947-1949 has been told neither in full nor earnest, due to a plethora of political and personal interests and intrigues. I have dedicated my entire career (including paratroops combat service a  degree in Philosophy and a PhD in History) to researching this war and its follow-ups, a career which started with when I was 14 years-old
(in 1954) and the people involved where mostly alive and available for introspections. I have publish a 4 volumes books series which covers a quarter of that war (1947-1949).

My Archive encompasses thousands of interviews and dozens of thousands of unique documents,

My mind holds hindsights which cannot be reconstructed, due to many personal acquaintances RIP.

Thus I feel a duty to my country to complete this great work, which cannot be supported by the establishment which failures it exposes. Please listen to my clip below and join me in completing this strategically important undertaking for the sake of the generations to come. Every donor shall get a copy personally signed by me.

My Personal appeal on a home-made Video-Clip:

https://youtu.be/ohy0876ypSg

My Website:

www.urimilstein.com/product.sc?productId=10

Video:

The Jubilees Project

70-75 Anniversaries

to the establishment of Israel

and its war of independence.

An appeal from:

Dr. Uri Milstein

story:
Hi! Our names are Camille Heard and Jacqueline Baron and we are the founders of FELOH. Have you ever been frustrated with your hair? Wasted money on hair products and tools that left you in tears? Searched far and wide across the internet for your birthday hairstyle or cut? Struggled with finding a reputable stylist or barber near you after relocating? Or just wanted advice on a healthy hair routine for your specific hair texture? If you answered YES to any of these questions, then we’ve got a product for you!

FELOH is a revolutionary social media app for the hair enthused community. Our goal is to equip hair enthusiasts with the best researching tools to meet the needs above and then some. We also want to equip social media entrepreneurs (YouTubers and bloggers), hair care retailers, and barbers and stylists, with innovative tools to help grow their personal brands. By aggregating the hair related information found across the internet, we believe we can help hair enthusiasts locate the information they need, and help hair industry entrepreneurs obtain high concentration brand exposure. 

Through our market research, we learned that the internet and word of mouth referrals are the top influencers when it comes to selecting hair care products.  We are delivering an internet platform that facilitates word of mouth referrals by connecting you with others that have a similar hair type!

Nearly ALL of the leading hair care apps available today focus on the stylist-client relationship.  However, our consumer research shows that most people regularly do their hair themselves.  We are the only app that is catering to the everyday person's hair care needs.

After interviewing nearly 60 diverse individuals, we found that 87% of our survey takers would find it helpful to share hair tips with someone that has a similar hair texture.  One distinct feature that sets FELOH apart from other hair social media apps is that we will filter and sort each person and post into hair-type categories.  This will allow users to easily connect with others that have a similar hair texture. 

Here at FELOH, we recognize that brand exposure is rapidly moving towards the realm of social media.  Below we define social media entrepreneurs and how we are planning to help these business owners grow their brands while helping hair care brands gain more market exposure. 

 

Where will your funds go?  

Alliance development- The goal of our campaign is to raise $2,500 which will go towards alliance development with hair care industry stakeholders such as hair care brands, renowned barbers and hair stylists, and social media entrepreneurs with a significant social media followings.  Building relationships with these stakeholders will position FELOH as a trusted and known name in the hair enthused community.  These relationships will be critical once the mobile app is launched.  Additional raised funds will go towards the following:

  • App development-  We estimate that we will need about $25,000 for the application development.  
  • FELOH rewards program​- To attract users, we will offer users FELOH dollars for every new user they refer to FELOH.  FELOH dollars will be redeemed at the FELOH store.  We will need $10,000 to stock the FELOH store with hair-related products from your favorite hair care brands. 
  • Marketing for app launch- We will need approximately $15,000 to fund our launch events and initial internet marketing strategies with social media entrepreneurs (YouTubers, Bloggers, etc.) to get the word out and attract new users. 

***Now for a brief recap!***

The Problem: 
1.) Consumers are in need of an efficient method to expand their consumer knowledge.
2.) Hair industry merchants are in need of a new marketing approach to capture and retain millennial consumers.

​The Fix: 
1.) FELOH allows users to easily browse through relevant posts via our hair texture filters to learn about new products and styles. 
2.) By aggregating the hair enthused market onto one app, FELOH can offer high traction marketing strategies that guarantees exposure to new customers, clients, and followers.

Your donation gets us one step closer to delivering you a product that we know you'll love!! Please consider donating today.  

As always, Peace, Love and Hair.

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/f_e_l_o_h/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/f_e_l_o_h

Website: www.feloh.com

Facebook: www.facebook.com/feloh2

Crowdfunding Cast Interview: 

http://crowdfundingcast.tk/crowdfunding-cast-ep...

***Now for a brief recap!***The Problem: 1.) Consumers are in need of an efficient method to expand their consumer knowledge.2.) Hair industry merchants are in need of a new marketing approach to capture and retain millennial consumers.​The Fix: 1.) FELOH allows users to easily browse through relevant posts via our hair texture filters to learn about new products and styles. 2.) By aggregating the hair enthused market onto one app, FELOH can offer high traction marketing strategies that guarantees exposure to new customers, clients, and followers.Your donation gets us one step closer to delivering you a product that we know you'll love!! Please consider donating today.  As always, Peace, Love and Hair.Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/f_e_l_o_h/Twitter: https://twitter.com/f_e_l_o_hWebsite: www.feloh.comFacebook: www.facebook.com/feloh2Crowdfunding Cast Interview: http://crowdfundingcast.tk/crowdfunding-cast-ep...

story:
About the project.

Hey there. 

We are FMW Films, a small London-based indie film production company and we need your help!

Our latest project GODLESS is ready to shoot - please read about the project, and support us in making what we believe will be a really special short film.

GODLESS is a short dark comedy. It looks at how people can get carried away by hype and propaganda. It will be approx 12 minutes in length, filmed over four days and involve some well known faces including:


Harriet Thorpe (The Brittas Empire, Absolutely Fabulous)

Richard Glover (Sightseers, A Field in England, Into the Woods)

Rachel Parris (Murder in Successville, The IT Crowd)

Simon Cotton (A Clockwork Orange Tour,  The Monster)

James Wren (Peacock Season, The Trap)

Richard Sandling (Nina Forever, The Catherine Tate Show)

Akila Cristiano (Acts of Redemption)


So why do we need you? Well, because we are hopefully creating something that you want - and want to support. Being an indie film company, it's a struggle to create awesome work for non-marketable reasons. This is for storytelling. We have brought together the best talent available to create this story that we are truly proud of.

More to follow!


What is the film about?

Trapped in their office by a baying crowd from all religious backgrounds, a group of filmmakers contemplate a fictional short film they have made disproving the existence of God. As the crowd outside intensifies they wonder if it is just a film or maybe something much more important.

About us.

FMW Films was set up in 2008 by Alan Freestone (Director/Writer), Fergus March (Director/Actor www.fergusmarch.co.uk) and James Wren (Actor/Writer www.jameswren.co.uk) in order to shoot the micro-budget feature PEACOCK SEASON at the Edinburgh Festival. The resulting film, where all the roles were played by festival veterans and stand-up comedians, received a standing ovation at its premiere at the Edinburgh Festival in 2009.

After PEACOCK SEASON (Available at www.gofasterstripe.com ), the team embarked on another micro-budget feature: THE TRAP, a comedy/horror filmed entirely on location in an abandoned Victorian bath house in London (Trailer: HERE). THE TRAP is now playing at festivals around the world and won The Jury Prize for Best Feature at TMBT AWARDS.

FMW are in post -production on their third micro-budget feature THE MAN YOU'RE NOT, a romantic comedy (Cast includes: Joanna Lumley, Reece Shearsmith, Adam Hills and Matthew Wright) expected September 2016.

At present FMW has two shorts on the festival circuit SILENT COUNTRY (Trailer: HERE) and THE MONSTER (Trailer: HERE)


What We Need & What You Get

In order to do justice to GODLESS we are looking to raise:

1) £1200 post production costs (VFX, Sound Mix & Grade)

2) £800 for DCP creation and festival submissions.

We are offering various perks for help in raising this money so do please have a look!

If we are lucky enough to go over our target those funds will go towards International Film Festival submissions

Other Ways You Can Help

Please forward this page to your friends and contacts! We appreciate you taking the time to have a look at our project.


Thank you

FMW Films x

story:
The Company

Meadowpark Pictures was founded by three friends. A designer, director and writer. Over the course of three years we have enlisted the help of artists from a broad spectrum of backgrounds to help grow and shape our fledgling company. We value experimentation, independence and quality.

The Budget

Over the years we have used thousands of pounds of our own money and were lucky enough to receive some private donations that have got us this far through pre-production. The figure we are asking for here is what we will need to get through production and into post.

Profit Hierarchy

We need the skills of writers, producers, directors, editors, designers, musicians, technicians, artists and a multitude of other talented people that are essential in the planning and production of a film. As a result, we believe in a profit structure that does not place the weight of monetary return from the top down.

After paying the bills and returning any investment offered by funding partners, the company takes 10% net profit in order to keep running.

50% of remaining net profit goes to the crew, which is split equally.

The remaining 50% goes to the cast, who are tiered as Primary Cast, Supporting Cast, and Extras, and who receive a cut accordingly.

Cast

The film has been cast and rehearsed for over a year now. We've been lucky to have so many talented actors put so much of their time into the project. 

Phillip Toop as Dylan

Phillip completed his degree in Drama and Performance at the University of Highlands and Islands, and throughout his studies earned leading roles in a number of plays. These included, ‘One for the Road’, ‘Titus Andronicus’ and Stephen Berkoff’s adaptation of ‘Metamorphosis’.
Since graduation, Phillip has appeared in several tours of ‘Dirty Water’, a new Scottish play by John Stuart that included a 19-day run at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival.
Following nine months of teaching English in Vietnam, he is excited to work on ‘A Letter to Molly’.
Also a passionate writer, Phillip often works writing short stories and screenplays; some of which will soon be in production. 


Colin MacDougall as Chris
A Glasgow-born actor, Colin has spent the past three years working on various television and film productions. In 2013, he met a third-generation professional stunt artist, Casey Michaels, who inspired him to take up acting - something he always wanted to do.
Always looking to gain experience in the industry and establish his status as an up-and-coming Scottish actor, Colin has had roles in films like ‘Whiteblade’, ‘Flux’ and ‘Sunshine’ (a multi award-winning short).
He is currently cast in ‘Dream Finder’, ‘Kingdom: Fall of Illandrieal’ and the TV series ‘Storm Warrior’ - all due to film in 2017.

Alex McDonald as Marty

Starting acting at 25, Alex has gained experience through varied forms of production. From his beginnings in a student film about unhinged teachers, to playing a Nazi soldier in Outpost 3, an extra in River City and a streaker in sports-themed dating show ‘World Series of Dating’. His claim to fame so far is his role in a 2013 Belhaven Best advert called ‘Tae a Pint’.

Across these different modes of acting, his favourite part of the industry has been meeting all sorts of interesting people, and experimenting with his style when placed in front of the camera.


Martin Haddow as Patch

Martin Docherty as Dan and William
Graduating from the RSAMD (Royal Scottish Academy of Music and Drama) in 1997 with the Silver Medal, Martin has spent many years in theatre, working with groups like The Tron, The Arches, The Traverse, Gridiron, The Citizens and The Oran Mor. He also spent four years working with The People’s Theatre of Finland on a successful Finnish government project to bring Finnish theatre to the Edinburgh International Festival.

Most recently, Martin played ‘Johnny Byrne’ in Tom McGrath’s ‘The Hard Man’ at the Finborough Theatre in Earls Court, London, to critical acclaim.

Andy Noble as Bruce

Leanne Cameron as Lauren


Team

Cheryl Campbell – Special Effects and Make-up

Melanie Cowell – Design Consultant

Martin Harvey – Illustrator and Graphic Designer

Stacey Keen – Executive Producer/ Production Designer

Craig Mackenzie – Executive Producer/ Director

Sarah Morris – Producer

Greg Mitchell – Composer

Robert Patience – Special Effects

Sadie Ryan – Composer

Sean Sweeney – Executive Producer/ Writer

Grant Thomson – Social Media Manager

Mark Wheelan – Storyboard Artist

Alison Wilson – Copywriter and Website Editor

story:
Music is Life is calling for support to achieve an ambitious £10,000.00 worth of funding which will see 4 courses being run across the region (Dingwall, Elgin and Inverness).

The aim is to fund 4 quarterly courses with 2 courses in Inverness (one in partnership with Birchwood Highland), 1 course in Dingwall and 1 course in Elgin.

The course was put together by myself (Steve Robertson) I am the Managing Director of an Events Management and Promotion company based in the Highlands of Scotland, I was born and raised in the Highlands and as a young person growing up in the 90’s I struggled to get involved with music with events being few and far between to gain experience and opportunities.

Two years ago myself and my team at TwentyTen developed Music is Life, an 8-week skill course aimed to help young people in the community.

Music is Life has previously shown great benefits with a track record of working with Birchwood Highland an Inverness based mental health recovery charity and receiving funding from Highland Youth Arts Hub to work with young people in the Inverness area earlier this year.

By supporting this campaign, you will have a chance to make a difference in the lives of both young people in the community and Birchwood Highland service users.

How? Well, you choose. Perhaps you want to experience what it’s like to be a roadie and work backstage for the day at a TwenyTen event of your choice or you want to grab a ticket to an upcoming TwentyTen event at a discounted price – not only do you get you to enjoy a concert at less than a face value but you get to support your community whilst you do so. We also have an exclusive download bundle with some of the hottest emerging acts from the Highlands and beyond!

There is also a sponsorship package available for socially conscious businesses that want to invest in their communities.

What will do with the funding?

Each course costs £2,500.00 to run, that enables us an opportunity for 80 young people and 20 Birchwood Highland service users to take part in the Music is Life course at a cost of £100.00 per participant.

The costs of each course breaks down as £1,000.00 budgeted to run a final concert at the end of each course, £750.00 budgeted for workshop space and £750.00 budgeted for delivery of each course from mentors and coaches.

Any additional money raised will be invested into future Music is Life projects within the Highlands & Moray.

The Crowdfunding project comes with a series of rewards for the general public and businesses alike that include a range of creative incentives including the opportunity to be a roadie for a day to business aimed sponsorship packages that are aimed at all budgets.

story:
Short Summary

Wild Stag Productions are a two man team:
Adam Cahill is a producer/director/screenwriter who has made several short films and documentaries. You can find him at www.facebook.com/adamwcahill
Adam is a very passionate film maker and is working a part-time, minimum wage job to be able to devote his time to his craft.
Luke Corcoran is an actor and screenwriter who is immensely innovative, intuitive, and extremely funny. Luke wants to give 100% to the art of film making, and believes that Follow the Dead is a big step forward to doing just that. You can reach him at www.facebook.com/Luke-Corcoran-Actor-1104065339...

Follow the Dead began as a commentary on the millenial age, and exhibits a distinct and modern approach to takling the "zombie apocalype" paradigm. It has since grown to include some novel graphic design and narrative ideas, which both Adam and Luke are just dying to bring to life for all to see.
 

What We Need & What You Get

We at Wild Stag Productions are terribly eagre to film this project. So much so that we would happily fnd it ourselves. Alas, we are not so fortunate as to have the means to pull off whatwe have planned without the help of generous invicuduals on the crowd funding scene.

We are asking for a minimum of €2,000 to be able to cover the costs of hiring a professional team which will include a sound recordist, graphic designer, effects makeup artist, caterer, composer, and our cast. We are also in of purchasing some professional lighting equipment.

What these funds will do is allow us to create a film that will not only be an hillarious take on the zombie genre, but it will also be a work laced with Irish charm. It is also going to use such graphic design effects as seen in the promo, but to a much fuller extent. We just can't wait for you to see what we have come up with!

story:
We're 4160Tuesdays, makers of fine fragrance in very very small batches.

  • We're based on London, and handmake all our fragrances in our Acton studio.
  • Our Mrs Gloss collaboration makes it possible for group members to have their own private fragrance (but without the £5K fee).
  • By sharing the costs, and having 20 Glossers round to the studio to choose the aromas they want, we hope to make a batch of 20 - 50 litres to share among everyone who wants some.

We have a really good offer for everyone who'll back it before we've even made it, based on 4160Tuesdays' track record in indie fragrance.

We'd love it if you'd join in, so we can buy all the raw materials we need to make a batch of both perfumes.

  • Our early bird rates are for everyone who's prepared to take a gamble on how the scents will turn out. (If you don'd like them, you can swap them later on the 4160Tuesdays News Facebook group.)
  • Every perfume comes with a free sample of it's other half. If you buy both, you get two free samples to share with another Glosser (or to keep :-) ).
  • Start small, with a 9ml pocket perfume, right up to 2 x 100mls.
  • We'll make the perfumes even if we don't crack the £2K target, so everyone will get their scents.

We've done this before...

As crowdfunding goes, this is pretty low risk; you will get a perfume come hell or high water, as long as we're here in once piece to make it for you.

We can now give you the updated notes, as we've just had our afternoon workshop to choose them

Outdoors: #MrsGlossMadeMeGoForAWalk -  a walk outdoors in the crisp cool winter: linden blossom for a cool top note, the forest floor smell of treemoss, the creamy slightly coconut milky scent of the octalactone molecule, warm cosy scarves.

Indoors: #MrsGlossMadeMeEatIt - all the wonderful scents of winter treats: tangerine, hazelnut, white cognac essential oil (a big hit, that one), red berries, amber, frankincense, and the slightest hint of toasted marshmallows.

The log fire smells were turned down as being a bit overpowering, spices are too irritating to use in fragrances, and we didn't want anything that was only relevant to the Christmas week; we wanted warm autumn and winter scents. 

So now you have an idea of how they will smell. Next step is to make the first batches - the 20 people who came along will get the first smells to test for the group, and they can put their reviews on Mrs Gloss & The Goss if they like.

There's still plenty of time to back our project. (If they turn out not to be exactly to your taste, you can always swap them on our Facebook group page.)
