story:
Synopsis: "Galtow" It is the year 2015 ...The age of Governments has passed in revolution and wars. The great Clan houses have engaged in conflicts over the years, each seeking to dominate the martial world which has sown a generation of children weaned on violence. From the ancient buildings of New York City, to the forbidding borders of the Bronx and Queens, chaos reigns as pretenders seek to lay claims to positions of power... An old lord has died, a victim of inner Treachery.

Be a part of the Action! We need your help to bring this exciting Indie Action, Adventure Comic to life.

The Urban Action Showcase and Expo is proud to co-produce it's first Action Short "Galtow" in association with Xmoor Studios and ASC Troopers Touch Entertainment. The UASE's facilitation protocol endeavors to both create and distribute new Heroic content that reflects multicultural images and interests. "Galtow"is an exciting Independent Action Adventure comic series written and produced by Robert Garrett of Xmoor Studios.

Your 2015 Donations goes towards the following Budget for the 30 min Short Film: $40,000

  • Filming 
  • Post Production
  • Locations and Permits Talent Development   (Training,Choreography, Rehearsals)
  • Costumes and Props
  • Marketing and Distribution 
  • Production Operations  (Craft Services, Crew Cost, Camera, Lighting)
Pre-order your Digital Copy or Donate today!

ASC Troopers Touch Entertainment has been producing and distributing Heroic content that reflects multicultural images and interests since 2004. We have distribution opportunities with all major digital platforms which are available from mobile to set top boxes. Find out more here: 

Would you like to be a Producer?

Find out how here: 

Please share our campaign and help us create more Heroes that reflect multicultural interests within the Block Buster Action Genre!
story_txt:
Synopsis: "Galtow" It is the year 2015 ...The age of Governments has passed in revolution and wars. The great Clan houses have engaged in conflicts over the years, each seeking to dominate the martial world which has sown a generation of children weaned on violence. From the ancient buildings of New York City, to the forbidding borders of the Bronx and Queens, chaos reigns as pretenders seek to lay claims to positions of power... An old lord has died, a victim of inner Treachery.

Be a part of the Action! We need your help to bring this exciting Indie Action, Adventure Comic to life.


The Urban Action Showcase and Expo is proud to co-produce it's first Action Short "Galtow" in association with Xmoor Studios and ASC Troopers Touch Entertainment. The UASE's facilitation protocol endeavors to both create and distribute new Heroic content that reflects multicultural images and interests. "Galtow"is an exciting Independent Action Adventure comic series written and produced by Robert Garrett of Xmoor Studios.

Your 2015 Donations goes towards the following Budget for the 30 min Short Film: $40,000

Filming 
Post Production

Locations and Permits Talent Development   (Training,Choreography, Rehearsals)

Costumes and Props
Marketing and Distribution 
Production Operations  (Craft Services, Crew Cost, Camera, Lighting)

Pre-order your Digital Copy or Donate today!    
ASC Troopers Touch Entertainment has been producing and distributing Heroic content that reflects multicultural images and interests since 2004. We have distribution opportunities with all major digital platforms which are available from mobile to set top boxes. Find out more here: 



Would you like to be a Producer?
Find out how here:  Please share our campaign and help us create more Heroes that reflect multicultural interests within the Block Buster Action Genre!

story:
Short Summary

I am a first-time filmmaker, trying to make a difference in how we as doctors care for patients, and in how the health care system can do its job more effectively. Each year, more than 200,000 people die from medical errors. There are a number of reasons for these mistakes, but everyone agrees the number would be much lower if doctors shared records. In this Internet age, we assume doctors anywhere can pull up our charts, but the truth is most have no way to do this. Technology is not the problem--the problem stems from a lack of will to invest in it. This documentary pieces together the story of why it's been so hard for our health care system to do something that other industries, like banking and retail, have been doing securely for years. And it uncovers the tragic, hidden cost on the lives of millions of Americans.  Take a look at our Trailer and look under the GALLERY tab on this page for more content. If you check us out on facebook, you will find clips from the movie there, as well.

What We Need & What You Get

I need $6,000 to complete the work necessary to get this film into print format. These funds will cover licenses for stock footage, DVD costs, and costs related to making the film available on iTunes, Amazon, and a number of other streaming sites.  If you don't help me, I'll get it done, but I could use your support to make this happen, and to help the country know we have national support!

If you can help me (and every little bit will help!)  I've got some great perks for you!

The Impact

After more than 25 years working in health care, I truly believe this film has the potential to influence national policy more than any other work I've done. More than my publications, and certainly more than my presentations around the world, simply because of the way film teaches.  

Our distribution plan involves regional and state screenings around the U.S., access to streaming versions of the film, and individual/group DVD sales.  The screenings are being  sponsored by groups and states. We have completed a screening and panel discussion in Michigan, and are actively planning one for Tennessee and Washington, D.C.  At each of these sessions, we will sell DVDs and convene experts to discuss local issues related to health information exchange.  We also will sell DVDs online from our web site and Amazon, as well as plan to stream from Netflix, Amazon, and iTunes.

story:
When we were about to start shooting one of our funders pulled out.
Let’s make the miracle happen #hagamoselmilagrito
[For English Subtitles click ‘CC’]


LA COSA ESTÁ ASÍ

Desde hace algunos meses venimos trabajando en la preproducción de esta película. Aunque Cristóbal, el director, lleva en esto desde el 2008!! Hicimos la tarea: investigación, equipo de producción, scouting, casting, locaciones, etc. (Para la historia completa, lean abajo)

Este año finalmente todo se alineó para poder grabar, un equipo de 12 personas trabajando con todas las ganas, una propuesta sólida, un cronograma favorable, financiamiento para el rodaje (y ojo que esto es complicado en un país como Costa Rica). Ayer, mientras Cristóbal ensayaba con los actores, y estando a solo DIEZ días de que empezara la grabación nuestro panorama cambió: Una llamada y 15 mil dólares con los que ya no podríamos contar para el proyecto parecían traerse todo abajo. Empezó a llover.

Gran parte de nuestra historia pasa en la reconocida Romería hacia la negrita, ese evento cultural que vive nuestro país cada 2 de agosto (sí, en dos semanas se nos viene encima) pero, como no podemos grabar toda una película en un solo día, tenemos como fecha de inicio el 25 de julio, es decir, en nueve días.

El equipo se mantiene motivado y ninguno se quiere echar para atrás (ni para agarrar impulso), ahorita lo que necesitamos es el último empujón. Con el apoyo de algunas personas y empresas hemos logrado sacar adelante transportes, hospedajes, entre otras cosas. Pero esos 15 mil dólares son vitales para cubrir gastos de equipo técnico, alimentación, equipo de producción y cast. Esos 15 mil dólares son lo que ahorita nos separan de terminar lo que hace mucho empezamos con tanta ganas.

A lado encontrarán los diferentes paquetes de financiamiento que les proponemos, hicimos un esfuerzo por ofrecerles perks atractivos que esperamos que les gusten; pero si no es el caso, siempre nos pueden escribir con sus comentarios para mejorarlos :)IMPORTANTE: Como ya les contamos, la grabación comienza el 25 de julio y la campaña cierra hasta el 02 de agosto; esto es porque con el financiamiento que tenemos ahorita podemos cubrir los gastos de una semana de rodaje, por lo que el apoyo de ustedes es increíblemente importante para terminar las otras tres semanas grabación. Cada aporte es un incentivo para poder sumar días al plan de filmación.

De una vez gracias, y ¡que comience a llover!

EL CUENTO LARGO

(Esto es lo de arriba, pero contándoles nuestra historia, así que si nos querés conocer más leelo, si no, pues esperamos que con la info de arriba haya bastado para que donés ;) )

Hace aproximadamente 4 años, Cristóbal Serrá empezó a desarrollar un proyecto de ficción. Era algo un poco loco, tenía que ver con la Romería, grabar a esta mujer que hace la peregrinación para intentar superar un duelo. Pero el proyecto era un largometraje y parecía muy muy lejano.

Hace tres años Cristóbal y Federico, aunque se conocían desde la universidad, coincidieron en unos talleres de Cinergia, se llamaban Cine hecho a mano, y esto sembró en ambos una inquietud de hacer películas con presupuestos reducidos, y no con los millones de dólares que normalmente se requieren.

Pero en ese momento no había dinero, entonces Cristóbal partió a Chile y luego a España, y Federico se dedicó a hacer crecer su empresa de producción publicitaria Caramba Films.

El tiempo pasó, y a finales del año pasado dos factores se juntaron: Federico había decidido abrir una división de Desarrollo de Proyectos en Caramba Films y Cristóbal estaba de vuelta en Costa Rica para el Festival de Cine Paz con la Tierra. El clic fue inmediato, querían trabajar juntos.  En ese momento empezaron a hablar de “El calor después de la lluvia”, pero Cristóbal tenía que regresar a Chile a trabajar en otra película.

La espinita quedó ahí, y poco a poco Caramba Films fue montando una estructura de producción para desarrollar películas. El objetivo: filmar una película en el 2015.

De nuevo los astros se alinearon y Cristóbal regresó a Costa Rica en mayo, con una versión de guión muchísimo más elaborada. Finalmente la película estaba lista para desarrollarse.

Era mayo, la romería era en agosto. Dos meses y un poquito los separaban de la fecha obligatoria de rodaje, pero el compromiso del equipo era muy grande.

Alejandra Vargas como productora ejecutiva de Caramba Films tomó el proyecto como propio y encendió una maquinaria de producción que en 2 meses había no solo conseguido el financiamiento necesario para la película sino que tenía a 12 personas trabajando en sacar el proyecto adelante.

La búsqueda de locaciones estaba a un 95% lista, ya se estaba comprando vestuario y preparando props. El casting ya estaba ensayando. Se habían hecho pruebas de cámara con distintas unidades hasta que finalmente se escogió un kit que funcionaba a la perfección para la película.

Caramba Films con base en esas pruebas decidió invertir cerca de $20mil en equipo técnico para la producción de la película, aparte del aporte en capital que ya estaba planteado para producción y postproducción.

Pero todo era demasiado bueno para ser cierto. El 15 de julio, a solo 10 días de empezar a rodar, recibimos una llamada. Cuando colgamos nos llenaba un sentimiento de incertidumbre, de tristeza e inclusive de ira: un presupuesto con el que contábamos para pagar a los actores, la comida y parte del crew se había desvanecido. 15mil dólares que hacen la diferencia entre poder o no poder hacer la película.

Entonces queda pedir un milagro, esperar que la negrita y todos ustedes nos permitan en estos 09 días que nos quedan para empezar, poder recoger el dinero para que esta película sea realidad.

A la peli le quedarían todavía casi tres semanas de filmación para poder terminarse, y es por esto que existe esta campaña.

--- ENGLISH ---

HERE'S THE THING

We’ve been working on this project for a few months, but Cristobal, our director, started in 2008. We did our part: our research, our fieldwork, casting, and getting every aspect for the production ready.

This year things work out so that we could make the film, with a team of 12 people working with all their energies, a strong story, and a favorable schedule, and funding for the film (this is very difficult in a place like Costa Rica). However, yesterday, just ten days before we start shooting, while Cristobal was rehearsing with our actors, everything changed… A phone call and we were 15 K USD short. It seemed like the project was impossible… but it started raining.

Our story is set during La Romería, a pilgrimage, towards la Negrita, a miraculous figure of Mother Mary. But more than a religious festival, the pilgrimage is also a very important cultural event. Every year, on August 2, millions of people join La Romería to visit the Negrita and ask for favors. Because we have to start shooting before event we were planning to do it on July 25, nine days from today.

Our team is motivated and we want to make it happen regardless of anything, now we just need a final push. Those 15K are crucial for covering food, and equipment. We need them to make our miracle happen.

On the side you’ll find our perks: we hope you love them, and if you don’t let us know, we can always make them better :) We are starting on July 25 because with the funding we have now we can cover the cost of one week of shooting, your support is really important so that we can finance the next three weeks. Every dollar you give means more shooting days and a better film.

Thanks again and let the rain begin! 

IT'S A LONG STORY

Four years ago, Cristóbal Serrá started working on a screenplay. It sounded weird, it was about La Romería, filming a woman in her pilgrimage to deal with her mourning. The screenplay was for a feature film and at the time making it was an impossible dream.

Cristóbal and Federico met in college, but three years ago they bumped into each other in a workshop on ‘Cine hecho a mano’ [Handmade Cinema], and they both started thinking of making low budget films.

But back then they didn’t have the money for a low budget film. Cristóbal moved to Chile and then Spain, and Federico started Caramba Films, his own production company.

Last year Federico decided it was time for Caramba to start working on features and Cristóbal was back in Costa Rica for a film festival. The click happened immediately, they wanted to work together. They started talking about “El calor después de la lluvia”, but Cristóbal had to go back to Chile to work on a different film.

They didn’t forget the project and little by little Caramba Films started working towards filming a feature in 2015. Things came together, Cristóbal came back with an improved screenplay and the film was ready to be made.

It was May, and La Romería is in August. We had two months and some days until the shooting and we were all committed to make it happen!

Alejandra Vargas as executive producer of Caramba Films loved the project and got things started. In two months she had the funding and a consolidated team of 12 people.

Location scouting was almost done, we were buying costumes and making props. The was cast rehearsing and we were playing around with different cameras until we chose the right one for the project.  Caramba Films invested more than $20K in technical equipment only, without including the funding that was already raised for production and postproduction.

But it sounded too good to be true. On July 15, ten days before our first shooting date, we got a call. When the called finished we were uncertain about the future of the project. We were planning to use the funding to pay actors, food, and part of the crew. Our dream seemed almost impossible. 15K dollars makes a big difference in being able to shoot a film or not.

There was nothing left than asking for a miracle. And waiting for La Negrita, and all of you to be able to fundraise what we need to make the film real!

We still have three weeks more of shooting, and that’s why we started this campaign.

story:
It was only a matter of time

With the city of Las Vegas only a hop, skip and a jump from The Sugar Cookie in St George, it was only a matter of time before the sweet infection would spread and Las Vegas would NEED a Sugar Cookie of its own. That time is now. 

And although we know that we deserve most of the blame, some of you are guilty accomplices. Some of you have been smuggling these irresistible jewels across the border ever since you found out about us. You couldn't resist bringing cookies to your best friend, the office, or the family; or posting bragging photos on Instagram  with hashtags like: #frostingtodiefor. Its OK we understand, you couldn't resist sharing ......neither can we.

Las Vegas needs you ....and so do we

It's official The Sugar Cookie  is coming to the Sahara Pavilion on the corner of Sahara Ave. & Decatur Blvd. We are so excited to be a part of Las Vegas! And we're so close! So...........we need your help!! We've already purchased the equipment and covered most of the expenses for the remodel. But, we need just a little more to push us over the finish line.

What exactly are we using the money for?

We're almost there, we've come so far! In order to make the delicious cookies you want, we have to do a little more plumbing than we originally planned for, which means we're a little short....

We know, we know, we want to get there just as soon as you want us to be there, so help us out and buy a perk!! 

Our goal is lofty, but every little bit helps and we keep whatever we get here, so thank you, in advance!


Sweet! Whats in it for you:

Aside from our undying love and gratitude for your generosity, you also will have the opportunity to get some great perks when you help fund The Sugar Cookie - Las Vegas location. Including 

  • SWEET deals on gift certificates
  • Cookies for LIFE!
  • Special one of a kind apron
  • Much more

Other Ways You Can Help

Do us a huge favor by spreading the word about this campaign and our new location. Especially if you or your friends live in Vegas. Tag, share, tweet and post and make the world just a little sweeter place.

Again thanks for all your support! We are here to make your life sweet. You have made ours sweeter!

You couldn't resist bringing cookies to your best friend, the office, or the family; or posting bragging photos on Instagram  with hashtags like: #frostingtodiefor. Its OK we understand, you couldn't resist sharing ......neither can we.
Las Vegas needs you ....and so do we

It's official The Sugar Cookie  is coming to the Sahara Pavilion on the corner of Sahara Ave. & Decatur Blvd. We are so excited to be a part of Las Vegas! And we're so close! So...........we need your help!! We've already purchased the equipment and covered most of the expenses for the remodel. But, we need just a little more to push us over the finish line.








What exactly are we using the money for?
We're almost there, we've come so far! In order to make the delicious cookies you want, we have to do a little more plumbing than we originally planned for, which means we're a little short....
We know, we know, we want to get there just as soon as you want us to be there, so help us out and buy a perk!! 
Our goal is lofty, but every little bit helps and we keep whatever we get here, so thank you, in advance!




Sweet! Whats in it for you:

Aside from our undying love and gratitude for your generosity, you also will have the opportunity to get some great perks when you help fund The Sugar Cookie - Las Vegas location. Including 
 SWEET deals on gift certificates
Cookies for LIFE!
Special one of a kind apron
Much more
   Other Ways You Can Help Do us a huge favor by spreading the word about this campaign and our new location. Especially if you or your friends live in Vegas. Tag, share, tweet and post and make the world just a little sweeter place.
Again thanks for all your support! We are here to make your life sweet. You have made ours sweeter!

story:
Who We Are


Mount Shasta is a destination worldwide for people drawn to our incredible mountain, pristine natural forest, clear air, pure water and the spirituality of the area.

The Best of Mt Shasta started six years ago and each summer for three full days and evenings we provide workshops on Native Healing, Spirituality, Health & Wellness and Our Environment as well as an Outdoor Festival where people picnic in the park, next to the world renowned Headwaters, and enjoy Music, Dance, Yoga, Tai Chi, Vendors, Food and Celebration.



This conference and festival is the largest gathering in the Mount Shasta area to personally meet and form friendships with the people who live here, who are exploring and bringing forth the latest insights available from this extraordinary place. It’s a transforming moment for those who attend this event, hence our title: Discover Your Self Here!

Not everyone can get to Mount Shasta for the conference and festival and many people tell us we should Live Stream and provide On Demand Videos of the event. So, here we are, please help us achieve this goal.

For More Information On Who We Are:

  • Official Website
  • The Best of Mt Shasta Conference Schedule 2015




What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $3,500 to produce The Best of Mt Shasta Live Stream and On Demand Videos.
  • Costs include adding subscription and live stream to our website, preparing video graphics, a dry run session and follow-up, directing and filming, streaming, broadcasting, editing and archiving videos on demand.
  • This project will be produced in cooperation with the Siskiyou Media Council.
  • We are going to start small this year, with a one day Live Stream event.
  • Live Stream to be July 27, 2015 (the day after Annual Conference & Festival)
  • There will be eight one hour workshops given by local area presenters.
  • Next year we plan to live stream the full three days of The Best of Mt Shasta.
  • Free Access to The Best of Mt Shasta Live Stream and On Demand Videos is possible!
  • Check out your perks!


The Impact

  • We live at a time when more and more people are questioning their purpose; who am I, why am I here, where am I going? 
  • People come from all over the world to Mount Shasta looking for direction and connection; to explore new possibilities and to ask the deeper questions.
  • With The Best of Mt Shasta Live Stream and On Demand Videos everyone will be able to connect with Mount Shasta from any place in the world at any time.
  • And the impact locally?  Siskiyou County, where Mount Shasta is located, is one of the poorest counties in the State of California.  Your involvement helps our local economy and is much appreciated!


Our Challenge

  • Our biggest challenge is The Best of Mt Shasta Conference & Festival is only held three days out of the year and it is difficult for people to arrange their schedules to travel to Mount Shasta for those three days.
  • With Live Stream & On Demand Videos everyone will be able to be part of The Best of Mt Shasta from the comfort of their own home, wherever they live in the world, and with the option to connect with our community whenever they want.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and let everyone know about this great opportunity to make The Best of Mt Shasta Live Stream & On Demand Videos available to all people, everywhere, all the time!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
There is no such thing as an average addict.



Put together a veteran filmmaker (who is passionate about telling real stories), and a professional noise maker (who happens to be a recovered addict, and the ceo of a massive drug treatment group), and you will get an incredible story!

  • Quintin van Kerken, top dog at www.antidrugalliance.com and an expert in all things drugs and addiction (check out the Gallery for TV interviews with Quintin), and his buddy Sean O, a veteran filmmaker with more experience than can be imagined, are the producers of this documentary. By producers, we mean that they do the filming, sound, editing and all the other stuff that needs to be done. Except cooking. They can't cook. Maybe Sean can, but that's a big maybe.
  • We want to tell the story of addiction in South Africa. It's not a rich or poor thing. It's not a black or white thing. It's a condition that millions of South Africans suffer from, and we want to use this movie to destigmatize addiction in our country, and show people addiction is not the end of the world.
  • Your contribution will mean that we get to make the film, and get it in front of at least 1 million school children, parents and families in South Africa. We aren't asking for much ;-)



What We Need & What You Get

  • We need a minimum of $12500 to get this project finished. We've already begun, and have to film stories around South Africa. So, that means at least $5000 for travelling, flights, accommodation and food. (We told you we can't cook).
  • There are a few electronic items we still need, such as another lens for the camera, and better sound equipment. Ours decided to die a terrible death. That comes to around $2500.
  • Post production is a costly business, that will set us back around $1000.
  • General permits, and licensing of copyrighted stuff comes in at just over $1000.
  • Every now and then, we need extra crew, so for the next 6 months, we've budgeted about $3000.


The Impact (Massive, of course)



  • A film like this has NEVER been made in South Africa.
  • This film will be distributed, FREE OF CHARGE, to at least 1000 schools in South Africa, meaning that we will reach a minimum of 1 MILLION school kids. 1 MILLION KIDS WILL GET TO SEE THIS MOVIE AND MAKE BETTER CHOICES ABOUT DRUGS AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE!
  • We want them to see the impact of drugs and addiction. We want them to see the reality of the devastation.


Risks & Challenges
  • On the filming side, we have an amazing director who understands the special needs of this film, and we have one of the foremost experts on drugs and addiction in South Africa who is interviewing and finding the stories. Quintin is extremely well respected, and he uses his experience to get into places filmmakers never could.
Other Ways You Can Help
  • If you can't contribute, SHARE SHARE SHARE!



IF WE DON'T MAKE THE FULL AMOUNT...
  • We will still complete the film, and charge South African schools a nominal fee of R100 (about $9) for a DVD copy of the film, and make the film available online for download at a nominal fee...

story:
The film MALESH [On Serbian MALEŠ] is important because it explores a wondrous world in which family traditions with deep roots on the Balkans closes all doors for the future. This is a topic that is little treated in the local cinema, and therefore represents a challenge.

In a man’s world, a woman who decides not to give posterity, gets exiled or chooses exile herself. Mother, heroine of the film MALESH, chose an ultimate exile, taking her three daughters with her.

*Serbian version below / Srpska verzija teksta nalazi se ispod



CONTEXT

Balkans, a place of explosive encounters of East and West. The last ray of orient and post-apocalyptic flower of the golden socialism. Ground sprouting unordinary families. Place where the extension of the family line is a woman’s biggest responsibility.

In this story, although seemingly normal at first, nothing truly is. The situation goes out of control at the youngest daughter’s 19th birthday, when Mother's struggle comes to its peak, as well as its fiasco at the same time.


This is a story of a vanishing world, a world made of four women, torn between an undeniable desire for family extension, and the freedom they are familiar with only in their imagination.

Film’s director Ivan Bakrač and screenwriter Bane Jevtić, along with DP Dušan Grubin and production designer Dragana Baćović, are a well-coordinated team working on their fourth mutual film. They’ve been working on film MALESH for almost a year now.

From the idea, to the script development and carefully chosen cast that are, as authors agree, unique in their authenticity, being the only ones that can create this layered story, its symbolism, as well as aesthetics, film MALESH is a one of a kind project asking for your support!

With your help, we can achieve so much with this film. Your contribution will be supporting a truly incredible team of filmmakers, from budding artists to established, award-winning creators. We truly believe this is a team you'll want to get behind.


CAST

Sonja Vukićević, a legendary Serbian ballet dancer, a choreographer and director and a life lover.

"As soon as I read Bane’s script, firstly I laughed my ass off, and then cried my eyes out over the life of the woman I was supposed to play. I’m looking forward to working with Bane since he made his first acting steps in my theater troupe exactly 15 years ago."


Bebi Dol, the biggest pop star in Yugoslavia in the last 30 years.

 "Film Malesh is quite a challenge for me because it offers layering for dreaming up, as well as for the exciting play. I accepted a film role after a few decades since my last one and I chose this story cause I immediately fell in love with the script and the crew."


Hristina Popović, one of Serbia’s most popular actresses.

"This story is unique mostly because it differs from all of the films shot in the last several years, and this role is something I haven’t done or read before."


Maja Šuša, popular Serbian actress of the youngest generation.

"I worked with Ivan and Bane on their previous film, and I am honored to be in this company. I can’t wait for the shooting to begin! "


ABOUT AUTHORS

Ivan Bakrač and Bane Jevtić began their collaboration in 2010 on Bakrač’s graduation film called “A Small, Good Thing“. Two years later, in 2012, Ivan Bakrač made film “Wars”, based on the motives of Adam Haslett’s short story. A year later, in 2013, Ivan decided to shoot a short film based on the story and screenplay of Bane. Give the name of the film "Our skin is going to gray".


Bane Jevtić, an actor, writer and painter, was born in Belgrade, Serbia in 1978. After graduating acting, Bane played in almost every Belgrade theater, spreading his acting experiences on films, as well as television. Writing has been a passion of his for several years, while his screenwriting debut happened in 2013, for a film “Our skin is going to gray”, for which he even received a Best Script Award at 2014 Bašta Fest. At the moment, he is preparing a collection of short stories, as well as a script for his first feature-length film.

Screenwriter’s Explication

After reflecting for a very long time on the notion of freedom here and today, avoiding generalization and making it quite personal, I came up to an idea of writing some kind of my confession regarding this so wanted freedom I only have in theory. This tendency towards an ultimate freedom is ultimately the one creating prison.
Story’s core is a pathological ambition of realizing an idea whose premise is wrong, unquestionably bringing the story’s hero to the downfall, as well as sacrificing everything she has, in this case her whole family, for the sake of something unattainable.


Ivan Bakrač, born in Nikšić, Montenegro in 1987. He received his Masters degree in Film Directing at Faculty of Arts and Design. He directed several short and medium-length films, also working as a screenwriter, editor and producer.
His films have been included in numerous international film festivals. Bakrač is this year’s participator of the Berlinale Talents program, as well as Talents Sarajevo. He is currently working on his first feature-length film.

Director’s Explication

Bane Jevtić’s script, besides its originality, caught my attention mostly because of its extremely unique and realistic atmosphere, creating a fantastic visual potential. This script offered me numerous possibilities for exploration, playing with forms, media etc. As a result, we are given the opportunity to create one specific world that looks different from the ones we’ve had the chance of seeing in previous short films.

Ivan's and Bane's collaborations:

Film WARS


Bane Jevtić was collaborator on the script.
The film "Wars" was noticed in a lot of international festivals, and some of them are:
* Kustendorf International Film Festival (Premiere)
* Athens International Film + Video Festival, Ohio (Oscar Qualifying)
* Zoom Zblizenia International Film Festival - The Best Student Film Award
* Zlín International Film Festival
* Long Island International Film Expo
* Let's Cee Film Festival


Film OUR SKIN IS GOING TO GRAY


Regardless of the poor production support, this film achieved great success at various international festivals:
* London Film Festival
* Belo Horizonte International Short Film Festival
* Thess International Short Film Festival - Cinematic Achievement Award
* Bašta Fest  - 'Golden inspiration' Award for the best screenplay
* Tirana International Film Festival
* Belgrade Documentary and Short Film Festival



Why did we choose Indiegogo?


We chose Indiegogo in the spirit of sharing and caring. Having you all involved at the launch of this project brings such a great feeling of support and also inherently guidance. You are our audience and our moral supporters; our big spoons. We'll have you with us as we take this journey of filmmaking. Okay, enough with the corny stuff. But really, each contribution is deeply felt.


SRPSKA VERZIJA

_____________________

Film Maleš je važan zato što istražuje jedan začudan svet porodice u kojoj ukorenjenost tradicije sa Balkanskih prostora zatvara sva vrata za budućnost. To je tema koja je jako malo obrađena u ovdašnjoj kinematografiji, i zbog toga predstavlja izazov.

U muškom svetu,  žena koja ne podari naslednika,  biva izgnana ili sama odabere izgnanstvo. Glavna junakinja filma Maleš je sa sobom u krajnje izgnanstvo povela i svoje tri ćerke. 

KONTEKST

Balkan, mesto eksplozivnog susreta istoka i zapada. Poslednji krak orijenta i postapokaliptični cvet zlatnog socijalizma. Tlo na kojem niču nesvakidašnje porodice. Mesto gde je produžetak porodične loze najveća obaveza žene.

U ovoj priči, na prvi pogled se čini da je ovde sve normalno, iako zapravo ništa nije. Cela situacija izmiče kontroli na 19. rođendan najmlađe ćerke, kada  borba majke dostiže vrhunac i fijasko istovremeno. 

Ovo je priča o jednom svetu koji nestaje, svetu koji čine četiri žene, rastrzane između velike želje za produženjem loze i slobode koju poznaju samo u mašti.

Reditelj Ivan Bakrač i scenarista Bane Jevtić su sa direktorom fotografije Dušanom Grubinom i scenografkinjom Draganom Baćović uigrana ekipa kojoj je ovo četvrti zajednički film, a na filmu Maleš zajedno rade već skoro godinu dana.

Od ideje, preko izrade scenarija, do pažljivo odabranih glumica koje su, po rečima autora, jedinstvene u svojoj autentičnosti, i kao takve jedine koju mogu da iznesu ovu slojevitu priču, simboliku, ali i estetiku.


PODLEA

Sonja Vukićević je čuvena balerina, koreograf i reditelj koja život posmatra širom otvorenih očiju.

„Čim sam pročitala Banetov scenario, prvo sam se sita ismejala, a  onda sam se rasplakala nad životom žene koju bi trebalo da igram. Jako se radujem saradnji sa Banetom jer je on prve glumačke korake napravio u mojoj pozorišnoj trupi pre tačno 15 godina“

Bebi Dol, najveća pop zvezda u Jugoslaviji u poslednjih 30 godina.

„Film Maleš je za mene izazov jer nudi slojevitost kako za razmaštavanje, tako i za uzbudljivu igru. Nakon nekoliko decenija sam prihvatila ulogu na filmu, jer sam se u scenario i u ekipu zaljubila na prvo gledanje”

Hristina Popović, trenutno jedna od najpopularnijih glumica u Srbiji.

„Ova priča je jedinstvena pre svega po tome što se razlikuje od svih kinematografskih u poslednjih nekoliko godina, a moja uloga je nešto sa čim se nisam do sada susretala“

Maja Šuša, popularna glumica najmlađe generacije.

„Sa Ivanom i Banetom sam sarađivala na njihovom prethodnom filmu, čast mi je što sam u ovom društvu i odbrojavam dane do početka snimanja” 


O AUTORIMA


Bane Jevtić, glumac, pisac i slikar, rođen u Beogradu, Srbija, 1978.godine. Završio je glumu, i igrao u skoro svim beogradskim pozorištima, na filmu i televiziji. Pisanjem se bavi dugi niz godina, a scenaristički debi mu je scenario za film “Koža će nam postati siva” (2013.), za koju je i dobio nagradu “Zlatna inspiracija” za najbolji scenario na Bašta Festu 2014.godine. Priprema prvu zbirku kratkih priča, a planira i scenario za prvi dugometražni film.

Scenaristička eksplikacija

Nakon dugog promišljanja o pojmu slobode ovde i danas, ne generalizujući istu, već vrlo na ličnom planu, došao sam na ideju da napišem svoju ispovest o jako željenoj slobodi koju imam samo naizgled. Težnja ka potpunoj slobodi je ona koja koja zapravo stvara zatvor. Srž priče je  patološka ambicija za ostvarenjem ideje čija je premisa pogrešna, koja neminovno mora dovesti idejnika u propast, kao i žrtvovanje svega što ima, u ovom slučaju cele porodice, zarad nečega što je nedostižno. Majka je napravila takvu porodičnu atmosferu da nijedna od ćerki ne odlazi od kuće, svi su simbiotski vezani i ostaju da žive izolovane, prihvatajući nametnutu ideju da je ovaj zatvor njihova jedina sloboda.

Ivan Bakrač, rođen je u Nikšiću 1987.godine. Završio je Master studije za filmsku režiju na Fakultetu za umetnost i dizajn. Režirao je nekoliko kratkih i srednjemetražnih filmova, a radio je i kao scenarista, montažer i producent. Njegovi filmovi su učestvovali na raznim internacionalnim filmskim festivalima. Ovogodišnji je učesnik programa Berlinale talents, i Talents Sarajevo. Pored filma „Maleš“ priprema i svoj prvi dugometražni film pod nazivom "Posle zime".

Rediteljska eksplikacija

Tekst Baneta Jevtića, osim zbog svoje originalnosti, privukao me je najviše zbog veoma zanimljive atmosfere koja pruža veliki vizuelni potencijal. Ovaj scenario ponudio mi je razne mogućnosti za istraživanje, igranje sa formama, medijima... I kao rezultat može se dobiti jedan specifičan svijet, koji izgleda drugačije od većine onih koje danas možemo vidjeti u kratkim filmovima.


Ivanove i Banetove saradnje:

Film RATOVI

Bane je na ovom Ivanovom filmu saradnik na scenariju. Film je zapažen na više međunarodnih festivala, a neki od njih su:

* Kustendorf International Film Festival (Premijera)
* Athens International Film + Video Festival, Ohio (Oscar Qualifying)
* Zoom Zblizenia International Film Festival - Nagrada za najbolji studentski film
* Zlín International Film Festival
* Long Island International Film Expo
* Let's Cee Film Festival


Film KOŽA ĆE NAM POSTATI SIVA

Sa ekipom iz prethodnog filma, po Banetovoj priči snimaju ovaj film bez budžeta. Bez obzira na slabu produkcionu podršku, ovaj film ostvaruje uspehe na raznim internacionalnim festivalima, neki od njih su:

* London Film Festival
* Belo Horizonte International Short Film Festival
* Thess International Short Film Festival - Cinematic Achievement Award
* Bašta Fest  - Nagrada 'Zlatna inspiracija' za najbolji scenario
* Tirana International Film Festival
* Beogradski festival kratkometražnog i dokumentarnog filma


THANK YOU FOR THE SUPPORT!

CAST
Sonja Vukićević, a legendary Serbian ballet dancer, a choreographer and director and a life lover.
"As soon as I read Bane’s script, firstly I laughed my ass off, and then cried my eyes out over the life of the woman I was supposed to play. I’m looking forward to working with Bane since he made his first acting steps in my theater troupe exactly 15 years ago."Bebi Dol, the biggest pop star in Yugoslavia in the last 30 years. "Film Malesh is quite a challenge for me because it offers layering for dreaming up, as well as for the exciting play. I accepted a film role after a few decades since my last one and I chose this story cause I immediately fell in love with the script and the crew."Hristina Popović, one of Serbia’s most popular actresses.
"This story is unique mostly because it differs from all of the films shot in the last several years, and this role is something I haven’t done or read before."Maja Šuša, popular Serbian actress of the youngest generation."I worked with Ivan and Bane on their previous film, and I am honored to be in this company. I can’t wait for the shooting to begin! "

ABOUT AUTHORS Ivan Bakrač and Bane Jevtić began their collaboration in 2010 on Bakrač’s graduation film called “A Small, Good Thing“. Two years later, in 2012, Ivan Bakrač made film “Wars”, based on the motives of Adam Haslett’s short story. A year later, in 2013, Ivan decided to shoot a short film based on the 
story and screenplay of Bane. Give the name of the film "Our skin is 
going to gray".Bane Jevtić, an actor, writer and painter, was born in Belgrade, Serbia in 1978. After graduating acting, Bane played in almost every Belgrade theater, spreading his acting experiences on films, as well as television. Writing has been a passion of his for several years, while his screenwriting debut happened in 2013, for a film “Our skin is going to gray”, for which he even received a Best Script Award at 2014 Bašta Fest. At the moment, he is preparing a collection of short stories, as well as a script for his first feature-length film.Screenwriter’s ExplicationAfter reflecting for a very long time on the notion of freedom here and today, avoiding generalization and making it quite personal, I came up to an idea of writing some kind of my confession regarding this so wanted freedom I only have in theory. This tendency towards an ultimate freedom is ultimately the one creating prison.Story’s core is a pathological ambition of realizing an idea whose premise is wrong, unquestionably bringing the story’s hero to the downfall, as well as sacrificing everything she has, in this case her whole family, for the sake of something unattainable. Ivan Bakrač, born in Nikšić, Montenegro in 1987. He received his Masters degree in Film Directing at Faculty of Arts and Design. He directed several short and medium-length films, also working as a screenwriter, editor and producer. His films have been included in numerous international film festivals. Bakrač is this year’s participator of the Berlinale Talents program, as well as Talents Sarajevo. He is currently working on his first feature-length film.Director’s ExplicationBane Jevtić’s script, besides its originality, caught my attention mostly because of its extremely unique and realistic atmosphere, creating a fantastic visual potential. This script offered me numerous possibilities for exploration, playing with forms, media etc. As a result, we are given the opportunity to create one specific world that looks different from the ones we’ve had the chance of seeing in previous short films.Ivan's and Bane's collaborations: Film WARS Bane Jevtić was collaborator on the script.The film "Wars" was noticed in a lot of international festivals, and some of them are:* Kustendorf International Film Festival (Premiere)* Athens International Film + Video Festival, Ohio (Oscar Qualifying)* 
Zoom Zblizenia 
 International Film Festival - The Best Student Film Award* Zlín International Film Festival* Long Island International Film Expo* Let's Cee Film FestivalFilm OUR SKIN IS GOING TO GRAY Regardless of the poor production support, this film achieved great success at various international festivals:* London Film Festival* Belo Horizonte International Short Film Festival* Thess International Short Film Festival - Cinematic Achievement Award* Bašta Fest  - 'Golden inspiration' Award for the best screenplay* Tirana International Film Festival* Belgrade Documentary and Short Film FestivalWhy did we choose Indiegogo?We chose Indiegogo in the spirit of sharing and caring. Having you all involved at the launch of this project brings such a great feeling of support and also inherently guidance. You are our audience and our moral supporters; our big spoons. We'll have you with us as we take this journey of filmmaking. Okay, enough with the corny stuff. But really, each contribution is deeply felt. SRPSKA VERZIJA_____________________
Film Maleš je važan zato što istražuje jedan začudan svet porodice u
kojoj ukorenjenost tradicije sa Balkanskih prostora zatvara sva vrata za
budućnost. To je tema koja je jako malo obrađena u ovdašnjoj kinematografiji, i
zbog toga predstavlja izazov.

U muškom svetu,  žena koja ne podari naslednika,  biva izgnana ili sama odabere
izgnanstvo. Glavna junakinja filma Maleš je sa sobom u krajnje izgnanstvo
povela i svoje tri ćerke.  
KONTEKST
Balkan, mesto eksplozivnog susreta
istoka i zapada. Poslednji krak orijenta i postapokaliptični cvet zlatnog
socijalizma. Tlo na kojem niču nesvakidašnje porodice. Mesto gde je produžetak
porodične loze najveća obaveza žene. 

U ovoj priči, na prvi
pogled se čini da je ovde sve normalno, iako zapravo ništa nije. Cela situacija
izmiče kontroli na 19. rođendan najmlađe ćerke, kada  borba majke dostiže
vrhunac i fijasko istovremeno. 
Ovo je
priča o jednom svetu koji nestaje, svetu koji čine četiri žene, rastrzane
između velike želje za produženjem loze i slobode koju poznaju samo u mašti. 
Reditelj Ivan Bakrač
i scenarista Bane Jevtić su sa
direktorom fotografije Dušanom Grubinom
i scenografkinjom Draganom Baćović
uigrana ekipa kojoj je ovo četvrti
zajednički film, a na filmu Maleš
zajedno rade već skoro godinu dana.
Od ideje, preko izrade scenarija, do pažljivo odabranih glumica
koje su, po rečima autora, jedinstvene u svojoj autentičnosti, i kao takve
jedine koju mogu da iznesu ovu slojevitu priču, simboliku, ali i estetiku.
PODLEA
Sonja Vukićević je čuvena
balerina, koreograf i reditelj koja život posmatra širom otvorenih očiju.
„Čim sam pročitala Banetov scenario, prvo sam se sita ismejala, a  onda sam se rasplakala nad životom žene
koju bi trebalo da igram. Jako se radujem saradnji sa Banetom jer je on prve
glumačke korake napravio u mojoj pozorišnoj trupi pre tačno 15 godina“
Bebi
Dol,
najveća pop zvezda u Jugoslaviji u poslednjih 30 godina.
„Film Maleš je za mene izazov jer nudi
slojevitost kako za razmaštavanje, tako i za uzbudljivu igru. Nakon nekoliko
decenija sam prihvatila ulogu na filmu, jer sam se u scenario i u ekipu
zaljubila na prvo gledanje” 
Hristina Popović, trenutno
jedna od najpopularnijih glumica u Srbiji.
„Ova
priča je jedinstvena pre svega po tome što se razlikuje od svih
kinematografskih u poslednjih nekoliko godina, a moja uloga je nešto sa čim se
nisam do sada susretala“
Maja Šuša, popularna glumica
najmlađe generacije.
„Sa Ivanom i Banetom sam sarađivala na njihovom prethodnom filmu, čast mi je
što sam u ovom društvu i odbrojavam dane do početka snimanja” O AUTORIMA
Bane
Jevtić, glumac, pisac i slikar, rođen u Beogradu, Srbija,
1978.godine. Završio je glumu, i igrao u skoro svim beogradskim pozorištima, na
filmu i televiziji. Pisanjem se bavi dugi niz godina, a
scenaristički debi mu je scenario za film “Koža će nam postati siva” (2013.),
za koju je i dobio nagradu “Zlatna inspiracija” za najbolji scenario na Bašta
Festu 2014.godine. Priprema prvu zbirku kratkih priča, a
planira i scenario za prvi dugometražni film.
Scenaristička
eksplikacija
Nakon dugog promišljanja o pojmu slobode ovde i danas, ne
generalizujući istu, već vrlo na ličnom planu, došao sam na ideju da napišem
svoju ispovest o jako željenoj slobodi koju imam samo naizgled. Težnja ka
potpunoj slobodi je ona koja koja zapravo stvara zatvor. Srž priče je 
patološka ambicija za ostvarenjem ideje čija je premisa pogrešna, koja
neminovno mora dovesti idejnika u propast, kao i žrtvovanje svega što ima, u
ovom slučaju cele porodice, zarad nečega što je nedostižno. Majka je napravila takvu porodičnu atmosferu da nijedna od
ćerki ne odlazi od kuće, svi su simbiotski vezani i ostaju da žive izolovane,
prihvatajući nametnutu ideju da je ovaj zatvor njihova jedina sloboda.
Ivan
Bakrač, rođen je u Nikšiću 1987.godine. Završio je Master studije
za filmsku režiju na Fakultetu za umetnost i dizajn. Režirao je nekoliko
kratkih i srednjemetražnih filmova, a radio je i kao scenarista, montažer i
producent. Njegovi filmovi su
učestvovali na raznim internacionalnim filmskim festivalima. Ovogodišnji je
učesnik programa Berlinale talents, i
Talents Sarajevo. Pored filma „Maleš“
priprema i svoj prvi dugometražni film pod nazivom "Posle zime".
Rediteljska eksplikacija
Tekst
Baneta Jevtića, osim zbog svoje originalnosti, privukao me je najviše zbog
veoma zanimljive atmosfere koja pruža veliki vizuelni potencijal. Ovaj scenario
ponudio mi je razne mogućnosti za istraživanje, igranje sa formama, medijima...
I kao rezultat može se dobiti jedan specifičan svijet, koji izgleda drugačije
od većine onih koje danas možemo vidjeti u kratkim filmovima. 
Ivanove i Banetove saradnje: Film RATOVI
Bane je na ovom Ivanovom filmu saradnik na
scenariju. Film je zapažen na više međunarodnih festivala, a neki od njih su:
* Kustendorf International Film Festival (Premijera)* Athens International Film + Video Festival, Ohio (Oscar Qualifying)* 
Zoom Zblizenia 
 International Film Festival - Nagrada za najbolji studentski film* Zlín International Film Festival* Long Island International Film Expo* Let's Cee Film FestivalFilm KOŽA ĆE NAM POSTATI SIVA
Sa ekipom
iz prethodnog filma, po Banetovoj priči snimaju ovaj film bez budžeta. Bez
obzira na slabu produkcionu podršku, ovaj film ostvaruje uspehe na
raznim internacionalnim festivalima, neki od njih su:
* London Film Festival* Belo Horizonte International Short Film Festival* Thess International Short Film Festival - Cinematic Achievement Award* Bašta Fest  - Nagrada 'Zlatna inspiracija' za najbolji scenario* Tirana International Film Festival* Beogradski festival kratkometražnog i dokumentarnog filma
THANK YOU FOR THE SUPPORT!

story:
Project Summary

Hi! My name is Sean Mo Williams! 
Join me in raising $3,000 to produce the short film, "Awakening."
This project is a passion of mine and I have been working on it for over two years.
I have given my blood, sweat, and tears and am ready to give even more! 
By joining us in the making of this film, you will be helping to create a piece of art that seeks to open a discussion about the nature of violence within American society. We want to challenge the way people think and hope to give them a truly thrilling and entertaining story.  This campaign will be over fast, so please read all about it below and thank you for your support. 

About Me 

I am an actor, writer, and filmmaker living in Los Angeles. I've written, directed, and produced three short films in the last three years. In addition, I was given awards for Best Director and Best Actor in a Drama for the short film "Alyona."
Along with this I have worked in production on two feature films  and several TV shows.  For the past two years, I have studied acting at the Playhouse West School and Repertory Theater in North Hollywood while continuing to write and improve my skills as a filmmaker.  
What We Need & What You Get 

We need $3,000 to make this film happen. 

This money will be used for production and post production costs including:

- Location Fees

- Make-Up Artist 

- Equipment

- Editing

- Color Correction

- Sound Mixing  

- Festival Fees 

- Food for Actors/Crew 

By contributing to this campaign you have access to a load of amazing perks including: digital downloads, premiere tickets, an autographed copy of the script, a night on the town courtesy of "Team Awakening," as well as the opportunity to see your name in bright lights as an Executive Producer for the film! 

In the very unlikely chance that we don't reach our goal, the funds will be concentrated towards location fees, the make-up artist, and sound mixing. 

Risks & Challenges

During my last three short films, I learned a lot about the time and resources it takes to make a successful film. 
The biggest risk for this project is that we won't have enough resources to complete the vision in a timely and efficient manner. In the past, I've had to shoot short films in poor lighting and under restricted circumstances. This meant that the quality of the picture was not always what i wanted it to be. With your help, our team can be given the freedom to make much better choices for the quality of the film. 
We also need to make sure we have the capability to reach out to a larger audience. Submitting short films to festivals can be a challenging process, it's like asking someone to marry you and not hearing from them for 4 months. Not to mention, each submission comes with a fee. The advantage of this film is that it touches on themes that many people can relate to, which will make it easy to find a home for the film.    


Other Ways You Can Help

  • You are so important to the creation of this film. Please help us by sharing the campaign with your friends, family, co-workers, and even your pets! 
  • Remember to #awakeningfilm on all your social media platforms! 
A sincere THANK YOU to all of you for taking the time to read this page.

story:
WHO WE ARE

We are three women making our thesis film Sound Soaker, in the Film Master program at Full Sail University.

·  Producer: My name is Jia Cui, I have filmmaking experience and got a bachelor’s degree in Animation in China. I love movies and a desire to make more awesome movies for anyone in the world.

·  Director: My name is Amara, I hail from India where I studied Bachelor’s in Journalism with a minor in Film Studies. I make films with a sense of responsibility and aspire to travel the world making films in all regions and languages.

·  Writer/Director of Photography: My name is CJ Lersch, I have a bachelor’s degree in business and a minor in theatre.  I have taken the leap into film because it is my passion and what I feel I have to do with my life.  I want to make people laugh, cry and think.

WHAT WE'RE DOING

Sound Soaker is a short comedy film about the desire to live a silent life.  This is a script we are all excited and passionate about.  Currently we are in pre-production, getting together our cast, crew and location as well as planning and preparing for the shoot.  To keep up with our progress, you can check us out here...

Facebook: www.facebook.com/soundsoakermovie

Twitter: @SoundSoaker

Instagram: SoundSoaker

WHAT WE NEED

 This production is made by passion and trust between creative minds but in order to make the project a reality we need your help.

The money we receive will be an integral part of all the departments of this production.

LOCATION AND PERMITS: $300.00 +$180.00

·  We will shoot in a suburban house environment for 5 days.

·  The permits will be acquired from the film commission of Orlando.

FOOD: $1400.00

·  We have a hardworking cast and crew of 35 people including grips, electric, art department, assistant directors, and camera crew for the 5 days of production.  A fed crew is a happy and productive crew.

ART DEPARTMENT: $260.00

·  Our art department needs to gather enough decoration to make the house of our Sound Soaker family full of the clutter we all accumulate in our lives. 

FILM FESTIVALS: $250.00

Our hard work and your support cannot be for naught.  We will be submitting to film festivals with the objective of winning acclaim from the judges and smiles from the audience.

IMPACT

This film is a culmination of what we have learned and our talents.  We consider this our first step into the world of film.  We are showing the world who we are and at the same time putting a smile on the faces of our audience.  If all this film does is make someone laugh, it will be a success.

EQUIPMENT

We will shoot on Sony F65 camera with various prime lenses. The lighting and electric equipment are all acquired and we are all geared up to shoot the film in August.

Murphy’s Law

We are aware of Murphy’s Law, which states that anything that can go wrong will go wrong.  We see these times as challenges that we are ready and willing to accept.  It is important to attack issues that arise with a clear head and an ability to be flexible.

Other ways you can help

Let's create some virtual noise by sharing. We have tons of great Behind The Scenes content AND... 

If you share our Indiegogo page on social media and tag us you will be entered into a drawing for a FREE DVD copy of Sound Soaker and a SURPRISE GIFT!

story:
The Synopsis of Lost Gurl

“Lost Gurl” is the story about a 17 year old girl named Nola who falls in love with a 24 year old Man named Jay.  Early in the story we see that Nola runs away from home and moves in with Jay.  Nola believes everything is great until Jay's true identity reveals its self. Nola is then put through physical and mental abuse that no woman, especially a girl should ever experience.

The Purpose

 The purpose of “Lost Gurl” is to depict the true to life story of what happens when a young woman is negatively influenced by and older man. I believe that this film will be used to creatively show some of the struggles that young women face during their search for love. I believe that this film can be a powerful tool that can teach young women about the dangers of foolish love, and show the world the impact of domestic violence and abuse.   
Lost Gurl can be compared to films like  "The inevitable defeat of Mister and Pete." and "Precious" Two great films which show the impact of living in the urban environment.

            



Why do wee need your Support

To make a movie it requires a team effort, and that is why we are asking you to be a part of our team, and help us make “Lost Gurl.” Lost Gurl is planned to be a 14 day consecutive film production which requires resources and funding  that we do not have. We are asking for your support and for your donations to help us to raise $10,000 which will give us a total  budget of $30,000 which is the total funding we need to make this powerful film come to life. 

Below is a list of items in which your donation will help cover

  • Camera equipment

  • Lighting Equipment

  • Locations

  • Cast

  • Crew

  • Props

  • Food

 



Risks & Challenges

Making a movie is extremely tough and unpredictable.  Many things can happen to a production, such as a talent member getting sick, equipment malfunctions, losing a location before production begins, all of our footage on the main hard drive suddenly gets wiped out or destroyed by an electromagnet, or even "dropping" it at a certain angle. The most unpredictable factor of them all is that Chicagoland weather can take it’s toll on the production.

But with your donation to “Lost Gurl” you can help us minimize some of these production problems by allowing us to have funding to secure  back up equipment or have funding to rent a location or help us afford a reshoot for a possible rain day.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially to our campaign, you can still help us enormously by sharing our Indiegogo Homepage on  Facebook,  Twitter, and Instagram, or any of your social media platforms using the buttons to the left of our launch video provided by Indiegogo.  Also, if you are in chicago and looking to be an extra in the film, hit us up on our facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/thelostgurl

Other Ways You Can Help If you are unable to contribute financially to our campaign, you can still help us enormously by sharing our Indiegogo Homepage on  Facebook,  Twitter, and Instagram, or any of your social media platforms using the buttons to the left of our launch video provided by Indiegogo.  Also, if you are in chicago and looking to be an extra in the film, hit us up on our facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/thelostgurl

story:
PRESS RELEASE: 2015 GREAT LAKES CHRISTIAN FILM FESTIVAL #GLCFF @BOLBUFFALO

SOUTH BUFFALO TO HOST FIRST EVER CHRISTIAN FILM FESTIVAL IN WNY

Buffalo, NY (July 8, 2015) – The 2015 “Great Lakes Christian Film Festival” will be hosted at Bread of Life Church, 1638 South Park Ave, Buffalo, NY 14220 between Sunday August 16th – Wednesday August 19th, 2015.  The festival will feature over 50 films from around the world, representing over 10 countries, screening feature films, shorts films, documentaries, and music videos, as well as, many up and coming film trailers. The festival is open to the public and offers an array of subject material for any viewer, from Action and Drama, to Animation and Biographies, there is something for everyone to enjoy.

Opening Night at 6pm will be the Buffalo Premiere of the highly acclaimed feature film “Adrenaline” starring John Schneider, Michael Rosander, Myke Holmes, Gregory Alan Williams, Buffalo’s own Charlene Amoia, and directed by Joseph Simpkins.

Monday night at 6pm will be the red carpet Buffalo Premiere of award winning drama “The Sparrows: Nesting” starring Kevin Sorbo, Christopher Atkins, James DuVall, Nicole Criss, Judy Norton, Terri Minton, Valenzia Algarin, and directed by Nancy Criss and Josh Hodgins.

Festival Executive Director Shawn Greene began the planning stages for the Great Lakes Christian Film Festival in May of 2014 and began the submissions process in November 2014. Since then, over 90 films from around the globe were submitted in hopes of being selected, but just over 50 were chosen.

Walk-up registration begins Sunday August 16th from 3pm to 6pm for only $45 for all 4 days. Individual blocks of 2 hours are $4. Registration is open online now at a discounted rate $35 until August 9th.

Information for the entire festival, including accommodations, tickets, and sponsorship opportunities, is on the official website: http://www.GLCFF.com

story:
Contributions can continue on our follow-up campaign after this one ends, link below: 

http://igg.me/at/dWjKU3iTaNU 


Short Summary

I am a humanitarian therapist and Phd candidate set on organizing art-based therapy sessions with refugee children in Lebanon to teach them how to deal with the psychological consequences of war. Children develop an array of developmental and psychological problems when exposed to the traumatic events of war and art is proven to help prevent psychological dysfunction in the long run.Afterwards, I will take what I learned and share it with humanitarians and researchers working with refugees all around the world to strengthen their impact. Unfortunately, because of the lack of research on war-affected children, the programs they currently run are based on what they know about western kids.  

What We Need & What You Get

A follow up campaign was created to raise the remaining amount needed to get the first set of workshops running. 

The funds go straight into the workshops which offer, healthy meals, art material the children can keep, a safe working environment, safe transportation, psychosocial support, art training, recreation, insurance, etc. Ask me and I'll send you a detailed budget.

All funds raised (more or less than the goal) will go towards the workshops, the more money we raise, the more workshops we can organise, and the more kids we will help. 

Donations start at $1, and there are fun perks you can claim like; free access to the movies created by the children, a personalized art piece from one of the kids, and 10 hours of consultancy to a non-profit organization.  And More.  ----------> 

The Impact

A refugee camp is the most dangerous place for a child. Over 45 countries at war today, meaning that millions of children around the world struggle with the physical and psychological traumas of war. In Lebanon, there are Iraqi, Palestinian, Sudanese and now over 1.1 million registered Syrian refugees, causing a huge spillover effect. Not to mention, with over 4 million refugees fleeing the conflict in Syria, it is the world’s single largest refugee crisis for almost a quarter of a century under UNHCR’s mandate. Refugee children have higher risk of death, disability, and becoming rape victims. They are often taken out of school, become homeless, orphaned or are forced into violence. Their quality of life is drastically deteriorated causing serious physical and psychological suffering that can have a lasting effect on the course of their lives. 

These artistic workshops teach participants realistic ways of coping with the negative consequences of war. This is called psychological resilience and is the best way to prevent the development of psychological dysfunction in war-affected children. Art-based therapies are scientifically proven to enhance resilience and can easily be implemented in refugee camps.

Risks & Challenges

I am looking forward to implementing this project and many more to come, but I need your help to make it happen. If everything goes as planned, I should be able to go on the field by January 2016, however in case of delay (funds have not been raised fully yet, dangerous political instability, logistics, etc) it will be happening in march-april 2016. I am determined to get this project running and I would just love to see you be part of it with me. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Thank you

This project is part of an initiative by ART4LIVES, a soon to be, registered charity in Canada whose purpose is to prevent mental health problems in war-affected children by fostering resilience through art. It will provide resilience-building interventions, generate research data about resilience in war-zones, and offer constancy to NGO’s working with refugees.

story:
The McGoo Summaro

RooMcGoo.com is the interwebz home for Stories that Sing created by musical comedian/video maker, Roo McGoo. Each post on the site includes a story (article), and a song (musical video), blending theatricality, pop culture, and irreverent satire- a direct result of Roo's childhood media diet consisting of MTV Reality Shows, Original Broadway Cast Recordings, and SNL Re-Runs. 

This campaign will fund Roo McGoo's Inauguroo Season, which runs from August 3rd, 2015 - June 30, 2016. The season features an ongoing series of musical comedy web content on the site as well as live (!) musical comedy shows. The live shows will be performed in and around New York City, while web content will be available anywhere you can be distracted by tiny screens. Contributions made to The Inauguroo Season are instrumental to the shaping of this digital space as a springboard for live musical comedy shows. 

SPOILER ALERT: I'm Roo McGoo, and I wrote this myself. Any questions or feedback left in the comments section will be replied to ASAP!

What Team McGoo Needs & What You Get

I am raising $5,000 to operate The Inauguroo Season. The basic distribution of this budget is outlined below (a more specific budget breakdown is available upon request) :

  • $1500: "A New Musical" Production (Equipment rental, team stipends)
  • $1500: "Roo-ining Christmas" Production (Equipment rental, team stipends)
  • $800: Live Show Tech/Venue Fees ($200/show, for 4 live shows)
  • $500: Marketing & Outreach (Facebook & Twitter Ads, Postcards, Mailings)
  • $500: Yearly Operations (Domain, Squarespace, & Editing Software Fees)
  • $200: "Roo-ining Christmas" CD Production ($200/200 CDs, via DiscMakers)
  • $5,000: TOTAL
For your controobution, you get: 
  • PERKS: Amazing incentives to contribute include Roo-served seats at live shows, a personalized birthday video, or even an in-home sing along with Roo!
  • PEOPLE: The Inauguroo Season will create ample opportunities for performers, songwriters, & production creatives- don't you wanna be where the people are?
  • SWAG: "Everybody gets a button, everybody gets a button!" - Oprah.  
  • SONGS: You know, those things you can sing along to. Roo's got plenty of em, and many more in store if we can get the Inauguroo Season up and running!
  • LAUGHTER: The best medicine. Helping bring an entire season's worth of new comedy into the world- How's THAT for health insurance?!
  • LEVITY: The internet can be a downer. It needs more spaces that reflect our world with positivity and optimism. Help me build it! 

The Impact

On the surface, RooMcGoo is about telling stories through songs, and sharing songs that tell stories. However, contributors should know that RooMcGoo represents and will strive to uphold the following Core Values: 

  • What unites us is stronger than what divides us. No one is better or worse than anyone else, even if they are different, and everyone should get to feel comfortable being themselves. 
  • The internet age has brought with it incredible opportunities to connect, but also a new sense of disconnection, and it is time to begin bridging this gap. 
  • Everyone is a creative person in their own way, and everyone deserves to have their creativity shared, and their story heard. 
  • Musical comedy should be accessible to everyone, regardless of education, geography, or cultural background. 

Risks & Challenges

The Main Challenge: What makes Roo's content special? 

My Strategy:  I reformatted my site to feature stories and songs in a structure I have yet to see online -  the stories (articles) provide thoughtful, witty context for the songs (musical) videos, and also include links to any non-RooMcGoo generated content which inspired the story/song of that post, combining these elements to become a whole greater than the sum of its parts. 

Another Big Challenge: How can you maintain steady output of new digi-content while simultaneously producing live components?

My Strategy: I began shooting footage for the Inauguroo Season 9 months ago, and have workshopped first rounds of the "A New Musical"(in 2013) and "Roo-ining Christmas" (in 2014) webseries' to tighten all production phases for maximum efficiency, and establish a team of core collaborators. Similarly, I workshopped live screenings and comedy shows in the past year, practicing exactly how the web content can feed into a live component. 

And, just for fun, A Big Risk: What if this doesn't take off, nobody watches anything, and you don't get on Ellen?

My Strategy: Over time, with consistent content being released, I know the message of RooMcGoo will attract its own audience. Still, I cannot guarantee that any content produced & released by RooMcGoo will go "viral" or get anyone on Ellen (though, DUH, that would be pretty cool). What I can guarantee is, with your support, content will continue to be released regularly as long as there is a large audience for stories and songs. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have no money, fret not- neither do I! I completely understand! You can still support Roo, for froo:

You can Subscroo! Or follow on Twittoo or Instagroo! Or Like on Faceboo! 

These options are all easily accessible with the handy-dandy share buttons below. You can also share this IndieGoGo Page or the RooMcGoo homepage on any of your preferred social sites, and spread the word to anyone you know that enjoys laughing, enjoys singing, or enjoys lasagna*.

*Lasagna lovers might not necessarily enjoy laughing or singing, but writing this took a while and I'm hungry now. Contributions made in lasagna will not be denied.

story:
--Some of us don't want to be told we don't count as much as other people.
--Some of us remember a time when Respect had a place At Law and In Parliament.
--Some of us are sick and tired of being told myths and lies, from the Top down.
--We already see, Civil servants don't seem to care what effects they create for the law-abiding, the peace-able and the hard-working among us.
--The Windsors at Buckingham Palace have forgotten what they're there for: TO LEAD English-speaking peoples, worldwide, into Peace with Civility and Decency.
--It's no wonder Islam is outraged; most Christians are just as furious at Vice,  nepotism, bribery and human-trafficking going on under our noses.

One answer lies in turning away to gather in old and new ways, to remind  ourselves that the Celtic Culture was called "Great" when we lived by Brehon--Common Laws in Trust--and we gathered together in celebration of our culture . . . a practice all but forbidden to Celtic peoples today.

Let's take it one step at a time.  1st, let's file papers with the Crown Court, so They notice our Complaint; 2nd, let's organize a Celtic Religious Body to return to the Ways of Trust and Decency ascribed to our ancestors, by Canon Law.  In this way, we sidestep hierarchy and call on Monarchy to provide real leadership.

To follow through with Step ONE will require the following resources:  1) one 100-mile trip to San Francisco to the UK Consulate, for a visa, stamped. $200  2) one open ticket to London Heathrow Sept 10, $1100  3) a place to stay with diplomatic immunity (priceless); 4) secure transportation from the airport to the abode of the Host and then to the Crown Court ($650).  Meals and expenses also.  It ought to just take a few days to get these papers filed; and then we can go on to Step Two.

story:
About me

Hi! I'm Tommy Clarke,  by trade I'm an aerial photographer, travelling the world photographing the stunning landscapes I find from helicopters, but being a director has been a lifelong dream. At the beginning of 2019 I decided to make this dream a reality by writing my first script, Reappear. 

Film Plot

Reappear follows Frank, in his early twenties, on a mission to try and make his Mum smile again after losing her husband. Frank has always been told he's the spitting image of his Dad and this year he choses to embrace that! There is one particular photo his Mum adores; one of his Dad looking the epitome of cool, leaning against his motorbike, in his best biker gear, in front of a seaside pier. So Frank decides to fix up the old motorbike and set off on an adventure to find that pier and recreate that photo. Unaware that his journey is just beginning. 

What we are aiming to raise

We are hoping to raise £15,000 to create this short film. Almost half of this budget will be going towards payment for our amazing cast and crew, as well as catering and accommodation and travel for the duration of the shoot. The rest of the funding will go towards production, locations, filming rigs, permits, post production and film festival submissions, amongst many other costs.

What you'll get

We are really excited about the amazing rewards we have set up, which can be yours in a few simple steps! We really do appreciate any level of support and with that in mind we have rewards ranging from a digital copy of the film, to becoming an executive producer! 

The Impact 

We hope that this project can bring a little bit of happiness to those who watch it by bringing this adventurous yet heart-warming story to life. We hope that Reappear will be a great first step into directing and that this cast and crew can create a really special short film.

Risks & Challenges

One of the biggest challenges of creating Reappear will be condensing the best qualities of a feature film into fifteen minutes! Aside from that, a massive challenge will be that we only have a few days to film on the British coast.... in mid winter! We may need a bigger budget for the amount tea we will need to drink to stay warm!

Other Ways You Can Help

One of the best ways you could help us is by getting the word out there! Share our Indiegogo on any (or all…!) of your social media accounts and together we can get the word out there about this exciting project! 

 

Thanks for having a read and I hope you want to get involved!

Tommy
