story:
Short Summary

Hello, there. We are the team behind the upcoming short film, Impermanence.  The feature takes place in the near future where everyone's conversations are recorded through a device called CORTEX. CORTEX is an implant that records every conversation the host has, enabling them to re-live their fondest memoires.  The story focuses on Ellen March, a surveillance officer who uses CORTEX to find those who took the most important thing from her. 

Our aim for the film is to create an emotionally layered narrative, that is both authentic and futuristic, where you follow Ellen on her journey to seek redemption and piece the puzzle together yourselves. 

The story came about through writer and sound designer Peter Elsmere, who has always felt that sound was the untold hero within cinema and hasn't gained enough recognition, compared to its visual counterpart. 

Meet the Team 

Director - Callum Sexton 

 

When I think about film I think of creativity, commitment and team work. Growing up it was always my passion to work within the film industry and have been lucky enough to experience the thrill of productions first hand. As an actor I feel that my experience within the world of acting has allowed me to input those skills to the role of directing due to the fact I know exactly how a director needs to present himself and his ideas in order to achieve the maximum resemblance to our script/story. I grew up taking inspiration from British actors such as Daniel Radcliffe, whilst also admiring the emergence of Tom Holland. Directing wise Steven Spielberg heavily stood out to me whilst admiring the historic work of the likes of Kubrick and Hitchcock.

Writer and Sound Designer - Peter Elsmere

 

“When thinking about my passion for film and how it is has affected my life, sound has played a major role within that and since being at University that passion has only grown. With this in mind, I wanted to write a project that drew upon the importance of sound within film.  Inspired by films such as Memento and Miniority Report, the film at its core is about memories, and how we hold things close to us, particularly when dealing with grief. However, instead of the visuals providing the majority of the information like most other films, my aim is to work alongside the Cinematographer and create an audio-visual journey that is pleasing on the eyes but also, on the ears. This film is very deer to me and something that I have wanted to make for a while. I look forward to showing it to you in near the future.”  

Producer - Pete Bustin

 As a film student I love films in a dystopian setting such as Blade Runner and The Platform which heavily inspires some of the locations and props we’ll use throughout our production to create a similar cinematic aesthetic within our film. We aim to have a diverse cast and motifs that immerse the audience with within our film and create the ambiance of a dystopian future.

 

Cinematographer - Sam Costa

 

“As a child, I was raised on classic sci-fi and action films: Star Wars, Back to the Future, The Matrix; and since then these films and, this genre as a whole, has a very special place in my heart. So, when I heard the pitch for Impermanence, I was instantly hooked and I knew this is the film I wanted to work on. Not only because of the thrilling science fiction world and narrative, but I’m also a sucker for deep emotional stories and layered characters, and Impermanence’s script has that in abundance. Having grown up around family and friends who were photographers and videographers, I have always had a passion and fascination for working behind the camera. And having already some experience as a cinematographer, I think my skills are at a good enough level for me to be able to experiment with a range of different ideas and techniques to make our audience feel engaged in our world. We can’t wait to show you guys what we’ve been working on!”

 

Music - Jordan​ Milopoulos

Studying music, I primarily specialise in Jazz, Rock and Fusion but have a love for Film and TV scoring. After many year of playing the guitar, I have found it necessary to learn a range of instruments to aid me in my creations e.g. Saxophone, Piano, Percussion and the Greek Bouzouki. I’m so excited to be working on this film!

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3pmEQ1ZFImf1m...

 

What We Need and What do you get? 

Our budget is quite small, as we have had to scale back the film due to the pandemic. However, as a team we have discussed about how we can make the most out of the money, which can be seen in the chart below: 

 

We want to make this film look and feel cinematic as much as possible, which is why we believe set design will play a key role in this. As you can see, Actors takes up a lot of our budget, this is because we would like to be able to pay the actors for their fantastic work. However, without you, this won't be possible.

If you believe in this production and want to help in the creation of the project, we have some really good perks that you can claim such as limited edition posters. 

 

The Impact

Impermanence is a powerful story about dealing with ones own grief but it also explores themes of corruption within society.  Most importantly though, it is an original feature that focuses on emotions and even though the film is fictionalised, the story itself is personal to us all. The importance of family is ever present within the film.

The focus around a female narrative voice has real importance. We feel that cinema focuses on male narratives and predominantly serves a male audience. This needs to change.  Supporting this film is where you can help make this change happen. 

We are really passionate filmmakers, who have long term ambitions to work within the industry but due to the pandemic, we have had limited chances to build our filmmaking portfolio. In supporting this campaign, you will not only help out third year students on their final project, but help build our show reel. This will enable us to apply the film to film festivals and gain recognition. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge we are still to face is the set design of the film.  Due to the pandemic, we haven't been able to physically go to the locations and work out what the scene will look like. However, through the programme Set.A.Light, we have created lighting and set design concepts of how they will look.  Here are a couple of examples. 

 

The pictures above are from an interrogation style scene. 

 

The pictures above are Ellen investigating audio files. 

Working of our aim of authenticity, we want to create a futuristic style to this film that needs a lot more care and attention to detail. 

Also, with limited resources and money, we were able to create an essence of what we want to create in our final film via our trailer. 

Joining our Campaign 

As a team, we are really excited about making this project and can't wait to share the experience with you. There are many ways to help bringing this film to life: 

  • Donate any money you can to reach our goal through the different perks.
  • Following us on social media, which you can find at the bottom of the page.
  • Sharing this page whether you can. Friends, Family, Work Colleagues whoever, we really appreciate it.
  • Contact us for any information about the project via social media platforms or email (you can find at the bottom of the page)

Welcome to the team! We look forward to sharing you all the content on socials, and can't tell you enough, how much we appreciate you being part of the project. 

If you are interested in being casted in the film please email the team at @impermanencefilm2021@gmail.com for the details. 

COVID

In line with the government guidelines, we plan to film between late March and early May. As discussed in our video, the safety of both cast and crew are our first priority. We understand that some people may be concerned about filming during a pandemic and spreading the disease. WE ASSURE YOU, we will be taking every step necessary to stop the virus. The script was written so that there would limited face to face contact between actors.  These are some of further steps that we will be taking whilst filming:  

  • Masks worn by crew at all times and actors when they are not in front of the camera.
  • Social distancing on set wherever possible.
  • Hand Sanitiser points will be positioned around the set. 
  • Crew will stick to their personal equipment. 
  • Sanitising wipes for shared equipment and props. 
  • For personal items, there will be set areas on set for items to placed.

If the worst scenario happens and have to film online due to the pandemic, we have a backup script that works online accordingly. 

And Finally...Thank You!

Thank you for checking out our Indiegogo page and your support. Without you, this project won't be able to happen. Anything you can contribute to the project and help us achieve our goal means the world to the team and we will be forever grateful.

If you can't, don't worry, you can stay up to date with the project on our social media sites:

https://www.instagram.com/impermanencefilm_2021...

https://www.facebook.com/Impermanencefilm

If you have any queries about the project, please don't hesitate to get in contact with the team on our social media campaigns or email us at: @impermanencefilm2021@gmail.com
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hello, there. We are the team behind the upcoming short film, Impermanence.  The feature takes place in the near future where everyone's conversations are recorded through a device called CORTEX. CORTEX is an implant that records every conversation the host has, enabling them to re-live their fondest memoires.  The story focuses on Ellen March, a surveillance officer who uses CORTEX to find those who took the most important thing from her. 
Our aim for the film is to create an emotionally layered narrative, that is both authentic and futuristic, where you follow Ellen on her journey to seek redemption and piece the puzzle together yourselves. 
The story came about through writer and sound designer Peter Elsmere, who has always felt that sound was the untold hero within cinema and hasn't gained enough recognition, compared to its visual counterpart.

story:
Summary

CALL IT LOVE is an intimate character study of a lonely young woman who believes a match she made on a dating app is the saving grace to her isolated lifestyle. The story soon takes the form of a psychological thriller as she gets stood up by the woman she matched with, and her intense hunger for love eradicates any sense of reason she may have had.

CALL IT LOVE is the debut film by Northbird Films, a creative filmmaking collective established with the mission of bringing dynamic voices to the screen. We would like to thank you for taking a look at our page and hope that you find our story compelling and choose to help us see it through! Donations of any size to our budget will be greatly appreciated.

The Story

The story follows Vaughn, a naive young woman who has been socially isolated throughout her adult life. Raised in a conservative southern community, Vaughn made the move to Los Angeles to live a life she felt she would have been denied back home. Unfortunately, her timing was off, and she moved just before the pandemic struck. Her isolation compounded by quarantine and not knowing another soul in LA, Vaughn’s only source of companionship is confined to the dating app on her phone.

Enter Parker — a self-assured woman and dating app veteran, who knows exactly what she wants and how to get it. After matching with Parker, Vaughn manifests a carefully elaborated fantasy in her mind about how the relationship will play out, skipping far ahead into a delusion before even meeting Parker in real life.

When Parker fails to show up for their date, Vaughn is sent into a tailspin where she confronts not only the depths of her obsession, but the object of her obsession, as well. The harsh truth behind their relationship is soon revealed, leaving Vaughn unable to comprehend the idea of a world where Parker ends up with anyone other than herself...

Who We Are

Northbird Films was formed in early 2021, in the midst of the pandemic, by a diverse group of aspiring filmmakers and artists determined to showcase their creative voice and perspective on the big screen. Although working without formal film school training, the team has made an effort to collaborate with one another to tell stories that are deeply personal and meaningful to them. 

Jack Creasy - Writer/Director

Jack Creasy is an LA-based filmmaker with professional development experience at an independent production company, and is currently working at a talent agency. He spends his time outside work pursuing independent filmmaking, crafting narratives where characters seek universal desires (success, influence, love, etc.) often through tenacious, ruthless, and obsessive means. He’s a longtime Hitchcock devotee, an avid fan of the paranoid thrillers of the 1970s, and is anxiously awaiting Bong Joon-Ho’s next directorial triumph. Jack began writing, directing, and producing short films while studying screenwriting at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.

Kyle Harvey - Producer

Kyle Harvey is a writer, producer and director from Boston now currently based in Venice, CA. He balances his time between independent filmmaking and his full time job advising global streaming clients on key marketing and development strategy.. Although he’s worked on content in every genre he prefers character-focused, gritty dramas with a dark twist that often explore human psychology. His favorite filmmakers include PT Anderson, Charlie Kaufman, Aaron Sorkin, Greta Gerwig, and Damien Chazelle. A graduate of Duke University, Kyle currently currently works on entertainment strategy at NRG.

Angela Wu - Producer

Angela Wu is a Chinese-American producer originally from Colorado and currently based in LA. Captivated by the thriller, sci-fi, and romance genres, Angela gravitates towards high-concept projects with subversive themes that use the medium of narrative storytelling to tackle topics of identity and citizenship in our world today. She is passionate about combining her background in public policy with her love of visual storytelling to create social impact and promote social justice. She believes that cinema can be a powerful tool to uplift underrepresented stories, shape our cultural zeitgeist, and inspire long-lasting change. A graduate of Georgetown University, Angela currently works at Dirty Films, Cate Blanchett’s production company.

Wyatt Grennan - Cinematographer

Wyatt Grennan is a freelance cinematographer based in Los Angeles. With a love for the horror genre, Wyatt enjoys exploring the ways in which lighting can influence the dramatic tension of a scene. Originally born and raised in North Carolina, Wyatt graduated from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill with a degree in Media Studies and Production. Along with his narrative projects, Wyatt has worked in documentary and reality television as well. His work will be screened at international festivals this coming year. When he isn’t on set, Wyatt can be found at Birns and Sawyer where he works as a Utility Tech.

Carmen Caruso - Associate Producer & Assistant Director

Carmen Caruso is an established freelance producer from South Florida with 6 years of professional experience and dozens of film credits under her belt. Bringing to the table production experience in features, television, shorts, and internet content, Carmen is focused on bringing fresh and intriguing stories to the screen. A graduate from the University of Miami, Carmen is currently working at a reputable talent agency in Los Angeles.

Dillan Boada - Northbird Films Head of Marketing

Dillan Boada, a LA-native and self-proclaimed entertainment junkie, graduated from the University of Southern California in 2019, majoring in Business Marketing with a Cinematic Arts minor. Taking her passion for film in combination with learned knowledge of marketing strategy and advertising tactics, she started her career in entertainment at Legendary Films during her undergrad. She later started her post-grad career working in marketing/advertising for Netflix and has contributed to campaigns for both feature films and series releases such as The Prom, Space Force, Ratched, Julie and the Phantoms, and The Boys in the Band, specializing in creative marketing and social strategy. 

The Impact

While this is a fictional story, it navigates universal experiences about loneliness and the desire to share an honest connection with other people, as well as the question of how legitimate online relationships really are. It is also told through a creative lens that is unique to the experiences shared by members of our production team who belong to the LGBTQ+ community.

Also for our debut short, we wanted to tell a story that is specific to our lives now as we're living through the pandemic. 

Where Your Money Is Going

As Northbird Films is composed of young aspiring filmmakers and filmmaking professionals, we are looking to self-fund all of our projects through our crowdfunding campaign. 

We're looking for funding to pay for the production costs in the following categories:

  • Camera/General Equipment
  • Locations
  • Cast and Crew
  • COVID Safety 

One of our biggest unexpected costs is ensuring that our production is safe during the pandemic, which means buying personal protective equipment for our team, supplying individual water bottles as well as individual pre-packaged snacks and meals, sanitizing sets as well as commonly used props, limiting crew members at our indoor locations and ensuring that everyone keeps up with our testing policies. We're committed to following all of the posted film guidelines and implementing our own practices to keep a safe set environment.

Other Ways You Can Help

Donations are the biggest help but simply sharing a link to this campaign will be greatly appreciated. Crowdfunding campaigns like this provide an opportunity for the young filmmakers behind this project to work toward finding their own place in the next generation of cinematic storytellers.

Please follow us on our social media! We are updating our Northbird Films social media pages with exciting updates so you can follow along with our production journey.

Instagram: @northbird_films  Twitter: @northbird_films

In Essence

CALL IT LOVE is a story about isolation, about loneliness, about unmet expectations, about wayward love, about obsession, about taboo, and about how the mind can delude itself in dangerous ways when left to its own devices. It’s a story that was conceived during the pandemic, in response to the pandemic, and will go on to be made during the pandemic. 

THANK YOU!

story:
PRODUCTS

Buy our toy drone  "DEATH STAR"

and if you prefer another favorite model within PERK


SHORT PRESENTATION

IF YOU DO NOT WANT TO READ ALL HISTORY, A SUMMARY HERE ARE IN ITALIAN AND ENGLISH

SE NON AVETE VOGLIA DI LEGGERE TUTTA LA STORIA,  QUI TROVATE  UN RIASSUNTO IN ITALIANO 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U4po7yfSNjs

http://youtu.be/_qJqb7JkqcU

     



STORY

WHO WE ARE

The campaign is lunched by Wic Venture Capital trust Fund Inc., an american new accelerator of business. With the technical help of Paolo and Emanuele.

Paolo:

Hello, I am Paolo Bianchi, an Italian aeronautical engineer , I have worked in AMERICA, DETROIT 2012-2014, and now I work with WIC VENTURE CAPITAL TRUST FUND INC, for lunching this CAMPAIGN. The campaign will be carried out only after defining an agreement with Walt's about copyright, that amount will be proportionate to the collection obtained and the margins on production costs. I think that if materials collection will be important as we requested, there will be all the numbers to meet the needs of fans.

You can see me,  in the photos, while working in production and sale of drones, also created by me. I worked for Detroit Aircarft, where I really hope to come back, and I work with still for sale the drone professional inquired of LOCKHEED MARTIN in europe.

Is a technician of information technology, and here he works on his PC in the software developement.

WIC Fund,  would like to develop this first project, which is very ambitious to go in the space, with a real spaceship with my CRODWFUNDER, and to do this I have to start from something small but fun, and I thought, since I am a FAN of Startwars to fly the sheet of  GALACTIC EMPIRE , integrating element for a high-tech for those who want the system more efficient ( WAL)

In order to clarify the procedures for collecting and investment business, we highlight and respond to your questions and doubts:

- Research and development does not affect the "drones toy", but a more ambitious project that will allow us to evolve the drones "starwars", from toy drones, drones to professional;

- Drones toy are built with existing technology and using 3D printer to produce the shell model starwars. Only we adapt the technology to the shape of ships. No need for specialized investments in research and development, and we can also provide only a few products, even if the campaign does not raise the total requested could.

So no problem and concern for the failure to supply the drone ordered present among the perks, in any case will be produced and delivered. We are already producing and printing the first units that will soon be on-line;

RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT

A) WAL SYSTEM: In about ambitious project of R & D for the construction of a communication system that can allow the drone to move, both in water and on land and in the air, piloted remotely, we note that there are already several research institutes who are facing trial, us with the funds raised could develop independent research, or co-finance the one already in progress. The decision to make our R&A, or in affiliation with a research center, will depend on the extent of the amount raised. If this sum, as we have requested will be consistent, we could be the ones to develop the prototype and patenting;

B) SPACE TURISM: With regard instead to space tourism, it is clearly a dream, however, based on the amounts collected could decide to unite our efforts in the activities of other companies that are investing in the sector and contribute to the implementation of the consocenza technology. Whether the sums will be particularly strong we could develop activities and prototypes directly also saving patent.

in a short time we would insert also the first official products.

story:
Summary 

 WIFE MISSING HAS NOT BEEN FILMED YET

What we have done so far: 
Since we are trying to raise the funds to make the full length feature film. We took some of the scenes from the full length script and created a teaser to use as a marketing tool. THE FILM HAS NOT BEEN MADE YET  

Human trafficking has become one of the largest money making business in the world and people seem to turn away from it, but everyone either has a child or knows someone with one and who knows they could be the next victim, yes boys as well as girls are kidnapped and enslaved as sex slaves. 

Wife Missing is guaranteed to keep you in suspense, while educating you about some very strong topics that need to be eradicated in the world.
Synopsis: 

After surviving a violently abusive husband, Brianna finally moves on along with her two children, she finalizes divorce proceedings, saves what is left of her home, and somehow repair their pieces of her shattered life. However, her vengeful soon-to-be-ex-husband isn't done with her. With his connections in organized crime, he arranges Brianna's abduction and subsequently sells her into the sex trade underworld. 

In a story that spans from the streets of New Jersey to the underbelly of the Chinese sex trade industry, Brianna is once again, a prisoner. With friends on both sides of the law looking for her, her two children desperately in need of her, and the plight of her fellow sex trade prisoners now in her conscience, Brianna must find the resolve to retain a fighting spirit. She must hold on to the idea that she can go home again.

"How you can help..." 

Please, please if everyone just donated $5.00 (just the cost of 1 coffee from Starbucks) to our cause we could make this psychological thriller come to life. 

Fat Bottom Productions is a group of individual heterogeneous independent film makers, residing in New Jersey and New York. We bring a diverse experience of feature films, including psychological thrillers,  "Lamb Killer," "The Cleaner", and others titles, listed on IMDB.com. 

So join us and our interesting cast, crew and help us along with this artistic project that will add awareness and value to the world we live in and help us educate our young girls and boys of today. We need to bring awareness of human trafficking, date rape drug and domestic violence which is rapidly spreading throughout our world.

Human trafficking has become one of the largest money making business in the world and people seem to turn away from it, but everyone either has a child or knows someone with one and who knows they could be the next victim, yes boys as well as girls are kidnapped and enslaved as sex slaves.


Some of the cast speak about the issues they have been made aware of since becoming involved with the film.

Help us tell a story that matters. We can't do it without your support!

Please pledge right now and then get 20 friends to pledge. WE CAN DO THIS TOGETHER!

Thank you so much for helping us make history and bring awareness to these gruesome crimes against humanity.

WEB Page: Wife Missing web page

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize not everyone is able to contribute money, but there are other ways you can get involved - By helping spread the word. Please use our share tools.

  • Support our Indiegogo Campaign! Tell us and the world that you have contributed to Wife Missing film by using the #WifeMissing. 
  • Take a photo of yourself holding up a sign, "#WifeMissing End human trafficking and domestic violence and post it on your social media site. Show your support and use social media to spread the message.
  • Spread the word! Sharing is caring--Email your friends! Post to Facebook! Tweet it! Blog it! Instagram it!
  • We are on social media! Give us a like/follow:

FACEBOOK   -   INSTAGRAM   -   TWITTER

Risks & Challenges

Film making is always a challenge and filming Wife Missing does carry risk factors. However, Fat Bottom Productions thrives on challenges, and adding up the experiences our team has acquired over many years, we know we're all up to the challenge of producing Wife Missing to make this story come to life!

We all would like to thank everyone in advance for supporting Wife Missing and we will cherish every dollar you donate. Thank you for helping shed light on these topics.
                                              
Please help us bring this movie to life. THANK YOU for your generous support. Please share this campaign with all your friends and ask them to do the same, because this could happen to just about anyone you know!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Tina Crouse and I’m the producer of the documentary SKIRTS! Canadian Women in Social Finance. Canada has a long history in social finance, a long cultural history but it’s over-shadowed by the US and the UK so no one knows it. And funny enough, while all over the world, people are being told how important it is to put women in leadership positions, here in Canada, we’ve been doing it for more than 30 years!

In this documentary, you will be introduced to 10 female ‘stars’ in the social finance field and I guarantee, you’re going to like them. Charming, charismatic, intelligent, committed and of course, visionaries. How could they not be? They got us all here.

In being part of this film project, I’m asking you to join a movement, the ‘I freakin’ love social finance’ movement. Why? Because this is how we change the world - we shift priorities, we teach people how to marry profit and social benefits and we do good work! 

What We Need & What You Get

For this campaign, we need $9,300. This is the 10% of the total budget needed to get the project going. It will take 5 of us: Producer; Director; Sound; Camera and Editor to get the story told and we’ll have to travel to 3 different locations; Ottawa, Toronto and Vancouver because Canada is that big. To tell the story of each of these amazing women, we’ll have site fees, insurance fees, legal costs (mandatory), equipment rental and facility charges. This is not a home video! Their stories and our’s deserve a top quality documentary and that is why we are reaching out to you to help make it happen.

Perks!  We have great perks, the kind you hope for ~ access to the information and social business expertise that these talented and inspiring women have. At the top level, you can select One-on-One Coaching with the top woman in your field or the one you most admire or the person who can take your company to the next level. Yes, they can. They did it for themselves; they did it for all of us.

Also, at the $10 supporter level, why not join the movement? Let’s publicize the good of social finance to everyone in Canada. Spend $10 and announce to the world. ‘I freakin’ love social finance’. Why not? Once you’re in it, you don’t ever want to go back to working only for the paycheque, to focusing solely on profit, to ignoring the additional benefits you could be giving to people except it’s not on the corporate agenda.

And of course, there will be the film! You’ll be able to get a digital copy through a secure password portal. Also, additional perks will include the full interviews of the women themselves; uncut or Director’s cut, you’ll hear and see what each woman accomplished, how long it took, what skills were needed, who helped (because she didn’t do it alone and each woman will tell you that).

The Impact

In the social finance field, we all talk impact. What impact will this have? How much impact will be experienced? With this film, our long history and in particular, these last 30 years, will show the world what Canada has been up to. We’ve been changing lives, changing laws and changing business. We have broad sector appeal if just more Canadians knew about us. It’s time for us to tell our story.

Risks & Challenges

As the producer, it’s my job to raise the money and coordinate the moving pieces. As I manage the film project, it frees the director to do her job which allows the camera and sound people to do their’s and finally, for the editor to polish it all so it’s worthy of release. If we don’t raise all of our funds through Indiegogo, we’ll keep going. The film is going to get made, perks will be honoured and one day, you’ll get to meet these 10 amazing women. For 20 years, I’ve been raising money and managing projects for non-profits and small businesses and for the past 5 years, I’ve been intimately involved with the inner workings of how we use social finance to enable the changemakers of Canada and the world to get things done. I even coach in this field. It’s your help we need because ‘collaboration’ is another thing we have to show the world and I think we’re pretty good at it.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Now, how can you help? Join the movement! $10 is not a lot to spend on advertising social finance. We also need to ‘leverage’ all of your networks. Everyone who knows you, knows how much you care about people and the planet. Tell them about us! We’re all in this together!

    And don’t forget, Indiegogo  supplies some great share tools! Please use them!

    Finally, Thanks, THANKS, Thx from the bottom of our hearts. It’s exciting to show what social finance has been, is and will be. Really looking forward to it!

    Tina Crouse, Producer

    SKIRTS! Canadian Women in Social Finance

introduced to 10 female ‘stars’ in the social finance field and I guarantee,
you’re going to like them. Charming, charismatic, intelligent, committed and of
course, visionaries. How could they not be? They got us all here.
In being part of this film
project, I’m asking you to join a movement, the ‘I freakin’ love social
finance’ movement. Why? Because this is how we change the world - we shift
priorities, we teach people how to marry profit and social benefits and we do
good work! 
   What We Need & What You Get 

For this campaign,
we need $9,300. This is the 10% of the total budget needed to get the project
going. It will take 5 of us: Producer; Director; Sound;
Camera and Editor to get the story told and we’ll have to travel to 3 different
locations; Ottawa, Toronto and Vancouver because Canada is that big. To tell
the story of each of these amazing women, we’ll have site fees, insurance fees,
legal costs (mandatory), equipment rental and facility charges. This is not a
home video! Their stories and our’s deserve a top quality documentary and that
is why we are reaching out to you to help make it happen.
Perks! 
We have great perks, the kind you hope for ~ access to the information
and social business expertise that these talented and inspiring women have. At the
top level, you can select One-on-One Coaching with the top woman in your field
or the one you most admire or the person who can take your company to the next
level. Yes, they can. They did it for themselves; they did it for all of us.
Also, at the $10 supporter level, why not
join the movement? Let’s publicize the good of social finance to everyone in
Canada. Spend $10 and announce to the world. ‘I freakin’ love social finance’.
Why not? Once you’re in it, you don’t ever want to go back to working only for
the paycheque, to focusing solely on profit, to ignoring the additional
benefits you could be giving to people except it’s not on the corporate agenda.
And of course, there will be the film!
You’ll be able to get a digital copy through a secure password portal. Also,
additional perks will include the full interviews of the women themselves;
uncut or Director’s cut, you’ll hear and see what each woman accomplished, how
long it took, what skills were needed, who helped (because she didn’t do it
alone and each woman will tell you that).

The Impact 

In the social finance field, we all talk impact. What impact will this
have? How much impact will be experienced? With this film, our long history and in
particular, these last 30 years, will show the world what Canada has been up
to. We’ve been changing lives, changing laws and changing business. We have broad
sector appeal if just more Canadians knew about us. It’s time for us to tell
our story. 
Risks & Challenges
 As the producer, it’s my job to raise the money and coordinate the moving pieces. As I manage the film project, it frees the director to do her job which allows the camera and sound people to do their’s and finally, for the editor to polish it all so it’s worthy of release. If we don’t raise all of our funds through Indiegogo, we’ll keep going. The film is going to get made, perks will be honoured and one day, you’ll get to meet these 10 amazing women. For 20 years, I’ve been raising money and managing projects for non-profits and small businesses and for the past 5 years, I’ve been intimately involved with the inner workings of how we use social finance to enable the changemakers of Canada and the world to get things done. I even coach in this field. It’s your help we need because ‘collaboration’ is another thing we have to show the world and I think we’re pretty good at it.

  Other Ways You Can Help 

Now, how can you help? Join the movement! $10 is not a lot to spend on
advertising social finance. We also need to ‘leverage’ all of your networks.
Everyone who knows you, knows how much you care about people and the planet.
Tell them about us! We’re all in this together!
And don’t forget,
Indiegogo  supplies some great share
tools! Please use them!
Finally, Thanks, THANKS, Thx from the
bottom of our hearts. It’s exciting to show what social finance has been, is
and will be. Really looking forward to it!
Tina Crouse, Producer
SKIRTS! Canadian Women in Social
Finance

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Augustus Carter. I'm primarily a songwriter and producer, but this is my first feature film project. I have a degree in Communications and Consumer Psychology and Masters education in Public Administration and experience in Nonprofit Organization. I have formed an organization called, Worldwide Nation which will use entertainment and other forms of cultural development as a means of raising funds for charity missions. Your contribution not only helps me complete the production of a film project; but after production costs are covered, the remainder and proceeds will be used to perform awesome acts of kindness and love to people in need... "Passion fuels the mission!" is our motto.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $125,000 to complete this film.
  • The funds will be used for some of the actor's pay and accommodations, additional wardrobe and props, insurance, entry to film festivals, and promotional events.
  • In return for your gift, you receive credit for being a contributing producer and a listing on our social media and websites, along with great incentives at various levels.
  • In the event our goal of $125,000 is not met, the amount received will be used as collateral to acquire a loan that will meet our short-term needs.

The Impact

  • Your contribution does more than help us produce a film. The proceeds will be used to fund our nonprofit charity efforts. We have definite plans to fund the building of new houses for people in parts of Asia, organize efforts to make sure certain neighborhoods are save in places like Puerto Rico, build irrigation systems in Ghana, as well as helping families in need here in the United States.
  • I have had success in administering food drives and family care on a local level. But, my goal is to reach greater numbers of people and make an even greater impact.
  • This project feeds two of my passions; I love being creative and expressive, and  I enjoy being able to help other people. Everyone involved gets the gratification of completing a heartwarming film and the satisfaction of knowing that our hard work and dedication also helps to make the lives of other people better. But, here's a harsh but true reality: If we simply went out to ask for money to help people in need, the response just wouldn't be as great as what we know will happen when we offer incentives and the value of entertainment. So, we hope that you will honor our honest effort to meet our goals through this funding opportunity.

Risks & Challenges

There are risks involved in making any type of investment. But particularly when it comes to film projects, the major concern is ROI (return on investment). The truth is most films don't have immediate gains in revenue. Although there are proven strategies that work and in the long run make successful projects.

  • My background and education in Consumer Psychology has given me great insight towards the proper way to market a film and to capitalize the gains opposed to taking loses.
  • The key to success in marketing a film is knowing the audience. Researchers prove that the most successful genre in film is Drama which includes Romance as a subset. Comedy is also a popular category but relies heavily on sales after release such as DVD and digital marketing (Netflix, Samsung, Amazon, etc.). Life Is But a Dream, being a Romantic Comedy, fits into the best of both worlds. And, our immediate plans after production are to take this project on tour to film festivals, gain exposure to potential theatrical distributors, hold a series of private showings, then take advantage of digital marketing opportunities as a second wave of revenue.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't afford to make a contribution, please share this opportunity!

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. You may use our link to post to your friends. It's most effective to share with people you actually know. Tell them all about our movie and goals to help people who are in need. Drop a message to their inbox or email. Here's our link to copy and paste: https://www.facebook.com/LIBADthemovie
  • Also feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Desperate to escape a lifetime of sexual abuse, a prostitute named Anna sets out on a mission to reinvent herself.  She returns home to face off against her family, her ex pimp, and her own mental illness. The move back into her childhood bedroom proves challenging as Anna struggles to acclimatize to the normalcy of family life. Anna needs to empower herself to overcome her homicidal tendencies, while navigating between reality and her fantasies of revenge.


While our film is a work of fiction, sadly Anna's story is entirely too true for many young girls in North America and around the world. In the US and Canada, the average age that a girl is forced into prostitution is 13-14 years old and escape is very difficult. The after-effects and trauma that trafficked victims face often require a long period of recovery and support through emotional and spiritual healing is just as important as physical recovery.  "Drowning" explores the repercussions on the physical and emotional well-being of a prostituted women as she tries to break from the men who have coerced, manipulated, bought and sold her.

The reality is making movies is expensive. Prohibitively expensive. Especially in Canada where, if you're just starting out, you don’t have ready access to the many private and public grants the various funding agencies provide. And frankly, unless you have Great Uncle Edmund financing your dreams of becoming a filmmaker, taking that first (or fifth) step towards becoming the next superstar Canadian filmmaker (where you might actually qualify for a piece of Telefilm or CMF funding) is mostly an exercise in personal bankruptcy. We do it because we love it! But we’d rather not go bankrupt…

When making an indie film, strangely it seems the bulk of the budget goes towards necessities you don’t see on the screen in an obvious way – accountants, lawyers, craft service – all very important things you can’t make a film without. The first $5000 - $10000 we raise in this campaign will be earmarked for those decidedly un-glamorous things. So, we truly hope we can exceed far beyond that first hurdle so that we might afford more of what we will be able to enjoy on screen. Admittedly, we set our crowdfunding goal very, very conservatively. $25000 really isn't enough to make this movie, but it's a good start. Hopefully with your help we'll be able to muster much, much more towards our stretch goals! But whatever amount we raise shows those private and public funding agencies that this film already has a whole bunch of people who believe in it and want to see it made. If you believe in us, they just might too!

Every dollar counts! We are so very grateful, as your contribution and/or shout out on social media means that we are able to pursue the dream of shooting our first feature film. Along with our own personal investment in this film, the support from you, our friends, family, colleagues, complete strangers, is making it possible for this story to be told. You are appreciated beyond measure! Thank-you! Thank-you! Thank-you!

We have pulled many favours already, such as getting some free locations and hitting friends up for their expertise, but at the end of the day, the costs of paying for equipment, actors and post production really add up. 

ACTRA CAST (Because professional performers give professional performances!):  $24,000

PRODUCTION CREW (Marco and Valerie are wearing many hats, but we're hoping to raise enough to fund positions like DOP, Sound Recordist, Grip, Gaffer, Camera Assistant): $30,000

EQUIPMENT AND SET OPERATIONS (18 days of camera and lights!): $25,000

OTHER PRODUCTION EXPENSES (insurance, legal, permits, food, etc.): $10000

POST (editing, colouring, sound, deliverables): $55,000

INDIEGOGO'S FEE (4% of what we raise): $5840

CREDIT CARD FEES (3% of what we raise): $4380

TOTAL = $156,220


If we don’t reach our full funding goal, we will still make this film because we believe strongly in telling this story, BUT it will mean we’ll have to make some serious changes to the script, cuts to the shooting schedule and post production and probably means Valerie holds the boom mic while Marco works his magic with the camera at the same time as directing our actors to their best performances. Totally possible!... But not ideal! We want to make the best version of this film - We need your help to make that happen!

What would a crowdfunding campaign be without perks? Please have a look to the right and see if there’s anything there that strikes your fancy. We hope that with whatever perk you choose, it allows you to feel like the very big part of this film that you certainly are. We can’t do it without you!

PASQUALE MARCO VELTRI – Writer/Director

Pasquale Marco Veltri is a Canadian filmmaker and photographer whose unique vision crosses the boundaries of culture and language. He is a worldly soul and visual storyteller whose focus on character development is strongly represented in the intelligence and complexity of his works. Faced with the tasks of producing, directing, cinematography, and writing, Veltri has developed an integrated and holistic approach to the art of cinema.

Veltri’s films have screened nationally and internationally in Canada, USA, Britain, France, Italy, and Egypt. Measuring Tape Girl has screened at the Cannes Film Festival and the Montreal World Film Festival. Words to Remember won the Chris Award for Narrative at the Columbus International Film and Video Festival.

VALERIE LAURIE – Producer

Valerie Laurie has been working in film and television for 15 years in both Production and Post during which time she has cultivated relationships with a broad spectrum of top behind-the-camera talent. She has spent 8 years putting crews together for large-scale productions at the CBC. Prior to that she coordinated Post on productions for CBS, ABC, Lionsgate, CBC, A&E, ESPN, Discovery and many more. After so many years of helping others perfect their own creations, she’s decided to re-team with her film school pal, Marco to get her own creative on. Valerie is tapping those long-held relationships and calling-in no small number of favours in order to get this film produced no matter what it takes!

story:
Short Summary

Being an LGBQ and/or Transgender South Asian/Desi can sometimes make it hard to share stories and experiences with and about family. Moving Truth(s): Queer and Transgender Desi Writings on Family aims to broaden conversations about family within social justice movements, and to be an honest and kind allyship resource for our families and each other. 

This project is being supported by the South Asian Americans Leading Together (SAALT) Youth Leadership Institute and will be supported entirely through donations.The lead organizers can be contacted at movingtruths [at] gmail dot com. The project will be published by Flying Chickadee. 

What We Need

Cost breakdown:

  • $ 4,000 - Paying publishers
  • $    780 - Divided up to give honorariums to our 13 contributors 
  • $    220 - Buying a copy of the book for each contributor

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

$    220 - Buying a copy of the book for each contributor



    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
En français …    |    In english …

 

De verdad te digo...

Cuando empecé con este sueño de hacer cine siempre pensé que sería guionista toda mi vida, pero el camino ha sido largo, con altos y bajos, y luego de varios años he aceptado el reto de dirigir esta película para que resulte tal y como la he imaginado.

Esta campaña es importante porque está respaldada por una producción internacional. Si bien es mi ópera prima como directora, no es un proyecto dejado al azar y marcará un precedente de colaboración entre Guatemala, Perú y México con un equipo apasionado.

Sobre la historia

Sinopsis

En una noche de luna, en una playa de pescadores, Toro descubre que su Esposa lo engaña con un hombre más joven. En ese instante Toro tiene que elegir entre la venganza o la resignación, o quizás ninguna de esas dos opciones.

Proceso de creación

El Toro y la luna es un cortometraje de ficción de 12 minutos que combina el estilo realista con momentos oníricos. La idea surgió hace cuatro años con la imagen de una pintura sin firma en un bar de tapas que trajo consigo una vorágine de ideas y de preguntas que crecieron hasta convertirse en una historia y, sobre todo, en una manera especial de aproximarse a la historia.

Necesitamos...

Tenemos casi todo listo para esta nueva aventura: el guión, el storyboard, el equipo técnico, creativo y artístico, su dedicación y voluntad, todas las capacidades necesarias para hacer esta película, pero falta algo: el presupuesto.

Necesitamos por lo menos 10,500$ para que este proyecto se ponga en marcha. Tu ayuda nos permitirá cubrir el costo del alquiler de los equipos, cámara, luces, sonido,  locaciones, vestuario, los días de trabajo, los permisos y seguros, la comida para todos, el hospedaje y transporte dentro de Guatemala, etc. Todo lo necesario para la producción.

Por eso hemos hecho este crowdfunding, porque sabemos que el cine es un oficio laborioso y exigente y que es muy difícil vivir de amor y agua fresca.

Si no logramos la meta total seguiremos adelante con el proyecto pero tendremos que tratar de financiarlo durante todo el año o más, pues nuestro objetivo es hacer un cortometraje excelente.

¿Por qué Guatemala?

Es la primera pregunta que hacen muchos.

Este es un proyecto complejo y completo, aquí trabajamos profesionales de distintos orígenes con un interés común, gente de cine que se conoce y que se tiene confianza absoluta, un ingrediente importantísimo porque en el cine es fundamental trabajar con un equipo en el que se pueda confiar ciegamente. El punto de encuentro es en Guatemala donde está la mayoría de ellos.

Las locaciones tienen particularidades que han alimentado nuestra creatividad, las playas de Guatemala tienen arena negra por su origen volcánico, las aguas son tranquilas y las edificaciones resaltan en la imagen. Cada elemento agregará textura y contraste.

El equipo está conformado por profesionales con experiencia, muchos de ellos han trabajado en producciones que se han exhibido en grandes festivales.

Algunos miembros del equipo


Marcela Cossíos, peruana. Soy la guionista y directora de este cortometraje. Estudié guión de cine en Montreal y una maestría de guión de cine y TV en Madrid. He escrito varios cortometrajes (Tic tac; La duda efímera, Montreal 2009; Las flores del mal, Lima 2012, que ganó el Concurso Nacional de Cortometrajes del Ministerio de Cultura del Perú y el premio a mejor Opera Prima en Filmocorto, Festival de Cine de Lima en el 2013); colaborado en la escritura de un largometraje documental (Cristobal Halffter: Libertad Imaginada, Madrid 2014) y coordinado y editado los guiones de una serie de televisión (Somos family, Lima 2015).

Actualmente preparo otra serie de televisión, enseño guión en una escuela de cine, trabajo en un proyecto de largometraje para un director canadiense y me lanzo a dirigir mi primer cortometraje: El Toro y la luna.

Mi mano derecha en este proyecto, a quien conocí en Madrid y me propuso lanzarme en esta aventura, es:


Fernando Cum, guatemalteco. Cine-fotógrafo. Es el director de fotografía de este corto.  Estudió cine en Guatemala, México y España. Tiene mucha experiencia en cortometrajes y proyectos visuales y mucha sensibilidad con las imágenes. Actualmente prepara su primer largometraje como fotógrafo, Girkiq, comienza la aventura, la primera película de títeres de Centroamérica, una película financiada con una campaña de crowdfounding.

Fernando quiere mostrar al mundo que en Guatemala se puede producir buen cine y lo haremos juntos, esta será una co-producción entre Guatemala,  México y Perú.

Reel de Fernando Cum


Joanna Prado, más conocida como Jou. Mexicana. Es directora de arte, Escenógrafa y Artista Plástica, tiene un master en escenografía para cine, teatro y TV,  ha trabajado en distintas producciones en España, México y Guatemala. Es la directora de arte de este cortometraje. Jou ha trabajado muchas veces al lado de Fernando y eso es un punto a favor porque conocen muy bien su forma de trabajar. Actualmente prepara su segundo largometraje como directora de arte, Girqik, comienza la aventura. Es también muy versátil y hábil para crear cosas donde no parece haber nada.

Reel de jou


Andrés Rodríguez, guatemalteco. Realizador audiovisual. Es el asistente de dirección de este proyecto. Tiene mucha experiencia en cine y TV como director, asistente de dirección, productor, casting, etc.

Como director, ha realizado varios cortometrajes que han participado en festivales internacionales  (Lorena, 2014; Armadillo-Helvetas, 2013; Ulew, 2013; Para los 30, 2012 , etc.)  Andrés también ha participado en diferentes largometrajes como asistente de dirección, director de casting, productor de campo, y muchos de ellos se han exhibido en festivales internacionales ( 1991, 2014; La casa más grande del mundo, 2014; La Jaula de oro, 2013).


Lucho Cáceres, Actor peruano. Es el protagonista de esta historia. Ha trabajado en muchísimos largometrajes exitosos (Cielo oscuro 2012; El evangelio de la carne, 2013; El elefante desaparecido, 2014, etc. ), decenas de obras de teatro y muchas series de televisión. Lucho aceptó inmediatamente ser el protagonista de esta historia a pesar de su poco tiempo libre, y tenemos una suerte única, Lucho tiene un registro impresionante para caracterizar personajes.

Cómo colaborar con nosotros... 

Todo está casi listo para esta película, esperamos que te haya gustado lo que has descubierto hasta el momento y que puedas ser parte del proyecto.

Puedes también difundir nuestra campaña en las redes sociales o entre amigos amantes del cine y de los retos.  Ayúdanos a hacer esta campaña viral y a que todos puedan conocerla.

¡Muchas gracias!

El equipo de EL TORO Y LA LUNA


 Français ...

Ce n'est pas une histoire d'amour, mais une histoire sur l'amour, sur la douleur de la trahison et sur la liberté.


Je te dis franchement ...

Lorsque j'ai commencé à rêver à faire du cinéma, je pensais que je serais scénariste toute ma vie. Mais le chemin fût long - avec des hauts et des bas - et après quelques années, j'ai accepté le défi de réaliser ce film pour qu'il soit tel que je l'avais imaginé.

Cette campagne est importante parce qu'elle soutient une production internationale. Même si c'est ma première œuvre en tant que réalisatrice, ce n'est pas un projet laissé au hasard et il marquera un précédent dans la collaboration entre le Guatemala, le Pérou et le Mexique avec une équipe passionnée.

Au sujet de l'histoire

Synopsis

Dans un village de pêcheurs, une nuit de pleine lune, Toro découvre que sa femme le trompe avec un homme plus jeune. Il doit alors choisir entre la vengeance ou la résignation, ou peut-être aucune de ces deux options. Ce n'est pas une histoire d'amour, mais une histoire sur l'amour, sur la douleur de la trahison et sur la liberté.

Processus de création

Le Toro et la lune est un court métrage de fiction de 12 minutes qui associe un style réaliste avec des moments oniriques. L'idée est née il y a quatre ans avec l'image d'une peinture sans signature dans un bar de tapas. Cette image a entraîné un tourbillon d'idées et de questions qui ont mûri pour se transformer en une histoire et, par-dessus tout, en une façon spéciale d'approcher l'histoire.

Ce dont nous avons besoin

Presque tout est prêt pour cette nouvelle aventure: le scénario, le storyboard, l'équipe technique, créative et artistique, son dévouement et sa détermination, bref, toutes les compétences nécessaires pour faire ce film. La seule chose qui manque, c'est l'argent.

Nous devons couvrir les coûts de location du matériel technique (caméra, lumière, son), du logement, du transport et de la nourriture pour toute l'équipe à la plage où nous allons tourner, les lieux de tournage, les costumes, la rémunération des jours de travail, les permis et les assurances, etc. C'est pour cela que nous lançons ce financement participatif. Nous savons que le cinéma est un travail laborieux et exigeant et qu'il est bien difficile de vivre d'amour et d'eau fraîche…

Pourquoi au Guatemala?

C'est la question que beaucoup de gens se posent.

C'est un projet complexe et complet, sur lequel travaillent des professionnels d'origine diverses avec un intérêt commun. Ce sont des gens du cinéma qui se connaissent et qui ont une confiance absolue entre eux, un élément très important dans le milieu du cinéma. Le point de rencontre est au Guatemala puisque la majorité de ces gens y résident.

De plus, la particularité du lieu a alimenté notre créativité: la plage du Guatemala a un sable noir à cause de son origine volcanique. L'eau est tranquille, le décor se découpe dans l'image et chaque élément y gagne en texture et contraste.

L'équipe est formée de professionnels qui ont de l'expérience, dont la plupart ont travaillé sur des productions qui ont été montrées dans de grands festivals.

Quelques membres de l'équipe


Marcela Cossíos, péruvienne. Je suis la scénariste et réalisatrice de ce court métrage. J'ai étudié l'écriture de scénario à Montréal et à Madrid. J'ai écrit plusieurs courts métrages (Tic Tac, 2009. Le doute éphémère, 2009. Las flores del mal, 2012 - qui a gagné le concours national de courts métrages du ministère de la culture du Pérou et le prix du meilleur premier film au festival du cinéma de Lima Filmcorto.

Récemment, j'ai collaboré à l'écriture d'un long métrage documentaire (Cristobal Halffter: Libertad Imaginada, Madrid 2014) et j'ai fait la coordination et la réécriture des scénarios de la série télé Somos family très appréciée des téléspectateurs de la chaîne Latina début 2015 au Pérou.

Je prépare actuellement une autre série télé, j'enseigne l'écriture de scénario, je travaille sur un projet de long métrage et je me lance dans la réalisation de mon premier court métrage.

Ma main droite sur ce projet, que j'ai connu à Madrid et qui m'a encouragé à me lancer dans cette aventure, est:


Fernando Cum, guatémaltèque. Directeur photo. C'est le directeur photo de ce court métrage. Il fait ses études de cinéma au Guatemala, au Mexique et en Espagne. Il a beaucoup d'expérience et de sensibilité avec les images. Il prépare actuellement son premier long métrage comme directeur de la photographie, Girkiq, comienza la aventura, le premier film de marionnettes d'Amérique centrale, un projet financé grâce à une campagne de crowdfunding.

Fernando souhaite démontrer que l'on peut faire du cinéma de qualité au Guatemala et nous le ferons ensemble. Ce sera une coproduction entre le Guatemala, le Mexique et le Pérou.


Joanna Prado, plus connue sous le nom de Jou. Mexicaine. Directrice artistique, scénographe et artiste plastique. Elle a travaillé sur plusieurs productions en Espagne, au Mexique et au Guatemala. Elle travaille régulièrement avec Fernando, un bon point puisqu'ils connaissent bien leur façon de travailler. Elle prépare actuellement son deuxième long métrage comme directrice, Girqik, comienza la aventura. Polyvalente, elle est très adroite pour créer des choses à partir de rien.


Andrés Rodríguez, guatémaltèque. Réalisateur audiovisuel. C'est l'assistant réalisateur de ce court métrage. Il a beaucoup d'expérience en cinéma et télévision dans les domaines de la réalisation, de l'assistanat de réalisation, de la production, du casting, etc.

Comme réalisateur, il a réalisé divers courts métrages qui ont été sélectionnés dans des festivals internationaux (Lorena, 2014. Armadillo-Helvetas (2013). Ulew (2013). Para los 30 (2012), etc.) Andrés a également participé à divers longs métrages comme assistant de direction, directeur de casting, direction de production. Plusieurs d'entre eux ont été montrés dans des festivals internationaux réputés: 1991 (2014); La casa más grande del mundo (2014); La Jaula de oro (2013).


Lucho Cáceres, acteur péruvien. C'est lui qui interprète le rôle principal de ce court métrage. Il a travaillé sur beaucoup de longs métrages à succès (Cielo oscuro 2012. El evangelio de la carne 2013. El elefante desaparecido 2014, etc.) et à des dizaines de pièces de théâtre et de séries de télévision. Lucho a un registre de jeu impressionnant pour caractériser ses personnages: intense, expressif ou modéré, c'est un acteur polyvalent.

Comment nous aider... 

Tout est presque prêt pour faire ce film. Nous espérons que tu as aimé ce que tu as découvert ici et que tu pourras faire partie de ce projet.

Tu peux aussi parler de notre financement sur les réseaux sociaux ou à tes amis fans de cinéma et des défis.  Aide-nous à rendre cette campagne de financement virale pour que beaucoup de monde puisse la connaître.

Merci beaucoup!

L'équipe de LE TORO ET LA LUNE

 English ...


I want really tell you... 

When I started with the dream of making movies I always thought it would be writer all my life, but the road has been long, high and low, and after several years I have accepted the challenge of directing this film to make it as we have imagined it.

This campaign is important because it is supported by a international production. Although it is my first film as a director, it is not a project left to chance, and it will set a precedent of collaboration between Guatemala, Peru and Mexico with a passionate team.


About the story

Synopsis

One moonlit night in a fishing village, TORO (50), an old fisherman, finds out that his WIFE(30) is having an affair with a younger fisherman. Toro now has to choose between revenge or resignation. Or maybe he doesn't choose any of those two options. It is not a love story but it is about love, about the pain that comes with treason, and also about freedom.

Creation process

The Toro and the moon  is a 12 minutes short film fiction that combines a realistic style with dreamlike instants. The idea arose four years ago with the image of a picture and has growing into a story and above all, in a special way to approach the history.


We need...

We have almost everything ready for this new adventure: the script, storyboard, technical, creative and artistic team, dedication and determination, all necessary skills to make this movie, but something is missing: the budget.

We need at least $ 10.500 for this project starts up. Your support will enable us to cover the cost of hiring equipment, camera, lights, sound, locations, costumes, days of work permits and insurance, food for everyone, lodging and transportation within Guatemala, etc. Everything needed for production.

So we made this crowdfunding, because we know that cinema is a laborious and demanding job and it is very difficult to live only of love and fresh water.
If we fail the total goal, we will go forward with the project but we will have try to fund it all year or more, because our goal is to make an excellent film.

Why Guatemala?

It is the first question I get asked by many.

This is a complex and complete project. Here, we work professionals from different origins with a common interest, cinema people who know each other and have absolute trust on the teem, an important ingredient because cinema is essential to work with a team where he can trust blindly. The meeting point is in Guatemala where most of them are.
The team is made by professionals with experience, many of whom have worked in productions exhibited at important festivals.

ABOUT SOME TEAM MEMBERS


Marcela Cossíos. from Peru. I'm the writer and director of this film. I have written several short films: Tic tac, Montreal 2009; The Flowers of Evil, Lima 2012; collaborated in the writing of a beautiful feature documentary (Cristobal Halffter: Libertad imaginada, Madrid 2014) and coordinated the scripts for a TV series (Somos family, 2015).

Currently I am working on another tv serie, I teach script in a film school, I work on a long film project for a Canadian film director and also in this, my first short film: The Toro and the moon.


Fernando Cum. from Guatemala. He is the cinematographer of this short. He studied film in Guatemala, Mexico and Spain. He has much experience in short films and visual projects and great sensitivity with images.

He is currently working on his first feature film as a photographer, Girkiq, the adventure begins, the first film puppet Central, a film financed campaign crowdfounding.

Fernando wants to show the world that Guatemala can produce good movies and we will do together, this will be a co-production between Guatemala, Mexico and Peru.


Joanna Prado, better known as Jou. From Mexico. She's art director, set designer and plastic artist, she has a master's degree in set design for film, theater and TV, she has worked on several productions in Spain, Mexico and Guatemala. She is the art director of this film. Jou has often worked alongside Fernando and that's a plus because they know they way of working. She is currently working on her second feature film as an art director, Girqik, the adventure begins. It is also very versatile and able to create things where there seems to be nothing.

Andrés Rodríguez. Guatemala. Audiovisual director. He is the assistant director of this project. He has extensive experience as a director in film and TV, assistant director, producer, casting, etc.

As a director, he has made several short films that have participated in international festivals (Lorena, 2014; Armadillo-Helvetas, 2013; Ulew, 2013; Para los 30, 2012, etc.) Andrew has also participated in several feature films as an assistant director, casting director, field producer, and many of them have been shown at international festivals ( 1991, 2014; La casa más grande del mundo, 2014; La Jaula de oro, 2013).


Lucho Cáceres. He is the protagonist of this story. He is a Peruvian actor who has worked in many successful films (Cielo oscuro 2012; El evangelio de la carne, 2013; El elefante desaparecido, 2014, etc. ), hundreds of theater plays and many television series. Lucho agreed to be the protagonist of this story despite his limited free time, and we're lucky, he has an impressive register to build characters.

The most important thing is that Lucho is a versatile actor, with an impressive register to characterize , and one of the few that I have full confidence. It is also a great friend and a transparent man.

Other ways you can help... 

Everything is almost ready for this movie. We hope you liked what you've discovered here and you can be part of the project.

But you can also spread the word about our campaign on social networks or between film and challenges lovers. Help us make this campaign something viral. Thank you very much!

EL TORO Y LA LUNA team
