 Français ...Ce n'est pas une histoire d'amour, mais une histoire sur l'amour, sur la douleur de la trahison et sur la liberté.

Je te dis franchement ...
 Lorsque j'ai commencé à rêver à faire du cinéma, je pensais que je serais scénariste toute ma vie. Mais le chemin fût long - avec des hauts et des bas - et après quelques années, j'ai accepté le défi de réaliser ce film pour qu'il soit tel que je l'avais imaginé.
Cette campagne est importante parce qu'elle soutient une production internationale. Même si c'est ma première œuvre en tant que réalisatrice, ce n'est pas un projet laissé au hasard et il marquera un précédent dans la collaboration entre le Guatemala, le Pérou et le Mexique avec une équipe passionnée.


 
Au sujet de l'histoire

Synopsis
Dans un village de pêcheurs, une nuit de pleine lune, Toro découvre que sa femme le trompe avec un homme plus jeune. Il doit alors choisir entre la vengeance ou la résignation, ou peut-être aucune de ces deux options. Ce n'est pas une histoire d'amour, mais une histoire sur l'amour, sur la douleur de la trahison et sur la liberté.


Processus de création
Le Toro et la lune est un court métrage de fiction
de 12 minutes qui associe un style réaliste avec des moments oniriques. L'idée
est née il y a quatre ans avec l'image d'une peinture sans signature
dans un bar de tapas. Cette image a entraîné un tourbillon d'idées et de
questions qui ont mûri pour se transformer en une histoire et, par-dessus tout,
en une façon spéciale d'approcher l'histoire.
Ce dont nous avons besoin
Presque tout est prêt pour cette nouvelle aventure: le scénario, le storyboard, l'équipe technique, créative et artistique, son dévouement et sa détermination, bref, toutes les compétences nécessaires pour faire ce film. La seule chose qui manque, c'est l'argent.
Nous devons couvrir les coûts de location du matériel technique (caméra, lumière, son), du logement, du transport et de la nourriture pour toute l'équipe à la plage où nous allons tourner, les lieux de tournage, les costumes, la rémunération des jours de travail, les permis et les assurances, etc. C'est pour cela que nous lançons ce financement participatif. Nous savons que le cinéma est un travail laborieux et exigeant et qu'il est bien difficile de vivre d'amour et d'eau fraîche…



Pourquoi au Guatemala?
C'est la question que beaucoup de gens se posent.
C'est un projet complexe et complet, sur lequel travaillent des 
professionnels d'origine diverses avec un intérêt commun. Ce sont des 
gens du cinéma qui se connaissent et qui ont une confiance absolue entre
 eux, un élément très important dans le milieu du cinéma. Le point de 
rencontre est au Guatemala puisque la majorité de ces gens y résident.
De
 plus, la particularité du lieu a alimenté notre créativité: la plage du
 Guatemala a un sable noir à cause de son origine volcanique. L'eau est 
tranquille, le décor se découpe dans l'image et chaque élément y gagne 
en texture et contraste.
L'équipe est formée de professionnels qui ont de l'expérience, dont la plupart ont travaillé sur des productions qui ont été montrées dans de grands festivals.
Quelques membres de l'équipe



Marcela Cossíos, péruvienne. Je suis la scénariste et réalisatrice de ce court métrage. J'ai étudié l'écriture de scénario à Montréal et à Madrid. J'ai écrit plusieurs courts métrages (Tic Tac, 2009. Le doute éphémère, 2009. Las flores del mal, 2012 - qui a gagné le concours national de courts métrages du ministère de la culture du Pérou et le prix du meilleur premier film au festival du cinéma de Lima Filmcorto. 
Récemment, j'ai collaboré à l'écriture d'un long métrage documentaire (Cristobal Halffter: Libertad Imaginada, Madrid 2014) et j'ai fait la coordination et la réécriture des scénarios de la série télé Somos family très appréciée des téléspectateurs de la chaîne Latina début 2015 au Pérou.
Je prépare actuellement une autre série télé, j'enseigne l'écriture de scénario, je travaille sur un projet de long métrage et je me lance dans la réalisation de mon premier court métrage.
Ma main droite sur ce projet, que j'ai connu à Madrid et qui m'a encouragé à me lancer dans cette aventure, est:



Fernando Cum, guatémaltèque. Directeur photo. C'est le directeur photo de ce court métrage. Il fait ses études de cinéma au Guatemala, au Mexique et en Espagne. Il a beaucoup d'expérience et de sensibilité avec les images. Il prépare actuellement son premier long métrage comme directeur de la photographie, Girkiq, comienza la aventura, le premier film de marionnettes d'Amérique centrale, un projet financé grâce à une campagne de crowdfunding.
Fernando souhaite démontrer que l'on peut faire du cinéma de qualité au Guatemala et nous le ferons ensemble. Ce sera une coproduction entre le Guatemala, le Mexique et le Pérou.



Joanna Prado, plus connue sous le nom de Jou. Mexicaine. Directrice artistique, scénographe et artiste plastique. Elle a travaillé sur plusieurs productions en Espagne, au Mexique et au Guatemala. Elle travaille régulièrement avec Fernando, un bon point puisqu'ils connaissent bien leur façon de travailler. Elle prépare actuellement son deuxième long métrage comme directrice, Girqik, comienza la aventura. Polyvalente, elle est très adroite pour créer des choses à partir de rien.



Andrés Rodríguez, guatémaltèque. Réalisateur audiovisuel. C'est l'assistant réalisateur de ce court métrage. Il a beaucoup d'expérience en cinéma et télévision dans les domaines de la réalisation, de l'assistanat de réalisation, de la production, du casting, etc.
Comme réalisateur, il a réalisé divers courts métrages qui ont été sélectionnés dans des festivals internationaux (Lorena, 2014. Armadillo-Helvetas (2013). Ulew (2013). Para los 30 (2012), etc.) Andrés a également participé à divers longs métrages comme assistant de direction, directeur de casting, direction de production. Plusieurs d'entre eux ont été montrés dans des festivals internationaux réputés: 1991 (2014); La casa más grande del mundo (2014); La Jaula de oro (2013).



Lucho Cáceres, acteur péruvien. C'est lui qui interprète le rôle principal de ce court métrage. Il a travaillé sur beaucoup de longs métrages à succès (Cielo oscuro 2012. El evangelio de la carne 2013. El elefante desaparecido 2014, etc.) et à des dizaines de pièces de théâtre et de séries de télévision. Lucho a un registre de jeu impressionnant pour caractériser ses personnages: intense, expressif ou modéré, c'est un acteur polyvalent.
Comment nous aider...  
Tout est presque prêt pour faire ce film. Nous espérons que tu as aimé ce que tu as découvert ici et que tu pourras faire partie de ce projet.
Tu peux aussi parler de notre financement sur les réseaux sociaux ou à tes amis fans de cinéma et des défis.  Aide-nous à rendre cette campagne de financement virale pour que beaucoup de monde puisse la connaître.
Merci beaucoup!
L'équipe de LE TORO ET LA LUNE

 English ...I want really tell you... 
 When I started with the dream of making movies I always thought it would be writer all my life, but the road has been long, high and low, and after several years I have accepted the challenge of directing this film to make it as we have imagined it.

 This campaign is important because it is supported by a 
international production. Although it is my first film as a director, it
 is not a project left to chance, and it will set a precedent of 
collaboration between Guatemala, Peru and Mexico with a passionate team.

 
About the story

Synopsis 
One moonlit night in a fishing village, TORO (50), an
old fisherman, finds out that his WIFE(30) is having an affair with a younger
fisherman. Toro now has to choose between revenge or resignation. Or maybe he
doesn't choose any of those two options. It is not a love story but it is about
love, about the pain that comes with treason, and also about freedom.
Creation process 
The Toro and the moon  is a
12 minutes short film fiction that combines a realistic style with dreamlike
instants. The idea arose four years ago with the image of a picture and has
growing into a story and above all, in a special way to approach the history. 



We need... 



We have almost everything ready for this new adventure: the script, storyboard, technical, creative and artistic team, dedication and determination, all necessary skills to make this movie, but something is missing: the budget.
We need at least $ 10.500 for this project starts up. Your support will enable us to cover the cost of hiring equipment, camera, lights, sound, locations, costumes, days of work permits and insurance, food for everyone, lodging and transportation within Guatemala, etc. Everything needed for production.
So we made this crowdfunding, because we know that cinema is a laborious and demanding job and it is very difficult to live only of love and fresh water. If we fail the total goal, we will go forward with the project but we will have try to fund it all year or more, because our goal is to make an excellent film.


Why Guatemala? 
It is the first question I get asked by many. 


This is a complex and complete project. Here, we work professionals from different origins with a common interest, cinema people who know each other and have absolute trust on the teem, an important ingredient because cinema is essential to work with a team where he can trust blindly. The meeting point is in Guatemala where most of them are.The team is made by professionals with experience, many of whom have worked in productions exhibited at important festivals.
ABOUT SOME TEAM MEMBERS



Marcela Cossíos. from Peru. I'm the writer and director of this film. I have
written several short films: Tic tac, Montreal 2009; The
Flowers of Evil, Lima 2012; collaborated in the writing of a beautiful
feature documentary (Cristobal Halffter: Libertad imaginada, Madrid 2014) and
coordinated the scripts for a TV series (Somos family, 2015).
Currently I am working on another tv serie, I
teach script in a film school, I work on a long film project for a Canadian
film director and also in this, my first short film: The Toro and the moon.



Fernando Cum. from Guatemala. He is the cinematographer of this short. He studied film in Guatemala, Mexico and Spain. He has much experience in short films and visual projects and great sensitivity with images.
He is currently working on his first feature film as a photographer, Girkiq, the adventure begins, the first film puppet Central, a film financed campaign crowdfounding.
Fernando wants to show the world that Guatemala can produce good movies and we will do together, this will be a co-production between Guatemala, Mexico and Peru.





Joanna Prado, better known as Jou. From Mexico. She's art director, set designer and plastic artist, she has a master's degree in set design for film, theater and TV, she has worked on several productions in Spain, Mexico and Guatemala. She is the art director of this film. Jou has often worked alongside Fernando and that's a plus because they know they way of working. She is currently working on her second feature film as an art director, Girqik, the adventure begins. It is also very versatile and able to create things where there seems to be nothing.


Andrés Rodríguez. Guatemala. Audiovisual director. He is the assistant director of this project. He has extensive experience as a director in film and TV, assistant director, producer, casting, etc.
As a director, he has made several short films that have participated in international festivals (Lorena, 2014; Armadillo-Helvetas, 2013; Ulew, 2013; Para los 30, 2012, etc.) Andrew has also participated in several feature films as an assistant director, casting director, field producer, and many of them have been shown at international festivals ( 1991, 2014; La casa más grande del mundo, 2014;
La Jaula de oro, 2013).



Lucho Cáceres. He is the protagonist of this story. He is a
Peruvian actor who has worked in many successful films (Cielo oscuro 2012; El evangelio de la carne, 2013; El elefante desaparecido, 2014, etc. ), hundreds of theater plays and many television series. Lucho agreed to be the protagonist of this story despite his limited free time, and we're lucky, he has an impressive register to build characters.
The
most important thing is that Lucho is a versatile actor, with an impressive
register to characterize , and one of the few that I have full confidence. It
is also a great friend and a transparent man.
Other ways you can help...  
Everything is almost ready for this movie. We hope you liked what you've discovered here and you can be part of the project.
But you can also spread the word about our campaign on social networks or between film and challenges lovers. Help us make this campaign something viral. Thank you very much!
EL TORO Y LA LUNA team

story:
Le mot de l'équipe

“Pour sa deuxième édition, le Festival Ciné-Rebelle a décidé de faire corps avec l’idée d’un cinéma émancipé et libre. Une programmation plurielle, étonnante et détonante. Des regards jeunes sur le cinéma et le monde. Nous vous proposons de découvrir des films passés furtivement sur les écrans, mais dont la qualité est indiscutable, de découvrir de grands succès sous un éclairage nouveau, mais aussi d'en discuter ensemble et d’échanger avec des professionnels autour de leur travail. Nous vous convions donc à partager cette expérience cinéphile, ouverte aux cinéphages, aux passionnés, comme aux grand curieux !”

 - Les programmateurs de Ciné-Rebelle 2015

Un événement créé en partenariat avec le Cinéma Les Lumières (Nanterre), les Cinémas Chaplin (Paris), le Cinéma Le Lincoln (Paris), l'ACID (Association du Cinéma Indépendant pour sa Diffusion), Clap Mag et Universciné. Avec le soutien du département Arts du spectacle et du service d'Action culturelle de l'Université Paris Ouest.

Qui sommes-nous ?

Étudiants en Licence Cinéma à l’université Paris Ouest Nanterre, nous faisons partie de l’atelier Ciné-Ouest, coordonné depuis la rentrée 2010 par Carole Milleliri. L'atelier a pour but d’initier les étudiants à la création d'événements culturels.

Au programme : découverte des métiers de la distribution, de l'exploitation et de la programmation, apprentissage du travail en équipe, négociation avec les distributeurs, discussion avec les partenaires exploitants, création de supports de communication, organisation d'un plan médias, animation de séances de cinéma...

Au fil des années, cet atelier pratique a donné naissance à de multiples événements, jusqu'à la création du festival Ciné-Rebelle l'an passé, en mars 2014.


Que préparons-nous cette année ?

== SÉANCE D'OUVERTURE ==

Vendredi 10 avril 2015 – 20h30 – Cinéma Les Lumières

Ouverture du festival avec une séance spéciale, en partenariat avec l'ACID :

Le Challat de Tunis de Kaouther Ben Hania (Tunisie, France, Canada, Émirats Arabes Unis - 1h30 min - Sortie France : avril 2015).

Tunisie, avant la révolution. Un homme à moto, armé d’un rasoir, balafre les fesses des femmes qui arpentent les trottoirs de Tunis. On l’appelle le Challat, “la lame”. Fait divers, rumeur ou mise en scène politique, d’un quartier à l’autre, tout le monde en parle, mais personne ne l’a jamais vu. Dix ans plus tard, alors qu’avec le Printemps Arabe les langues se délient, une jeune réalisatrice obstinée enquête pour élucider le mystère du Challat de Tunis.

 Projection suivie d'une rencontre avec l'équipe du film.

== NUIT CINÉMA ==

Samedi 11 avril 2015 – 20h30 à l'aube – Cinéma Les Lumières

Cette année, la Nuit Ciné-Rebelle présentera quatre films pétris par un souffle de révolte et/ou d’innovation à leur sortie, des films rebelles dans leur façon de représenter et d'interroger la société qui les a vus naître. Il s’agira de mettre en avant un cinéma frondeur, qui bouleverse l'horizon d'attente du spectateur. Ce sera donc l’occasion de redécouvrir quatre films à la carrière internationale. Des films qui restent gravés dans les mémoires et qui méritent de retrouver les honneurs du grand écran pour être appréciés dans toute leur fougue.

Henry, portrait d'un serial killer de John Mc Naughton. Durée : 1h23.
Orange mécanique de Stanley Kubrick. Durée : 2h16.
Persepolis de Marjane Sartrapi et Vincent Paronnaud. Durée : 1h35
La Haine de Mathieu Kassovitz. Durée  : 1h35

La nuit sera ponctuée d’animations entre les séances : concert acoustique, quizz avec lots à gagner, buffet...

== TABLES RONDES ==

Mardi 14 & Mercredi 15 avril 2015 – 18h - Espace Reverdy - Bat. L - Université Paris Ouest

Deux tables rondes pour promouvoir et défendre un cinéma pluriel, reflet de la diversité d’un monde en mutation, ce cinéma qui a parfois du mal à trouver sa place jusqu’aux salles dans un paysage cinématographique saturé. Par ces tables rondes, nous souhaitons créer un lieu chaleureux d'échanges privilégiés entre étudiants, professionnels du cinéma et amateurs curieux pour débattre ensemble d’enjeux actuels.

1 - Liberté et sexualité à l’écran : le queer en question

Aujourd’hui, la notion de liberté sexuelle renvoie beaucoup dans notre imaginaire à la notion de queer et aux mouvements LGBT. La revendication des libertés sexuelles, visant à leur légitimité sociale et culturelle a-t-elle libéré les représentations cinématographiques ou conduit à la création de nouveaux stéréotypes ? L’institutionnalisation des mouvements LGBT a-t-elle contribué à marginaliser ou à populariser le cinéma queer ?

2 - Quand les femmes se regardent : les représentations du féminin au féminin

Autrefois purement objet cinématographique, les femmes, par leur présence dans les métiers du cinéma, ont-elles réussi à reprendre en main leur propre image filmique ? En compagnie de femmes et d’hommes travaillant dans différents domaines du cinéma (production, réalisation, programmation, jeu), nous nous interrogerons sur la force des conditionnements sociaux et sur les barrières que nous nous imposons à nous-mêmes.


== SOIRÉE COURTS METRAGES ==

Vendredi 17 avril – 20h30 – Cinéma Chaplin Denfert

Notre appel à films a permis de collecter près de 130 films. Le 17 avril, nous proposerons donc une dizaine de films courts sur grand écran pour explorer la fantaisie, la folie, la liberté de ce format élastique et de ce champ de création hétéroclite.


== PROJECTIONS-DÉBATS ==

Weekend du 18-19 avril – Cinéma Le Lincoln

Mettre en avant de jeunes réalisateurs en marge du système et des méthodes académiques, insufflant un vent nouveau sur le cinéma français. Voilà l’envie qui guide notre programmation, pour sortir du champ encore trop imposant dans les sorties hebdomadaires d’un cinéma aux formes classiques, qui n’a plus rien à dire ou à montrer, qu’il soit français ou étranger. Marre de voir les mêmes histoires, la même esthétique, la même façon de cadrer ? Un autre cinéma est possible et il trouve sa place timidement dans les salles françaises. Dans ce cinéma-là, les réalisateurs ont moins de moyens, mais plus d’idées. Autodidactes, sortis d’écoles de cinéma ou issus du monde du théâtre, bien de jeunes cinéastes viennent aujourd’hui constituer une nouvelle « Nouvelle Vague », pleine de folie créative et d’impertinence.

  • Samedi  18 avril

19h : Tonnerre de Guillaume Brac

En présence de Vincent Macaigne et Guillaume Brac.

21h30 : Les Rencontres d'après-minuit de Yann Gonzalez

En présence de Yann Gonzalez.

  • Dimanche 19 avril

19h : La Bataille de Solférino de Justine Triet

En présence du producteur du film : Emmanuel Chaumet.


21h30 : Une avant-première surprise

Ce dont nous avons besoin...

Pour cette deuxième édition, les copies des longs-métrages sont financées par nos partenaires exploitants (Cinéma Les Lumières et Cinémas Chaplin) et une petite enveloppe nous est fournie par le département Arts du spectacle. La communication print est financée par le service d’Action culturelle de l'université Paris Ouest Nanterre La Défense, en complément d'une communication web déjà en cours de déploiement sur le site de l'université ainsi que sur les réseaux sociaux (plus de 600 fans sur Facebook).

Nous vous invitons d'ailleurs à consulter notre page :

https://www.facebook.com/festivalcinerebelle

La création d'un festival implique d’autres frais liés à l'édition de certains supports de diffusion et à la dimension événementielle du projet. La somme de 2000 euros que nous souhaitons rassembler doit donc nous permettre : 

·  De créer un master de projection numérique (format DCP, normes professionnelles) avec l’ensemble des courts-métrages pour la soirée du vendredi 17 avril. C'est-à-dire de défrayer un monteur pour sa réalisation et financer le support en lui-même.

·  De soutenir la communication print par l'impression de photographies et articles de presse, exposés à l'université et dans nos salles partenaires.

·  D’accueillir les intervenants professionnels dans de bonnes conditions

·  De financer les différents buffets prévus pendant le festival (en particulier pendant la nuit cinéma)

·  De créer des goodies Ciné-Rebelle

Pourquoi nous aider ?

En contribuant au budget du Festival Ciné-Rebelle, vous aidez un projet jeune porté par un groupe de 27 étudiants passionnés et engagés. 

  • Soutenir Ciné-Rebelle, c'est s'engager pour un projet jeune mais sérieux, qui défend un regard pluriel sur le cinéma et invite à la rencontre. Dans la forêt des événements cinéma, le festival Ciné-Rebelle trouve sa singularité non seulement dans la diversité de son programme (avec une identité à la fois universitaire et ludique), mais également dans la configuration de ses équipes. Chaque année : une nouvelle promotion d'étudiants, programmateurs débutants, un nouveau départ, de nouveaux défis...

  • Soutenir Ciné-Rebelle, c'est permettre à des étudiants en cinéma de parfaire un projet  important dans leur professionnalisation. Ce projet leur permet de découvrir des métiers cachés du cinéma, mais aussi de se confronter aux enjeux et aux contraintes de la création d'un événement complexe : apprendre à collaborer avec des professionnels du secteur, gérer au mieux un budget, travailler en équipe, respecter des délais, organiser un plan de communication. Autant de compétences utiles pour leur avenir (et transférables dans bien des domaines).

Risques et défis

Le principal défi pour nous est de vous amener jusqu'à la salle de cinéma !
Nous savons bien à quel point l'offre culturelle est chargée à Paris et en Ile-de-France. Mais nous espérons trouver notre place dans vos cœurs et vous dans nos salles. Pour cela, nous avons prévu un plan de communication structuré, dont cette campagne Indiegogo constitue une phase cruciale.

Après une première édition prototype, l'enseignante coordinatrice et ses étudiants programmateurs ont tiré profit de cette expérience pour proposer une deuxième édition plus riche, plus ambitieuse, à l'organisation professionnelle.

D'autres façons de nous aider

Si le projet du festival Ciné-Rebelle vous intéresse, mais que vous ne pouvez pas y contribuer financièrement, il existe d'autres façons de nous aider.

  • D'abord, en relayant cette page Indiegogo autour de vous. Tout simplement ! Vous aimez notre projet, invitez vos amis à y participer. Ce sera déjà beaucoup pour nous.
  • Ensuite, vous pouvez soutenir notre communication sur l'événement en lui-même via les réseaux sociaux. Faites du bruit pour Ciné-Rebelle !
  • Et, évidemment, venez nombreux du 10 au 19 avril à nos projections et rencontres !! On a hâte de vous voir en personne.

Merci à tous pour votre soutien .

L'EQUIPE CINE-REBELLE

Il s’agira de mettre en avant un cinéma frondeur, qui bouleverse l'horizon
d'attente du spectateur. Ce sera donc l’occasion de redécouvrir quatre films à
la carrière internationale. Des films qui restent gravés dans les mémoires et
qui méritent de retrouver les honneurs du grand écran pour être appréciés dans
toute leur fougue.
Henry, portrait d'un serial killer de John Mc Naughton. Durée : 1h23.Orange mécanique de Stanley Kubrick. Durée : 2h16.Persepolis de Marjane Sartrapi et Vincent Paronnaud. Durée : 1h35La Haine de Mathieu Kassovitz. Durée  : 1h35La nuit sera ponctuée d’animations entre les séances : concert acoustique, quizz avec lots à gagner, buffet...== TABLES RONDES ==
Mardi 14 & Mercredi 15 avril 2015 – 18h - Espace Reverdy - Bat. L - Université Paris Ouest
Deux tables rondes pour promouvoir et défendre un cinéma pluriel,
reflet de la diversité d’un monde en mutation, ce cinéma qui a parfois du mal à
trouver sa place jusqu’aux salles dans un paysage cinématographique saturé. Par
ces tables rondes, nous souhaitons créer un lieu chaleureux d'échanges
privilégiés entre étudiants, professionnels du cinéma et amateurs curieux pour
débattre ensemble d’enjeux actuels. 
1 - Liberté et sexualité à l’écran : le queer en questionAujourd’hui, la notion de liberté sexuelle renvoie beaucoup dans notre imaginaire à la notion de queer et aux mouvements LGBT. La revendication des libertés sexuelles, visant à leur légitimité sociale et culturelle a-t-elle libéré les représentations cinématographiques ou conduit à la création de nouveaux stéréotypes ? L’institutionnalisation des mouvements LGBT a-t-elle contribué à marginaliser ou à populariser le cinéma queer ?
2 - Quand les femmes se regardent : les représentations du
féminin au féminin
Autrefois purement objet cinématographique, les femmes, par leur présence dans les métiers du cinéma, ont-elles réussi à reprendre en main leur propre image filmique ? En compagnie de femmes et d’hommes travaillant dans différents domaines du cinéma (production, réalisation, programmation, jeu), nous nous interrogerons sur la force des conditionnements sociaux et sur les barrières que nous nous imposons à nous-mêmes.
== SOIRÉE COURTS METRAGES ==
Vendredi 17 avril – 20h30 – Cinéma Chaplin Denfert
Notre appel à films a permis de collecter près de 130 films. Le 17
avril, nous proposerons donc une dizaine de films courts sur grand écran pour
explorer la fantaisie, la folie, la liberté de ce format élastique et de ce champ
de création hétéroclite. 


== PROJECTIONS-DÉBATS ==
Weekend du 18-19 avril – Cinéma Le Lincoln
Mettre en avant de
jeunes réalisateurs en marge du système et des méthodes académiques, insufflant un vent nouveau sur le cinéma
français. Voilà l’envie qui guide notre programmation, pour sortir du champ encore trop imposant dans les
sorties hebdomadaires d’un cinéma aux
formes classiques, qui n’a plus rien
à dire ou à montrer, qu’il soit français ou étranger. Marre de voir les mêmes histoires, la même
esthétique, la même façon de cadrer ? Un
autre cinéma est possible et il trouve sa place timidement dans les salles
françaises. Dans ce cinéma-là, les réalisateurs ont moins de
moyens, mais plus d’idées. Autodidactes, sortis d’écoles de cinéma ou issus
du monde du théâtre, bien de jeunes cinéastes viennent aujourd’hui constituer
une nouvelle « Nouvelle Vague », pleine de folie créative et
d’impertinence.

Samedi  18 avril 19h : Tonnerre de Guillaume BracEn présence de Vincent Macaigne et Guillaume Brac.21h30 : Les Rencontres d'après-minuit de Yann GonzalezEn présence de Yann Gonzalez.Dimanche 19 avril 19h : La Bataille de Solférino de Justine TrietEn présence du producteur du film : Emmanuel Chaumet.21h30 : Une avant-première surprise

Ce dont nous avons besoin...

Pour cette deuxième édition, les copies des longs-métrages sont financées
par nos partenaires exploitants (Cinéma Les Lumières et Cinémas Chaplin) et une
petite enveloppe nous est fournie par le département Arts du spectacle. La
communication print est financée par le service d’Action culturelle de
l'université Paris Ouest Nanterre La Défense, en complément d'une communication
web déjà en cours de déploiement sur le site de l'université ainsi que sur les
réseaux sociaux (plus de 600 fans sur Facebook).
Nous vous invitons d'ailleurs à consulter notre page :
https://www.facebook.com/festivalcinerebelle
La création d'un festival implique d’autres frais liés à
l'édition de certains supports de diffusion et à la dimension événementielle du
projet. La somme de 2000 euros que nous souhaitons rassembler doit donc nous
permettre : 
· 
De créer un master de projection numérique (format DCP, normes
professionnelles) avec l’ensemble des courts-métrages pour la soirée du vendredi
17 avril. C'est-à-dire de défrayer un monteur pour sa réalisation et financer
le support en lui-même.
· 
De soutenir la communication print par l'impression de photographies et
articles de presse, exposés à l'université et dans nos salles partenaires.
· 
D’accueillir les intervenants professionnels dans de bonnes conditions 
· 
De financer les différents buffets prévus pendant le festival (en particulier
pendant la nuit cinéma)
· 
De créer des goodies Ciné-Rebelle



Pourquoi nous aider ?
En contribuant au budget du Festival Ciné-Rebelle, vous aidez un projet jeune porté par un groupe de 27 étudiants passionnés et engagés. 


Soutenir Ciné-Rebelle, c'est s'engager pour un projet jeune mais sérieux, qui défend un regard pluriel sur le cinéma et invite à la rencontre. Dans la forêt des événements cinéma, le festival Ciné-Rebelle trouve sa singularité non seulement dans la diversité de son programme (avec une identité à la fois universitaire et ludique), mais également dans la configuration de ses équipes. Chaque année : une nouvelle promotion d'étudiants, programmateurs débutants, un nouveau départ, de nouveaux défis... 



Soutenir Ciné-Rebelle, c'est permettre à des étudiants en cinéma de parfaire un projet  important dans leur professionnalisation. Ce projet leur permet de découvrir des métiers cachés du cinéma, mais aussi de se confronter aux enjeux et aux contraintes de la création d'un événement complexe : apprendre à collaborer avec des professionnels du secteur, gérer au mieux un budget, travailler en équipe, respecter des délais, organiser un plan de communication. Autant de compétences utiles pour leur avenir (et transférables dans bien des domaines).



Risques et défisLe principal défi pour nous est de vous amener jusqu'à la salle de cinéma !Nous savons bien à quel point l'offre culturelle est chargée à Paris et en Ile-de-France. Mais nous espérons trouver notre place dans vos cœurs et vous dans nos salles. Pour cela, nous avons prévu un plan de communication structuré, dont cette campagne Indiegogo constitue une phase cruciale.Après une première édition prototype, l'enseignante coordinatrice et ses
 étudiants programmateurs ont tiré profit de cette expérience pour 
proposer une deuxième édition plus riche, plus ambitieuse, à l'organisation professionnelle.

D'autres façons de nous aider

Si le projet du festival Ciné-Rebelle vous intéresse, mais que vous ne pouvez pas y contribuer financièrement, il existe d'autres façons de nous aider.
D'abord, en relayant cette page Indiegogo autour de vous. Tout simplement ! Vous aimez notre projet, invitez vos amis à y participer. Ce sera déjà beaucoup pour nous.
Ensuite, vous pouvez soutenir notre communication sur l'événement en lui-même via les réseaux sociaux. Faites du bruit pour Ciné-Rebelle !
Et, évidemment, venez nombreux du 10 au 19 avril à nos projections et rencontres !! On a hâte de vous voir en personne.
Merci à tous pour votre soutien .L'EQUIPE CINE-REBELLE

story:
Short Summary

Death’s (Man)date is a six-minute long dark comedy short film that was created from start to finish in a single weekend as a part of the global, and annual, 48 Hour Film Project (48HFP). It performed admirably in the Johannesburg, South Africa competition of the 48HFP where it was nominated for nine award categories including Best Directing, Best Editing, Best Script and WINNING Best Dialogue, Best Acting and the coveted BEST FILM.

The TEAM (Iconic) behind Death's (Man)date consists of eleven independent Johannesburg based filmmakers with different levels of experience and skill but all passionate about film as a medium; all looking to find ways to improve themselves as technical and creative individuals.

Winning the Johannesburg leg of the competition means Death's (Man)date gets to participate in the international competition, and is invited to attend the FILMAPALOOZA event in Hollywood where 48HFP teams from around the world gather to share stories, partake in panel discussions, network with one another and support their film, city and country at the award ceremony where the top 10 films will be announced and sent to the CANNES INTERNATIONAL FILM FESTIVAL.

Being able to attend the event in Hollywood personally offers South African independent filmmakers a rare opportunity to interact with other filmmakers from around the world. Participating in panels lead by influential and experienced industry professionals which can help teach and influence these filmmakers how to further their careers in South Africa but also opens the door for international collaboration and experience.  That being said, Hollywood is in many ways a sort of Mecca to film and filmmakers and most of these filmmakers won't have the opportunity to visit this famous cinema city if not through an event and invitation such as this.


What We Need

We need money to get the cast and crew to Hollywood. 

The South African Rand (ZAR) is very weak against the United States' Dollar which means travelling to the US is incredibly expensive for South Africans. More so for independent filmmakers most of whom work as industry freelancers. 

We are looking to fund six members of the winning team for flights and accommodation and $5000 would go a very long way to making that happen. If we are unable to gather the full amount, anything we could gather will go to flights and seeing if we can at least get some of the members to LA to experience what could be a game changer for these guys.


The Impact

The South African film industry is going through a time of growth, allowing young independent filmmakers a platform to showcase and further their careers. Opportunities are however hard fought to get and recognition and funding is still pretty scarce. Attending an event where these filmmakers can increase their exposure to the greater film industry but also share themselves and their work with more people is a great opportunity to create relationships and opportunities for themselves while also making friends and building relationships that can turn into future collaborations. 

The filmmakers that make up the team, 'Iconic', have great potential and have shown it through the standard of their work and winning a competition that could take them as far as the Cannes International Film Festival is a witness to that.


*We are also looking at funding opportunities locally and have approached a group of companies and organisations in search of sponsorship, trying to cover as many possible funding opportunities as we can think off. A 'hierarchy' has been established as to who gets to go 'first' - Director, Producer, Actors, Editors being the hierarchy - as well as a model for how funds might be distributed across all members if multiple funding opportunities come through positive; first being flights, then accommodation, then other travel costs, then administrative costs including travel Visas and event attendance, and if at that point there is still money left (which would be an amazing blessing), some spending money.


Other Ways You Can Help

Awareness is a great tool for us at this stage. Sharing our information and story with other people who might be able to help with funding would be much appreciated. The indiegogo summary recommends that we remind of the sharing buttons and we would much appreciate if you would consider sharing our project and dream with the rest of your world.

story:
Big NEWS! We contacted our theater and they offered us an extraordinary discount so that we can present the festival at their theater!  If we raise another $9K right here in the next 5 days, we have 2 screens for 3 days and a small closing ceremony.  If we raise an additional $17K total, we can procure 3 screens for 3 days.  We can do this! :D


A CELEBRATION OF EMPOWERED WOMEN, ACTION FILMS, & WOMEN WHO KICK ASS IN THEM.

·  Over two hundred film submissions—feature films, short films, animation and documentaries. We are inundated. We have enough films to make a very thunderous roar to empower women.

• Premium screens at centrally located theater in Downtown Los Angeles

And many more announcements of honor awards for actresses and stunt women coming soon.



Additional judge announcements coming soon.

·  Panel discussions, demos, and workshops on each day featuring stuntwomen, actresses, athletes, historians and film historians. 

WE CAN’T DO THIS WITHOUT YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS.  WOMEN AND MEN WHO WANT TO SEE FEMALE ACTION HEROES NEED TO SHOW THEIR SUPPORT NOW.

We’d like our art to reflect a world where women and men share in equal power, strength and love.  If you blow the doors off what a woman believes she can do on a physical level it transcends her reality of what she thinks she can do in all aspects of her life.  By celebrating images of physically empowered women we hope to help blow the doors off personal notions of limitation for women everywhere.

For every dollar we raise here, we are donating 4% to Girls on the Run, Los Angeles County division, to help them celebrate their 10 years of making a difference in girls' lives across the nation.

We offer two different categories of rewards:  1.) in person rewards, such as passes, for those who are able to attend the festival in Los Angeles, CA,  2.)  rewards designed for those who don't attend.  Our reward packages build upon each other with a major perk in each reward. If you pick a higher level reward, you will receive all items in lower dollar reward levels as well as your chosen perk.  ALL CONTRIBUTORS WILL BE LISTED ON OUR WEBSITE FOUNDERS PAGE AS FOUNDERS OF THE FESTIVAL.

Please note:  All rewards designed around attendance to the festival DO NOT INCLUDE ANY TRAVEL EXPENSES, with the exception of our Raffle contest.

 








An accomplished actress and stuntwoman, Ms. Wise has been acting professionally for over a decade.  As lead actress of the award-winning horror-action film, Hanah’s Gift, Ms. Wise won best actress at the IndieFest Film Festival. Her character was so popular with young women that it spawned two fan clubs in Southern California.  Standing six-feet tall, a former basketball standout and licensed physical trainer, Ms. Wise possesses a presence and charisma that is groundbreaking in feature films—More Clint Eastwood than girlfriend-next door.  Ms. Wise is also an accomplished producer having overseen the production of three indie feature films as well as multiple shorts and commercials.  She is an adept video and sound editor, graphic design, 2D motion graphics, and  specializes in polishing troubled projects.

An award-wining writer-director, as well as an actor, Mr. Newcombe has produced and directed dramatic film, commercial and music video projects, and authored several screenplays. An alumnus of Princeton University, Mr. Newcombe is active in political and social issues and is a champion of female empowerment in his films and screenplays. He believes that female action heroes are a talisman for a more shining ideal of the roles possible to a woman.

A prolific writer, Mr. Baldwin has authored nearly 200 screenplays, 50 stage plays and six novels and has directed three feature films. Mr. Baldwin is also an experience stuntman and stunt coordinator. He has championed powerful roles for women throughout his life and has featured strong female action characters in most of his productions.  He feels an action script with a female lead makes a film more interesting and offers a unique perspective.

Mr. Miller is one of the most esteemed editors in Hollywood having edited films for Woody Allen, Martin Scorsese, The Coen Brothers, Michael Bay and Sir Anthony Hopkins. His credits include Raging Bull, Manhattan, Miller’s Crossing, Raising Arizona, Armageddon and Stigmata. He is an accomplished director and producer. 

Jackie Hesley has been a social media and PR specialist since 2008.  Renowned for her expertise at increasing brand consciousness through web-based networks, she employs numerous techniques to drive awareness and popularity to her clients’ products.  With a background in public relations, marketing, talent development and film production, she has been involved in both in front and behind the camera.  A native of Dallas and a graduate of the Art Institute of Dallas, Ms. Hesley believes it's time for Women to stand up, be counted, and have their voices heard.

A veteran PR professional with years of experience in the field, Liz had a background as a newspaper reporter and editor, before segueing into public relations.  During her tenure in community journalism for the largest weekly newspaper east of the Mississippi, Ms. Tonis garnered a dozen press club awards, covering political corruption, and making her mark on a breast cancer clusters series. She then focused the next decade with PR stints for two non-profits-a hospital and a museum.  

Sonja is originally from Nürnberg, Germany.  She’s had a passion for movies from a very young age. She first indulged in that passion when she moved to Detroit, where she began studying acting with former Second City Detroit Director and SNL writer Rich Goteri. Sonja earned her Directing Certificate from UCLA Extension in Fall of 2014.  Her first short film, “Mighty Benjamin Little”, which she wrote and produced, was recently showcased at the Nonstop Shortfilm Festival in Nürnberg, Germany. 

With a passion for both film and women's rights, it was natural that John Halbert would gravitate to the Artemis Women In Action Film Festival. A student of philosophy at Swarthmore College and of cinema at the University of Southern California, Mr. Halbert approaches film by probing and challenging it's conventions, particuarly those which pertain to gender. Mr. Halbert likes to say that, as a filmmaker, he intends to never make a movie that does not pass the Bechdel test.


A sports marketing veteran of 20+ years, Howard is the founder of Sports and Social Change, a sports marketing firm with a focus on Cause Marketing, Corporate Social Responsibility and Social Enterprise development, working to connect brands, media properties, teams, leagues and athletes with nonprofit organizations, foundations and affiliated cause-driven businesses.  His expertise includes brand positioning and activation, grassroots and experiential marketing programs, public relations and social media campaigns, as well as business plans, revenue models and corporate partnership development. @sportsandchange

A graduate of Wesleyan University, Heidi Mastrogiovanni was a performer and writer with the sketch comedy group Mindfield, playing in clubs and cabarets in New York and appearing on the syndicated television show Spotlight Café.  Heidi’s comedic novel, "Lala Pettibone’s Act Two," will be released in 2015. She sits on the boards of two animal welfare organizations in Los Angeles. The web comedy series "Verdene and Gleneda," for which Heidi serves as writer/producer/actor, was chosen for the Hotspot on the WGA's Hotlist for July 2014.

Malissa Wise is the Owner and President of Wise Business Decisions, which was established in 1998.  She specializes in accounting and financial consulting for small businesses ($500K-$5M).  Malissa assesses and creates a specialized structure to maintain accounting and bookkeeping systems for a wide variety of clients and businesses.  To further financial goals, she affords her clients the opportunity to understand how their business is performing through the interpretation of financial statements and by creating easy to understand retrospective and prospective evaluations. Malissa has a BS in Finance from University of Southern California, an MBA from California State Los Angeles, and has her CPA license.

story:
Konoto Children's Centre

The Lonely Road Foundation is building an Early Childhood Development Centre called the Konoto Children's Centre. It will service over 200 kids aged 0 to 5 years old, from a rural community called Ga-Dikgale in the Northern part of South Africa.

The name of the centre comes from the legendary queen of the Dikgale clan, who fought oppression and injustice by giving her people hope in a time of despair.

Childhood Development Centres in rural areas go without adequate sanitation, running water and power. They function on extremely limited resources. We can change the lives of the children in Ga-Dikgale for the better. With your generous donations we will be able to store, clean and prepare healthy food, in hygienic conditions, for all 200 children. All the necessary facilities and utensils, such as stoves, fridges and freezers, are included. This, together with running water and ablution facilities, will raise the standards and will be a first for childcare in the area.

The cost to build the whole Centre: $120 000
Our target to start construction: $20 000

If you can imagine a life without sanitation, running water and power then you can imagine the lives of the orphaned and vulnerable children of Ga-Dikgale. We are going to change that paradigm for good.

Join us as we… "Raise our Kids" in a way that ensures they feel loved, respected and belong!

You, your family, friends and colleagues can donate any amount from $20 over the next 45 days. For only $100 a child, we can make their dreams a reality.

In return for your generosity, you will receive anything from a personalised “Thank you message” directly from one of the children to your own personal message on the “Angels of Love” wall. There are also copies of The Lonely Road Book and different sized prints by acclaimed photographer John Ross which were shot in the community.

With your help, we will build the first of five sections of the Children's Centre. In the long term, the Children's Centre will change the lives of thousands of children for many years to come!

What are the Other Ways You Can Help?

We understand if you're not in a position to support our cause financially. You could play your part by sending this appeal out to 10 of your family, friends and colleagues. Give them the opportunity to get involved in changing people's lives.

  • Please pass this on to 10 of your friends
  • Use the IndieGogo share tools to spread the word easily
  • Visit us on Facebook and like our page to stay in touch
  • Visit our website www.thelonelyroad.org and see what's happening

Give a child a life worth living!

story:
A Message From the Creator: 

"Being a kid who grew up in the late 70s and into the 80s, I cut my teeth on shows like Buck Rogers, Battlestar Galactica, He-Man, the Lone Ranger, Star Wars, and the Original Star Trek.

 MAX ADVENTURE is the combination of great family entertainment with educational properties for the young and teen crowd. Everything that I loved as a kid is what makes MAX what it is. With more and more kids being turned to violent video games, MAX ADVENTURE is the right mix of adventure, fun, and education.

How cool is it to watch something that's fun and entertaining that has a moral twist to it? Kids won't even know they're being educated!"   

Phillip "Pat" Fitzlaff 
Owner Motion Dynamics Animation, LLC



When an overly glorified delivery man (Max) is thrust through a black hole, his ship crash lands on the strange planet of Nemisia. He quickly finds himself caught in a war between the Nemisian Army and the Goranian Resistance, and the subject of interest by both!    

Max Adventure Teaser Trailer
(Winner of the September 2014 IpISoft Motion Capture Competition) 

 

MAX ADVENTURE PROMO TRAILER



THERE'S NOTHING LIKE MAX ADVENTURE! 




 

PHILLIP "Pat" FITZLAFF, Q.M.H.A, M.B.A - SERIES CREATOR

Series creator Phillip "Pat" Fitzlaff has been performing since the age of 16, starting in theater and then moving into film. His interest in animation started at the young age of five when he wanted nothing more than to work for Disney Studios. He started making flipbooks and then later worked in cell animation with a light table built by his grandfather (who was a news photographer) Wayne Kinnie. 

He has appeared in such stage productions as Alice in Wonderland, The Haunting of Hathaway House, and Sir Gawain and the Green knight and at Star Trek: The Experience - each production he landed a principal role. 

He has studied film at the Northwest Film Center in Portland, Oregon where he was born, and also at the Art Institute of Las Vegas, Nv. He would later get is Baccalaureate Degree in Human Services Management and his Masters in Business Administration.

MAX ADVENTURE, created by his independent animation company Motion Dynamics Animation, LLC,  is Phillips dream of combining a fun fantasy story with education called Psycho Social Rehabilitation. Phillip has been counseling children and families for the past 6 years in Psychosocial areas and wants to pass that on to the masses through MAX ADVENTURE.  He also voices the bad guy, Seth Cordall.   


Page Ostrow - Industry Executive and Producers Representative

We couldn't be more pleased than to be able to submit MAX ADVENTURE to Page Ostrow of Ostrow and Company for distribution. She and her company have found distribution for over 200 feature films not to mention numerous documentaries. Her clientele include such stars as Mark Wahlberg, Meryl Streep, Michael Moore, just to name a few. 

"Ostrow’s background includes working under contract for Initial Entertainments Graham King distributor/producer of Oscar winning films such as ‘The Departed’, ‘The Aviator’ and ‘Blood Diamond’. These days, in order to find, negotiate track and collect on deals for independent filmmakers and producers Ostrow relies on her extensive relationships and the previous distribution expertise developed during the ten years she spent providing distributors with global sales support, licensing and pre-sales for their film projects and libraries to international buyers at all the film markets. As a result Page Ostrow maintains her contacts with key executives who have a shared vision toward launching quality films into the marketplace." (Source: Ostrow and Company)

 

Richard Band - Emmy Award Nominated Musical Composer

"Richard decided to take on making music for films for numerous production companies like Paramount, Universal, Film Ventures International and 20th Century Fox. During the mid eighties he scored music for all of his father's and brother's horror films including Re-Animator (1985), _Dolls (1986)_, Troll (1986) and From Beyond (1986). After his brother's company collapsed, Band worked with numerous other filmmakers, and then returned to work for his brother and father in the early nineties. Richard Band's music scores are unique and fascinating and he has done music for over 50 motion pictures to date." (courtesy IMDB)
Some of his credits include Walker Texas Ranger, Stargate SG-1, Masters of Horror and Modern Marvels, just to name a few.
It is an absolute honor to have his expertise, style, and flair on the show. He's patient, collaborative, and just a heck of a nice guy!

Watch Richard in Action as he conducts a session!

Find our more about Richard HERE!

 

Vincent Caso - S.A.G Actor - The Guild

We are honored to introduce Vincent Caso, who stars on the critically acclaimed series The Guild as Bladezz. His IMDB profile shows a history of television series and motion pictures.  Vincent has graciously offered his services not only in the promotion of Max Adventure, but also as a talent. Vincent is well known in the Comi-Con world as well as in the sci-fi gamer groups. The power that he holds within this particular fan base is invaluable to Max Adventure. We want to thank Vincent for giving his valuable time to this project.

 

Eric Randall, B.A Theater - Actor

Actor ERIC RANDALL has an impressive history in television, voice over work, and film acting. He was rated the number one weather man in Nevada for almost 20 years and was highly recognized by the governor. He has hosted a nationally syndicated sports talk show and has appeared in motion pictures such as "Pure Country" and "Casino", and has lent his voice to Westwood Studios for games such as "Command and Conquer," "Tales of Kyrandia". He even acted in the live performance of Star Trek at the Las Vegas Hilton for more than 8 years. We are lucky to have his talents in voicing Max Adventure, General Conn, and Lieutenant Armok. You can see more of Eric HERE!   

 

GINA BURGO, B.F.A - ACTOR

The beautiful Gina Burgo is a graduate of the University of Colorado, Boulder with a bachelors degree in Dance.  As a dancer, singer, and actress, she has performed in various shows including Superstars of Country, Legends in Concert, and Star Trek: The Experience.  She is thrilled to be a part of the MAX family as the feisty Phem.

  

C. Clayton Blackwell, M.F.A - S.A.G - Actor
It is an honor to announce that Screen Actors Guild member C. Clayton Blackwell has joined that cast of MAX ADVENTURE!
Mr. Blackwell has an impressive background in both Stage and Screen acting.
He has performed alongside such stars as Nora Jones, Natalie Portman, Coolio, Rocio Verdejo and Mark Greenfield. 
He has been a long time friend of ours and we are THRILLED that he's joined us. Shhhhh....His character is a surprise!

 

Curtis Fowler, B.F.A - Actor
The acting bug hit Curtis back in high school, and ever since then if he is not involved in any productions, he's making up his own in front of the mirror. Getting his start doing live theater through the Las Vegas Little Theatre in such productions as"Beau Jest", he slowly moved up, receiving roles as a Starfleet Officer at the live action Star Trek The Experience at the Las Vegas Hilton, to having a supporting role in an international Nissan commercial. Soon after his interest in post production work grew as well, attending the Art Institute of Las Vegas studying Digital Media Production, learning about camerawork and editing. Curtis is lending his talents as the adorable yet absent minded robot, Tugg-Butt.

AMAHL DUNBAR - ANIMATOR 

Another Star Trek: The Experience alumni to join the MAX ADVENTURE family is Amahl Dunbar. Amahl is not only an accomplished animator, but has taught computer animation at the College of Southern Nevada. He has just recently wrapped an independent feature called Space Detectives as the lead animator and effects person on the project.  Some of his work can be viewed here. 

Brandon Anderson, B.S Computer Science - Character Animator

Brandon is a multitalented powerhouse. His demo reel, education and raw talent allows for the perfect blend of artistry that will allow our characters to not only breath life, but show character.  

ERIC BUMPUS, M.B.A - EDITOR

Eric has a vast background in media production, audio and photography. In addition to holding an MBA, he has experience in organizing both pre and post production aspects of a production and is owner of his own production company, Meliora Productions.    

Jennifer Kansky, M.ed - Educational Consultant

Jennifer is definitely one of the joys of the production. Not only is she a mother of three, but she is also an educator who holds dual master degrees in Education and Law. She is responsible for ensuring each MAX ADVENTURE story meets educational guidelines.

Gerson R. Druckman, CPA

Mr. Druckman is one of the few "honest Abes" out there and we are proud to have him represent our financial interests. Those who donate to MAX ADVENTURE can rest assured that the bookkeeping and IRS representation will be in order through his company's services.  



Our mission is to create quality adventure based educational shows. With a talent pool who work in entertainment, education and psychology, we bring over 80 years combined experience to the table!

Our biggest concern moving forward is guaranteeing that YOU have access to the film. This is very important to us because we are asking you to put your faith in our team to bring this story to you. Provided that our goal is met, we pledge to bring MAX ADVENTURE directly to YOU via a digital download for those contributing $30 or over.

We leave you with this thought…reaching our goal will not only green light MAX ADVENTURE, it will bring us one step closer to bringing back adventure based entertainment that's fun for the entire family!

-Your MAX ADVENTURE Producing Team



While MAX ADVENTURE is entertainment for the ENTIRE FAMILY, it is specially geared towards those 10 years and up. 
With many of today's youth addicted to technology; some of it violent, wouldn't it be nice to give them the adventure they are seeking through an outlet that is safe and educational without being preachy? 
Max Adventure covers the following topics:
  • Anger Management
  • Loss
  • Coping Skills
  • Acceptance
  • Social and Cultural Tolerance
  • Being flexible in life
  • Sense of humor
  • Technology Addiction
    And many other social issues that today's teens and young adults face. 



    What you Get:
    • Max Adventure T-Shirts
    • Max Adventure Hoodies
    • Digital Download of the Series
    • Posters
    • Cell Phone Cases
    • Computer Wallpapers
    • Lunch Boxes
    • Backpacks 
    • USB Drives
    • Signed Scripts
    • Producers Credit
    • Free Copy of Poser Pro 2014
    • Metallic Prints
    • Character Phone Greeting
    • Skype Session with Cast and Crew
    • Production Updates 
    • Max Adventure School Kit
          DISTRESSED MAX ADVENTURE CLOTHING
                             
                                

    MAX ADVENTURE POSTERS 

                                        

                       

    MAX ADVENTURE WALLPAPERS 



    iPhone/Samsung Phone Case

                                  

    MAX ADVENTURE BACK TO SCHOOL PACKAGE:

    Backpack, Notepad, Phone Case, Pen, USB Drive, Lunchbox

      

     

    FREE Copy of POSER 2014!

                          



    !!!!!PLUS MANY MORE ITEMS!!!!!



    All projects face risks, challenges and setbacks. We are lucky in the fact that we have the people lined up, the business legalized and formulated and support from our sponsors and fans. 

    Our BIGGEST challenge right now is simply getting the funds to kick this project off. While we've listed $80,000 as our asking price, this amount only allows for the bare minimum needed to see season 1 of MAX ADVENTURE completed. We would all have to keep our day jobs which could very well hold up production and distribution submission.

    Speaking of distribution, while Page Ostrow is great at what she does (and can usually land a deal within 3 months,) there's no promise that Max will find distribution immediately. In fact, if and when  it does, the network may very well ask for changes which could also set us back.

    There are other unforeseen situations such as computers could fail, renders could crash, actors could lose their voices or face personal crisis, e.t.c.  

    In any case, with your support you WILL see MAX ADVENTURE completed! 


    We're happy you asked! To be blunt, your contributions will go into a business account registered under Motion Dynamics, LLC. Your donations will go towards equipment, updated software, distribution costs, legal costs, marketing and pr, and a stipend to the cast and crew. 

    Of course, the more you give, the more we can do!

    What does this mean? More quality assurance over the project so that we can operate more efficiently and more quickly which will streamline the production. This will allow us to get our product to the distributor faster while offering a better product overall. 

    Here's the Breakdown:

    Materials: 35%

    Payroll:  30%

    Overhead: 20%

    Contingencies: 10%

    Taxes: 5%






    Read the MicroFilmmaker Magazine Article Here!

    SCI-FI BLOGGERS

     Listen Here


    We've also bee featured in:


    Come visit MAX and say HI and don't forget to like us! We'd LOVE to hear from you! You can find us on facebook, youtube, twitter, and Google+!

Read the MicroFilmmaker Magazine Article Here!SCI-FI BLOGGERS Listen HereWe've also bee featured in:

Come visit MAX and say HI and don't forget to like us! We'd LOVE to hear from you! You can find us on facebook, youtube, twitter, and Google+!

story:
Short Summary

Reclaim: Freedom Beyond Rescue is an in-depth look at survivors of sex-trafficking and their hopes and challenges post-rescue.

Rescue is a process, not a one-time event. The story we often hear tells us what led to someone being trafficked and what their exploitation was like, but the rest of the story goes untold.

We believe storytelling is a powerful medium to educate and increase awareness of the realities survivors face on a daily basis. Survivors want a brighter future, but face significant barriers and challenges along the way. Our goal is to expand on current knowledge of survivor care and to spark greater understanding, support, and love for survivors of sex trafficking. 

Over the next three months we will be interviewing survivors and experts in survivor care asking questions that broaden our understanding of life beyond trafficking. We will see survivors' strength and resilience demonstrated in their story, and hear from leading experts who serve survivors.

The Impact

Your contribution goes to much more than just making a film. Our vision is that this film will spark a larger movement to provide the level of care and opportunity survivors deserve. There has never been a documentary that goes this deep into life beyond rescue.

The Team

Our team is composed of passionate people who love what they do, and are committed to seeing this project through from start to finish. 

Allie Merrill (Producer/Director/Cinematographer) - www.msqcreative.com
Josh Bailey (Executive Producer) - thegrayhaven.org
Stephen Stonestreet (Cinematographer) - stonestreetcreative.com
Tucker MacDonald (Music Composer)

Production Schedule

Filming will take place along the East Coast in New York City, Washington D.C., Nashville, Richmond and Charlottesville, Virginia.

All filming is set to be complete by June 31st, 2015. Editing and all other post-production will be completed by November 31, 2015. 

We will submit the completed film to various film festivals across the country, and the film will be released to the public following any festival showings in 2016. 

Other Ways You Can Help

It's impossible to do this project on our own, and that's where we need you! Your donations will make a difference in many lives, and in furthering the cause of the stories of the survivors represented in the film. Every little bit adds up, and we have budgeted each item carefully to ensure we have all costs covered in order to make this project a success. However, we understand that not everyone can give financially so we have other ways you can get involved.

  • Volunteer - We are in need of volunteers to assist on shoots, research and make contacts, and help with everyday tasks. If you are interested in helping in any way, please reach out to us! We are open to creative ideas and fresh perspectives.
  • Spread the Word - How does each revolution start? One friend talking to another friend, talking to another friend, talking to another friend...you get the point. We need your help to reach as many people as possible in order to secure funding and increase awareness about the film. Send it to everyone you know, post it on social media, talk to your family, friends, and coworkers -- don't leave anyone out.

story:
Short Summary

"Through The Eyes" is a short film with a look into the world of a serial killer from his point of view. A raw and real journey into insanity with a psychological and thriller focus. This short will be filmed on a Go pro video camera which will be shot in pov.



Jamie Hall: Jessie James Hall has always had a passion for all the arts, music, painting, sculptures, and above all cinema and film. As a child of only 10 years of age he was placed behind the camera for the first time when his grandfather, George Hall, purchased a V/H/S home video camera. Jessie found himself directing his action figures in various short films. Mr. Hall’s grandfather also influenced his artistic eye by introducing him to such horror greats as Alfred Hitchcock, Rod Sterling, and Vincent Price. As Jessie grew older he discovered many more directors such as Stanley Kubrick, The Cohen brothers, Martin Scorsese, David and Jennifer Lynch who influenced his style even more.

In his early 20’s Jessie did abandon film for a brief period to per sue his love for playing East Coast Hardcore and Punk style music.He was approached by the Bravo Channel to film pilot for a reality television show in titled “The List”. He has worked with other networks such as VH1 as Director of Photography for the Kita Williams reality show. It was there that he meet his soon to be best friend and business partner, J. Lazarus Hawk. The team of Hall and Hawk decided to join forces and operate the company Rising Fyre Productions.


Mr. Hawk better known as Laz in the Memphis film community was interested in a script that Jessie co-wrote and planned to direct titled “ Cold Blooded”. Filming for "Cold Blooded" commenced on January 19, 2012 and wrapped March 5, 2012. Cold Blooded was the first film Jessie ever premiered to the public. Met with rave reviews and heartfelt criticism, his first official short film inspired him to get started on his first feature length film. 


J. Lazarus Hawk:


In July, 1997, after spending a decade in Connecticut, Lazarus moved to Memphis, Tennessee, where he met film director Craig Brewer, who gave him his first opportunity to work in film. He played a drug dealer in Craig’s film “The Poor and Hungry.


Two years later, Craig served as Executive Producer on Lazarus’ film “The Morning Ritual,” which won the Hometowner Award at the 2001 Indie Memphis Film Festival for Narrative Short. “The Morning Ritual” also received a Darrell Award in 2002 from the Memphis Science-Fiction Association. In addition, the film was runner-up at the 2002 Nashville International Film Festival where, although not a winner, it was treated as a winner and delivered to and screened for the Directors’ Guild.

From there, Lazarus founded Rising Fyre Productions and proceeded to teach himself filmmaking by making films. In 2005 he produced “US,” a short film written by his older brother, which he eventually released in 2010. In 2008, he portrayed Ace in J. Michael McCarthy’s “Cigarette Girl.” Also in 2010, he wrote, produced, and directed a short film entitled “Words of a Father.”
Keith Goff:

﻿​Born Br​​​​​​ian Keith Goff in Grenada, Mississippi, on March 22, 1973. After graduating High School, Keith went to the Mississippi State Fire Academy and became a full-time employee with the local Fire Department. ​​​​

Keith then decided that he wanted to become a Police Officer and attended the Mississippi Law Enforcement Officer's Training Academy and went to work as a Police Officer. ​​​​​

He is presently employed as a Police Officer in the Fugitive/Warrant Division.​ Keith entered the film industry in 2011 after auditioning for a Feature Length Film entitled "Trey". Keith landed the lead role, as the main character (Trey). ​​​ 

Film 'Trey" was entered in the 2013 AOF International Film Festival, held in Pasadena, California, and won the category for Best Feature Film.  Since this award winning film, Keith's career has taken off landing him on a major production set with HBO/Cinemax in 2013.

This has opened many doors and opportunities for Keith to work with A-Lists celebrities and a well-known Director in the Film and TV Industry.

http://www.keithgoff.com/

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3565919/

Heather Denise 

           My name is Heather Denise. I am a model and actress from Memphis, Tn. I love modeling and acting they are my biggest passions. I enjoy the outdoors and new activities. I have experience in Runway, Ring Girl, Promotional work, Print, Commercial, Short Film, Music Videos, and Hosting/Spokesperson.

I am outgoing, professional, and enthusiastic. I strive to become a successful model and actress. I want to make extraordinary art for others to view for many years to  come.

-Heather-

https://www.facebook.com/HeatherDeniseModel




    What We Need & What You Get

    As stated above Rising Fyre Productions is currently seeking $3,000 for financing "Through The Eyes." Production will be total of 2 days production 12 hours per day.This will allow us to pay our actors, build set design, food, editing, and have some money set aside in case it is needed during production. Any and all money raised will go into a secure account for the film and withdrawn as needed. In the event that we do not raise our Finance goal that will not stop us from completing the film. We will go into production but will not be able to pay our actors and key members for there services. We hope in all costs that we will be able to give those who are deserving there due pay. If only a portion of our goal is raised we will still secure the funds in an account and withdraw as needed and complete the film with what we have. We want to give those who donated funds a completed product for what they could give us. 

    The Impact

    With more films today moving toward instant steaming outlets such as Netflix, itunes and Hulu, we plan on distributing "Through The Eyes" and "Coldblooded" together exclusively on amazon Instant Video and will be available for rent and purchase after the film as been completed. The success of "Coldblooded" came as a surprise to Rising Fyre Productions and everyone involved. With a special thank you to Bateman Underwood, lead actor of "ColdBlooded" for making it happen.


    Risks & Challenges

    As filmmakers we also must understand the reality of the business we are in. Investing in film is one of the most risky investments to make due to the unpredictability, and instability of the film business. A lot of things can go wrong and schedules can change at any moment. We cant guarantee that people will be lining up to see our film or see it at all but we are risk takers at heart and we go into every project we do with an open mind prepared for any challenge we must encounter. Our devoted production team and company members of Rising Fyre Productions move forward with hard work and persistence with any hurdles we may encounter and most importantly work as a team to solve problems in the jobs we do. It is hard work to make films but the reward of seeing our hard work on screen is well worth the effort not only to ourselves  but the ones who were willing to take a leap of faith with us along the way.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      We understand that not everyone can contribute financing and that is perfectly understandable. We are all trying our best to save what we can but that doesn't mean you cant help. We encourage you to help by talking to friends, family and people you may know to help us make this film. Promote on social media, blogs and fan sites to help us get the word out.

      Thank you
